story:
The Project!

  • Hi! My name's Oliver Waterman. I'm a singer/songwriter from Portland Maine
  • I've been playing out and writing music for over ten years, and this is my first studio recording! I couldn't be more excited to share it with the world!
  • But, to do that, I need your help! Everything's recorded, mixed, and mastered, but I still need to finish paying the studio, cover production costs, and properly release it.

What I Need, & What You Get!

  • I need $500 to finish paying the wonderful Penumbra Recordings for all their hard work, cover printing costs of the CD's, flyers, promo materials, and mailing costs. 
  • As a contributor you can get Pre-Release Downloads, CDs, and/or Guest List Spots for the CD Release Party and be VIP's! At least to me.

The Impact!

  • If you've seen me play over the years, then you know just how hard I've worked to be the musician that I am, and how long it's taken me to get to this point. 
  • If not, here's what I mean.  Ever since I started playing classical guitar 13 years ago, all I've done with my spare time is write music, and play shows. I realized that there was a "sound" that I wanted to experience that just didn't exist. So I've been working over the years trying make it real, and I believe I have!
  • This is my life, and my life's work, and it's just the beginning! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just cause you don't have cash doesn't mean you can't help. There are multiple ways of sharing this page on the interwebs! 

Tell your friends!

story:
Who is Orbit? What is Orbit's Tears?

I am Orbit. You are Orbit. We all have a piece of Orbit inside of us.

Orbit's Tears is a hip-hop/rock band from Chicago.  We are five members strong with many years of experience and a chemistry most bands would kill for.  

Our job is simple.  We tell the story of Orbit, those hiding in the shadows or under the thumb of oppression.  Our debut album tells the story of a young woman's journey to adulthood and the true struggles many children face in a world full of social brainwashing, violence, and the 'me' complex.  There is something in this album for everyone. 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need to raise and why:

  • We need to raise $10,000 to cover the final expenses of mastering and reproduction of our debut album and to cover most of our travel expenses for our 2015 tour. We have already combined all our our personal funds to cover all of the recording, mixing and distribution costs of the album.  We've also been able to generate about half our of tour travel cost.
  • Our perks are varied, just like your tastes. From great merch, to one of a kind experiences from each band member, to free shows! You're sure to find one that calls out to you.
  • If we do not reach our goal, all funding raised will be put directly to our album first.  After that, any additional funds will be banked towards our tour and we will continue gathering funding and adjusting our schedule as necessary.
  • If we surpass our goal, all additional funds will be donated to a local women's shelter in Chicago.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out about our campaign on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ranjani Krishnan. I am woman of Indian origin, who grew up in the middle-east and have spent the last 20 or so years in Portland, Oregon. I have been fortunate in my life to be able to absorb various genres of music in my journey through the world - Indian Classical, Flamenco, Balkan, North African, Jazz, Celtic, Country. The music I perform is a composite of all these genres and I want to be able to bring my music to life. 

I am also a composer who is also trying to bring to fruition some rare ideas like putting together Renaissance polyphony with the idea of Raga in Indian music and creating harmonies in the context of Ragas. All these ideas need resources and people to bloom. I am a high school teacher by day with humble means. In order to recruit musicians to work with me on anything innovative, requires that I offer them the time and funds to work with me as they are also trying to make a living with their existing repertoire. New music requires us to participate in experiments, learn from them so that we can can produce a shining final product. And no, it won't stop with a product, this vision will continue.

If you like what you hear, see some promise in my vision and can spare some funds, please check out the various fundraiser options and contribute according to your means. A local Portland natural beauty company, Echo, is offering gifts for various levels of contribution.

What We Need & What You Get

By contributing...

  • You would help to cover the costs of studio recording time.
  • You would help to cover the costs of musicians in the studio.
  • You would help to cover the costs of producing the album (design, artwork, printing, duplication, etc.) for it.

The Impact

You could play a crucial role in bringing to life a unique kind of music that can only be made here in Portland from all the local talent. My album will feature local musicians like Tarik Banzi, Gavin Bondy, Randy Porter, Martin Zarzar. The album will also feature Scottish bagpiper, Stuart Liddell.

Contribute and see how your patronage can change the face of music and Portland.

Risks & Challenges

  • Making an album of new music is a labor of love. CD sales and interest in this kind of music will, ultimately, determine the success of the venture.
  • This is a non-trivial financial risk for artist as well as backers. A lot of funds, time, energy and resources have gone into making the album and arranging this concert. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you like what you hear and you see value in this kind of music, please get the word out about this campaign by forwarding the video and the link to this site: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qnGj6gvviH8 
  • Come to my concert on August 29th, 2015 and ask your friends to go to the concert if you think they'll like my music http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/1995059
  • Check out and pass on the information at: http://creamofportland.com
  • Show your support by "liking" this work on: https://www.facebook.com/creamofportland

story:
The Cleftos are having an amazing year so far! In just this past semester we have had two great concerts in addition to performances at Cornell University, a fundraiser for Children's Miracle Network, Central Park, and even the White House! 

To celebrate, we are gearing up to record a brand new EP of some of our best songs of the year! If we reach our goal we will record 5 songs at $600 per song for recording, producing, and mastering. 

We truly appreciate all of your continued support and we are so excited to share our new music with you!

P.S. - Check out the 'Gallery' tab for some pictures and videos from our recent performances!

If we reach our goal we will record 5 songs at $600 per song for recording, producing, and mastering. We truly appreciate all of your continued support and we are so excited to share our new music with you!P.S. - Check out the 'Gallery' tab for some pictures and videos from our recent performances!

story:
Hello Everyone,

Thank you for taking the time to check out my campaign!  

Who?

Me... husband of one, father of five! 

What?

My goal is to professionally record an original Worship album.  "Run to Him," the song used in the video, is the first of 12 songs to be recorded.  "Run to Him" demonstrates the quality you can expect from the rest of the project.

When?

May of 2015 is the projected finish date.  

Where?

Thanks to two awesome friends, Shep Stacy and Brian Craddock, I am recording at The Cat Room Studio in Charlottesville, VA.  Brian (producer/songwriter/guitarist with Daughtry) owns this studio.   Shep (producer/songwriter) owns Stacy's Music. 

Why?

THE ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF CHRIST'S SUPREMACY IN ALL THINGS is the reason we worship.  Live Worship events are being scheduled around the "flow" of the project.  Corporate Worship is what I love most!  My prayer and utmost desire is that God will grant me many opportunities to proclaim HIS Worth as a direct result of this project. 

How?

Your contributions will cover musicians' fees, recording, mixing, mastering, artwork, and pressing of the CDs. This project has a total budget of $13,500-$15,500. Keep in mind that projects like this at major record labels can cost anywhere from $50,000 to $200,000 or more.

Estimated breakdown of Project expenses:

The Cat Room Recording Studio 15 days $500 /day $7,500.00 

Studio Drummer 2 Days $200/day $400.00  

Mixing 5 Days $500/day $2,500.00 

Engineering Fees $200/song 

Producer Fees $200/song 

Mastering $500.00

CD Distribution through CD Baby $100.00  

CD Production w/Full Color Jacket $2,500.00  

Total Production Costs $13,500.00 

Perks for Helping Make This Album Possible



Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone is in a position to donate financially.  You can still help us reach our goal by praying for the campaign and its purpose!

SPREAD THE WORD! 

Tell everyone you know about this exciting new project. Encourage your friends, family, and colleagues to participate.  You can even share straight to your Facebook, Twitter, and other social media!

A FINAL NOTE

Serving Jesus is my passion and this album is an amazing opportunity to do that. $15k is "the number" I need to get this job done well.  However, as a father and husband I have to provide for my family and creating music is a tough career to "earn a living."  If you feel so led to continue to donate, it will enable me to do things as simple as putting meals on the table.  Regardless of whether I meet that $15K goal or not, I will continue to serve my family and worship the Lord with this music.

Please email me directly with comments or questions, etc. Thank you in advance for your contribution which allows me to keep doing what I love after all these years.

Danny 

dcb@danielchafinbryant.com

story:
Short Summary

Aloha Friends,

First of all, we want to thank you for considering being a part of our venture. To us, just the fact that you've found your way here, means a great deal.

We are Philip Wikel and Peggy Johnson and we are publishers, musicians, photographers and writers on the island of Maui. Philip has had mild success as a musician with his band The Julian Day, he makes a living as a graphic designer and loves the Hawaiian Culture.

Peggy is a retired warrior and mother of three. Her background is in Law Enforcement, Gang mediation and intervention. She is also a Plant, animal, and human rights activist. She is an artist, a writer and is studying native American, Hawaiian, and Asian holistic medicine.

Philip Wikel is a five star (Midwest Book Review) novelist, a graphic designer and publisher who also dabbles in music and photography. He studied Comparative Literature at UC-Santa Cruz and his lifelong passion for words led him to write poetry, short stories, two novellas and journalistic pieces which have found readership in various forms of publication. He considers the high point of his writing career to be when he interviewed the musician Jack Johnson for Blue Edge magazine as it fused three of his favorite interests, music, surfing, and writing. After making 5 extended trips to surf on Maui, beginning in 1986, Phil finally decided to make the island his home in 2012. 

His motto: "Endeavoring to increase the moments of joy experienced through the arts."

Philip and Peggy reside at the Ka Hale A Ke Ola Homeless Resource Center/Homeless Shelter and are very hopeful of moving forward and outward.

Our intention is to establish a communication and resource network.

The campaign actually has three interlocking components. Firstly the Video Fest (which will be a weekly online broadcast) and will showcase diverse bands from around the world with Hawaiian Culture and music as it's centerpiece thusly perpetuating the Spirit of Aloha and create a worldwide bond between socially and politically conscious bands from around the world. We will also be working with the "Music is the Medicine" Foundation. Musicians in the festival include representatives from Portugal, India, Germany, The Phillipines, the UK, and various and sundry other parts of the world, including Texas.

Secondly there is our fledgling publication Mauisalt Magazine, a quarterly publication which we hope to use as a vehicle to: 

1. Promote Hawaiian Culture through its connection to the Ocean  

2. Promote the Video Fest and... 

3. Serve as an outreach for the many native people who have found themselves homeless on Maui and the Other Hawaiian Islands.

And thirdly, to help establish a warrior sanctuary (hopefully to be named the Queen Kaahumanu Center, given permission). 

We feel if we can't be part of the solution, then we are part of the problem. We've combined our gifts and visions to be activists for: Human Rights, The Land and The Sea, and The Hawaiian Culture which we honor and respect dearly. They our our hanai (adoptive) family.

We are working in collaboration with many non-profits on Maui, including the Homeless Alliance, Ka Hale A Ke Ola homeless resource center, and Maui School Garden Network. We need resources to assist us in helping these organizations through the success of the World Wide Video Fest and it's partner project Mauisalt Magazine. Together these things promote independent music and the music of Hawaii, a healthy ocean, artists in art and, in turn, promotes non-profits and other altruistic organizations that are beneficial to the islands and our planet as a whole as we will be featuring them both in the video fest and in the magazine.

Lastly, our greater goal is to eventually establish the aforementioned Kaahumanu Center, a place for education, healing, resources and a living facility for Hawaiians, veterans and others who suffer from PTSD and mental and emotional illnesses.

We've thus far garnered the support of Erin Fleming (CEO of Ka Hale A Ke Ola), Shelley Brown (Case Manager at Ka Hale A Ke Ola), Mike Zelko (Founder of See Farm) and Richard McDonald (US Department of Veteran Affairs). These people have been truly inspiring and instrumental on getting us on the right track.

What We Need & What You Get

$250 per week for operating expenses over the course of six months until both the Video Fest and it's sister publication Mauisalt Magazine become established. (For a total of $6,000 dollars). This is essentially seed money and grants us enough time to: obtain advertising support, pay at least part of the expenses of a part-time advertising salesperson and to gain momentum and get established as a center for indie music, Hawaiian Culture, and publishing, and altruism in the community.

$2,000 will go to printing the Premier Issue of Mauisalt Magazine (our main source of marketing for the Video Fest.

$300 for a color printer.

$500 for a professional camcorder for band interviews and special features, both for the Video Fest and the magazine website.

$1,000 for rented or donated transportation for distribution of the magazine.

$200 for hamburgers, fries, cokes and shoes.

We're happy to provide receipts and post them for all expenditures.

For a donation of $5.00 those with limited resources will receive a Mauisalt Magazine decal.

For $10.00 donors will receive an Audio CD of the the first Aloha Maui "Mixed Plate" Video Fest and a Mauisalt Magazine decal.

For a $25.00 donation donors will receive a DVD of the first Aloha Maui "Mixed Plate" Video Fest and a Mauisalt Magazine decal.

For a $50.00 donation donors will receive an Audio CD and DVD of the the first Aloha Maui "Mixed Plate" Video Fest, and a Mauisalt Magazine decal.

For a $100.00 donation donors will receive a Video Fest t-shirt, an Audio CD and DVD of the the first Aloha Maui "Mixed Plate" Video Fest, a Mauisalt Magazine decal.

For a $250.00 donation donors will receive a profile in our magazine, a spot in the Video Fest and all of the merchandise described above.

If we don't reach our goal we we will do our best with what we receive and hope for the best.

The Impact

The weekly Aloha Maui "Mixed Plate" Music Video Fest will showcase local hawaiian musicians, spread the word on the need to support, perpetuate and invigorate the Spirit of Aloha and Hawaiian Culture, and create a worldwide bond between bands from around the world.

Mauisalt Magazine will, among other things, promote sustainable organic agriculture, speak to the ancient connection between land and sea from the Hawaiian perspective, and provide information about resources for the homeless, and work in any way possible toward alleviating the epidemic of homelessness.

The Queen Kaahumanu Sanctuary will provide much needed healing, education, and other resources for veterans, displaced Hawaiians and others with PTSD and other mental illnesses.

Why We Can Do It

Philip has produced a national magazine (The Surfwriter's Quarterly) which performed better on the newsstand than nearly every other startup magazine carried by Warner International Periodicals.

Philip also volunteered for the Surfrider Foundation which was successful in returning a major local beach to its natural state. He's worked for Habitat for Humanity and the Hawaiian Wildlife Fund on Maui.

Peggy served on the Board of Directors for the Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals in Stanislaus County, California. She served on the Gang and Graffiti Task Force in Modesto, California. She also ran the Summer Youth Program in the capacity of Coordinator in Waterford, California.  She has coordinated fund raising benefits for The Eagles, The Lions and The Clampers (three community organizations). 

Peggy spent 14 years in Gang Outreach & Intervention. 

Peggy has also worked for Habitat for Humanity, is currently volunteering for Grow The Change, and the Maui School Garden Network.

Risks & Challenges

Both the Music and Publishing industries are highly competitive, however, we feel strongly that with a little seed money and our combined experience we can overcome any of the obstacles that might present themselves. The verbal interest in both the magazine and the Video Fest has been fantastic, inspiring, and will continue to grow. We have in place a network of people who are also interested in the success of both of these ventures.

With regard to the Queen Kaahumanu Sanctuary the major challenge will be securing a lease and donations. We've found the perfect property for the sanctuary at a cost of $2,000 per month. We're working with both the realtor for, and owner of, the property, with the hope of coming to a mutually beneficial arrangement which include a reduced rent. Philip receives money from freelance graphic design work and Peggy has her hand in two other small, reliable forms of income. 

We are passionate people who will give our all to this multifaceted venture. We are likely to put in 10-12 hour days until we gain the momentum needed to see this through to its fruition.

We've both experienced various forms of adversity throughout our lives and feel we are now uniquely qualified to not only succeed, but to thrive.

As mentioned previously, we have a network of friends and colleagues who will freely advise, promote and support us in all we do.

Other Ways You Can Help

Those of you who are not financially able to support us can help by sharing our campaign with your friends and family via email, social media, word-of-mouth.

Indiegogo itself provides share tools!

These people have been truly inspiring and instrumental on getting us on the right track.What We Need & What You Get$250 per week for operating expenses over the course of six months until both the Video Fest and it's sister publication Mauisalt Magazine become established. (For a total of $6,000 dollars). This is essentially seed money and grants us enough time to: obtain advertising support, pay at least part of the expenses of a part-time advertising salesperson and to gain momentum and get established as a center for indie music, Hawaiian Culture, and publishing, and altruism in the community.$2,000 will go to printing the Premier Issue of Mauisalt Magazine (our main source of marketing for the Video Fest.$300 for a color printer.$500 for a professional camcorder for band interviews and special features, both for the Video Fest and the magazine website.$1,000 for rented or donated transportation for distribution of the magazine.$200 for hamburgers, fries, cokes and shoes.We're happy to provide receipts and post them for all expenditures.For a donation of $5.00 those with limited resources will receive a Mauisalt Magazine decal.For $10.00 donors will receive an Audio CD of the the first Aloha Maui "Mixed Plate" Video Fest and a Mauisalt Magazine decal.For a $25.00 donation donors will receive a DVD of the first Aloha Maui "Mixed Plate" Video Fest and a Mauisalt Magazine decal.For a $50.00 donation donors will receive an Audio CD and DVD of the the first Aloha Maui "Mixed Plate" Video Fest, and a Mauisalt Magazine decal.For a $100.00 donation donors will receive a Video Fest t-shirt, an Audio CD and DVD of the the first Aloha Maui "Mixed Plate" Video Fest, a Mauisalt Magazine decal.For a $250.00 donation donors will receive a profile in our magazine, a spot in the Video Fest and all of the merchandise described above.If we don't reach our goal we we will do our best with what we receive and hope for the best.The ImpactThe weekly Aloha Maui "Mixed Plate" Music Video Fest will showcase local hawaiian musicians, spread the word on the need to support, perpetuate and invigorate the Spirit of Aloha and Hawaiian Culture, and create a worldwide bond between bands from around the world.Mauisalt Magazine will, among other things, promote sustainable organic agriculture, speak to the ancient connection between land and sea from the Hawaiian perspective, and provide information about resources for the homeless, and work in any way possible toward alleviating the epidemic of homelessness.The Queen Kaahumanu Sanctuary will provide much needed healing, education, and other resources for veterans, displaced Hawaiians and others with PTSD and other mental illnesses.Why We Can Do ItPhilip has produced a national magazine (The Surfwriter's Quarterly) which performed better on the newsstand than nearly every other startup magazine carried by Warner International Periodicals.Philip also volunteered for the Surfrider Foundation which was successful in returning a major local beach to its natural state. He's worked for Habitat for Humanity and the Hawaiian Wildlife Fund on Maui.Peggy served on the Board of Directors for the Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals in Stanislaus County, California. She served on the Gang and Graffiti Task Force in Modesto, California. She also ran the Summer Youth Program in the capacity of Coordinator in Waterford, California.  She has coordinated fund raising benefits for The Eagles, The Lions and The Clampers (three community organizations). Peggy spent 14 years in Gang Outreach & Intervention. Peggy has also worked for Habitat for Humanity, is currently volunteering for Grow The Change, and the Maui School Garden Network.Risks & ChallengesBoth the Music and Publishing industries are highly competitive, however, we feel strongly that with a little seed money and our combined experience we can overcome any of the obstacles that might present themselves. The verbal interest in both the magazine and the Video Fest has been fantastic, inspiring, and will continue to grow. We have in place a network of people who are also interested in the success of both of these ventures.With regard to the Queen Kaahumanu Sanctuary the major challenge will be securing a lease and donations. We've found the perfect property for the sanctuary at a cost of $2,000 per month. We're working with both the realtor for, and owner of, the property, with the hope of coming to a mutually beneficial arrangement which include a reduced rent. Philip receives money from freelance graphic design work and Peggy has her hand in two other small, reliable forms of income. We are passionate people who will give our all to this multifaceted venture. We are likely to put in 10-12 hour days until we gain the momentum needed to see this through to its fruition.We've both experienced various forms of adversity throughout our lives and feel we are now uniquely qualified to not only succeed, but to thrive.As mentioned previously, we have a network of friends and colleagues who will freely advise, promote and support us in all we do.Other Ways You Can HelpThose of you who are not financially able to support us can help by sharing our campaign with your friends and family via email, social media, word-of-mouth.Indiegogo itself provides share tools!

story: We have been laboring to earn money to record an album and pay for studio time. Anyone who knows anything about the industry knows it can be brutal. The talent is there. The heart is there. But, in all honesty, a good product is expensive. We are perfectionists, the lot of us. This is a dream. Music is hard work. Anybody who tells you differently has never given it a go. Writing is hard. There are so many opinions among just the four of us, let alone the masses. The best part, at the end of the day, is that we genuinely care about and love one another. This makes all that work worthwhile and helps me to keep on keepin' on. Please help our band, The Working Stiffs, fund our debut album, FLAT BROKE.

The best part, at the end of the day, is that we genuinely care about and love one another. This makes all that work worthwhile and helps me to keep on keepin' on. Please help our band, The Working Stiffs, fund our debut album, FLAT BROKE.

story: CNY Rock Productions wants to go all out this year with our third anniversary party!  We're already letting YOU, the fans, choose which local bands play the show and we need some help with the financial aspects of everything.  The more we raise the bigger and better the prizes will get for the winning bands!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Tawana Ross. I've been involved with ministry and  music for several years.  I've traveled throughout the globe and I am very grateful. Throughout this journey  I've received numerous awards and the passion continues to increase. Everything I've done, everything I've seen, all my past and present experiences have prepared  me for where I am right now.

Over the past few years I have recorded three full length albums and 1 LP.  In addition to featuring on numerous projects. The track record achievements consist of numerous awards and concert invitations ranging from small group to large arenas. 

What We Need & What You Get

There are a lot of expenses that goes into recording, mixing, traveling and making product available for everyone. So what I'm asking is for you to consider helping fund this project. 

The goal for this project is $3500.00. I truly believe in investing in yourself which is why the campaign goal for this project is very low. 

All the funds contributed will go to

·  Traveling

·  Videos

·  Marketing

·  Promotions

·  Duplication

·  Shipping and handling

·  Free give-aways

·  Flyers

Campaigning beyond the goal is a excellent thing.  Releasing a quality project and having it available is very important. 

The Impact

The objective is to ignite, energize, empower and motivate lives through music.  My life is the best mic I can have. Through the words and the music an impactful sound will be heard worldwide. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand some people just can't contribute which is okay.  Even if you cannot contribute financially your prayers is definitely needed.   You can also tell your friends and share the campaign.  Use the Indiegogo social media share tools but most of all pray.  Prayer is a necessity.

story:
I'm a Brooklyn-based singer/songwriter originally from Canton, OH. My sound is Stevie Nicks meets Lauryn Hill meets Sade - all huge influences in my music. I released my debut EP "The FALL" September 2014 and have been touring since!

I'm raising money to pay for airfare and a hotel room for myself and my 3 band members to get to LA for a show we have on Wednesday, June 3rd at The Mint!

It's been amazing to be able to pursue music as a career and I'm so thankful to everyone who purchased a CD, has come to a show and supported me in any way.

Please help me and my band make it to LA for our first ever concert on the West Coast. All monies will go towards booking airfare and a hotel room for myself, bassist Blake Walker, guitarist Tom Senatore and drummer Raphael Washington.

Based in LA?

Come out and see me as well! I'd love to meet all who donated and helped make this show happen: http://themintla.com/event.cfm?id=200890&cart.

Based in NY?

Come hang out with me at Rockwood Music Hall on Wednesday May 20th! I'm performing on Stage 3 at 10pm: http://www.ticketfly.com/event/809781.

story:
The Project and the Musician

In 2009, Matt Starling (formerly Matt Dixon) founded the Salt Lake Electric Ensemble, an electronic music performing group with acoustic touches. The group of 8 artists initially came together to perform American composer Terry Riley's classic 1964 minimalist composition In C, marking the first time the score had been approached primarily with electronic instruments. Under Starling's direction, the ensemble went on to turn heads in the contemporary art music community with the 2010 release of their recording of the piece, which earned critical praise throughout North America and Europe:

"[The Salt Lake Electric Ensemble's recording of In C] is nothing short of a revelation. . . . [It's] already the most important addition to the discography since the premiere recording, and will likewise be recognized as part of a performance tradition that is a vital and remarkably apt expression of the present cultural moment."

-Dr. Rob Haskins, Writing for American Record Guide,

Associate Professor of Music, University of New Hampshire

Now, Starling seeks to publish another recording of a score by Riley. On the 50th anniversary of its composition, Starling has completed work on Dorian Reeds, a composition for solo performer, microphone. two tape recorders and playback. 

The piece has only been recorded with soprano saxophone performers up until this point. Starling, a brass instrumentalist since childhood, has now recorded the score using a flugelhorn. Its warm, captivating tone and its depth of sound when layered according to the instructions in the score has yielded a recording of the piece unlike any other. 

While this particular piece had previously been approached mainly through live performance, Starling chose to produce the music over the course of several months in the recording studio. This allowed him to leverage several powerful music technologies including high resolution digital audio (24 Bits/96 KHZ), sophisticated computer audio editing, digital signal processing, and precision mixing tools. The result is pure hypnotic minimalism, with a pulsating and constantly evolving texture.

Matt Starling holds a Bachelor of Music degree from the University of Utah in Salt Lake City, and a Master of Music Technology degree from IUPUI in Indianapolis, IN. Commissioned performances with the Salt Lake Electric Ensemble have included the Utah Arts Festival, the University of Utah, Brigham Young University, IUPUI, Music at Main (Salt Lake City Public Library), and the Salt Lake Arts Council's Brown Bag Concert Series (2010-2013). He is also active as a music journalist, music educator, audio engineer, and composer. Watch for Starling's first ambient composition to be published in the summer of 2015.


Needs and Rewards

  • Your generous donation will allow Starling to manufacture CDs, secure international digital distribution, and will provide general operating support during the release of this project.
  • All donations will grant the donor a copy of the album with album art included.
  • If the funding goal is not met, Starling will make do with the funds available and deliver all perks on schedule. The album may be released on CD-R discs instead of professionally replicated CDs, depending on funding.

The Impact

  • There are only two existing recordings of this score, and neither explore instrumental timbres outside the saxophone family.
  • Your donation will help build a recorded history of American music in the postwar period, and will allow the recording to be distributed worldwide. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Link to this campaign on social media sites.
  • Inform people who might have interest in this project.

story:
What Are We Asking? 

  • For fans and supporters to help the Phunky Monkeys transcend from a regional New Orleans band to a National Corporate Party Band by making a crowdfunding contribution to support the band in purchasing:  (1) an LED video wall and stands; (2) intelligent light fixtures; (3) a 22 foot cargo truck; (4) studio recording and video recording time; and (5) new wardrobes for the band.  
Why Are We Asking? 
  • The typical New Orleans party band has 6 to 8 musicians using basic light and sound production while performing a variety of cover tunes from different genres of music.  Right now, the Phunky Monkeys is one of the most requested New Orleans party bands.  And now, we want to grow . . . expand . . . take our dynamic show national so we can bring the Phunky Monkeys to cities everywhere.  Yet, to be a successful national corporate party band, we need a higher level of production with more lights, high-quality sound, and wardrobe.  We've got the musicians and the talent, now we need the gear.  The band's founders, Michael J. Taylor and Arthur Thomas, have already invested over $100,000 to get the band to its current level.  We are on cusp of crossing to the next level . . . and frankly, we just need some help to get us there.  We have already performed several national gigs (i.e. the NFL Holiday Party, Super Bowl XLIV) and consistently receive overwhelming positive praise but to stay and expand in the national market we must augment our production.  
Who Are We Asking? 
  • Our fans, friends, and family in our various networks who want to support us in large, medium or small amounts.  We figured we'd give this new, organic way of raising capital a shot as people are always asking about ways that they can support us.  
When Are We Asking? 
  • Starting . . . NOW!  We are launching with a Mardi Gras Showcase in Atlanta, Georgia on February 17th at the Suite Lounge on 375 Luckie Street Northwest.  Our incredible supporters in Atlanta - Marc Taylor and Lacrecia Cade - are hosting a private showcase for our expanding fan base in Atlanta to check us out and show us some support.  Our goal is to raise this money in 45 days so that in 2015 we can enter this new era.  But we want to reach out to all our fans in New Orleans, Baton Rouge, Biloxi, New York . . . everywhere to be an instrumental part of making the Phunky Monkeys EVEN PHUNKIER!!!  
Even if you can't contribute dollars, you can: 
  • Get the word out by sharing our campaign through your social networking tools; 
  • Help spread the word about the Band.

story:
Music, is a universal language that can change the way people think, and may be the only tool that can bring about a sustainable world peace. Jazz music has a tradition of breaking down barriers, uniting people from foreign lands and initiating a healthy, positive dialogue between cultures from around the world. During my studies at Berklee College of Music, and career as a professional pianist, I have met and played with musicians from all over the United States, Mexico, Brazil, Canada, the Caribbean, England, Italy, Germany, Russia, Turkey, China, Japan, South Korea, Pakistan, Egypt, Greece, West Africa, India, Bangladesh, Nepal, Australia, and Taiwan. Music in my life has served as a tool for connecting with people, ideas, and cultures from all over the world, and has changed my perspective to see people from all nations and backgrounds as my brothers and sisters in the human family.  I am now trying to spread this understanding and awareness through the power of music with my group of international musicians, Unidentified Fusion Orangement, to Japan, which has recently undergone many traumatic disasters and has been receptive to jazz music through hosting International Jazz Day in 2014. Jazz music has been the voice of freedom since it’s creation in the early 20th century for over a million peole in the United States and around the globe. Jazz music is the perfect tool for cultural diplomacy because it values diversity, welcomes new ideas, encourages responsibility, sincerity, and fosters both inner reflection and communal interaction. It is the perfect language for uniting people from foreign lands and serving as a bridge between cultures, belief systems, and ideologies.

               Beginning from July 15th 2015, I will be taking my musical group on a two week cultural outreach program to Japan to demonstrate the ability of jazz music to bring people together from around the world and have a positive impact on a foreign nation. The group will consist of Berklee students from around the world: Alexander Anderson from San Diego, California playing piano and synthesizer, Connor Steck from Portage, Wisconsin playing soprano saxophone, Tomoki Sanders from Irabaki, Japan playing tenor saxophone, Will Lyle from Orange County, California on the electric bass, and Juan Chiavassa from Santa Fe, Argentina playing percussion. We plan on conducting clinics at local music schools, perform seminars at music manufacturing companies, host jam sessions inviting local musicians, conducting musical therapy sessions at special needs facilities, and performing in concert halls and jazz clubs to promote the ideas of intercultural exchange and understanding through improvised music.

  In order to fulfill the intentions of this cultural outreach program, we require appropriate funding to cover the cost of transportation, lodging, food, and promotions. Five round trip tickets from Boston to Tokyo will cost $6,000, two weeks of lodging for the five of us will cost around $2,000, and two weeks for food and other miscellaneous expenses is going to be around $2,000. This does not factor in the cost of documenting the events in the form of audio/video recordings. In total, a minimum of $10,000 must be raised to cover the bare expenses of this cultural outreach program. We are only asking for the amount to cover the plane tickets. Any organizations, donors, or government agencies that may be able to sponsor this program are essential, and is a primary goal of ours. Any events, workshops, or receptions that we as a group can take part in to demonstrate the effect, impact, and reality of our undertaking are more than welcome to reach out to me personally. Please assist us in reaching the blossoming community of Japan!

Schedule:

·  7/15 Departure from Boston, MA – Osaka, Japan

·  7/16 Arrival in Osaka, Japan

·  7/17 Evening performance at “Nu Things” Osaka

·  7/17 Rhythm Section/Improvisation workshop at “Apple Guitars” Kobe

7/18 Daytime clinic at Koyo Conservatory of Music's "Maiden Voyage" Kobe followed by evening performance. 

·  7/21 Evening performance at “Always Umeda” Osaka

·  7/22 – Daytime woodwind clinic at “Apple Guitars” Evening performance at “Pine Farm” Kobe

·  7/23 Travel from Kansai area to Tokyo; Evening performance at “Babel Rock Tower” Tachikawa, Tokyo

·  7/24 Evening performanceat “Absolute Blue” Tokyo

·  7/25 Nightime performance at “Electrik Jinja” Tokyo

·  7/27 Evening Performance at “Basement Bar” Tokyo

·  7/28 Evening performance at “Anti Knock” Tokyo

·  7/29 Evening performance at “KD Hapon” Nagoya

·  7/30 Depart from Osaka – Boston

·  8/1 Arrival in Boston


http://www.alexanderandersonmusic.com/japan

Evening performance at “Babel Rock Tower”
Tachikawa, Tokyo

·  7/27 Evening Performance at “Basement Bar” Tokyo

story:
About Me

Last summer, I moved across the country from Atlanta, Georgia to Bend, Oregon to teach music full-time at a local arts-oriented preschool.  Having attempted to freelance in Atlanta for several years, it was refreshing to have a full-time position doing something I love - playing music with children.  Having never been to the PNW before, it was certainly a bit of an adjustment.  Moving cross-country definitely has its challenges.  But being surrounded by the incredibly beautiful natural environment here has been quite therapeutic, invigorating, and inspiring.

In March, after reading about how time isn't really linear, I got the idea to write a song about time and how we really only have the present moment.  I thought about how precious life is...and fragile...how it can change in the blink of an eye.  This song, Kingdoms, ended up touching on the Boston Marathon in a very poignant way.  

"Sometimes we are interrupted,

Sometimes we trade in our glory,

For  a moment of grace."

Starting in March, I have written 10 new songs and continue to write.  But what is amazing, is that several of these songs, have come out of deep empathy for people who have been lost in incredibly heartbreaking events.  After having written just a few songs over the past several years, I have found this ability here in Central Oregon to write, not just one, but several exquisitely beautiful songs to honor these souls who have passed on.  

One of the songs, "Rain Makes the Flowers Grow", was written in memory of a child killed at Sandy Hook.   Then in May, I found out Atlanta musician and activist, Frank Barham, had been killed in a traffic accident while on a  300 mile journey to Savannah by wheelchair.  This struck me very deeply...barely a week later I wrote the song "The Road to Savannah", which was inspired by Frank's journey and the deeper soul-searching mission he was on, to banish his own demons, and to help others.  

Just this past week (today is June 29th), I wrote a song, "Black Sun", to honor the victims who died at the Emanual AME Church in Charleston, SC.  Too often, the attention shifts away from the victims in these tragedies.  I want to bring the focus to them, and how beautiful they were - their essence, their souls. 

In writing these songs, I have found that I have a real gift to create music that is healing, exquisite, and powerful.  I am so in touch with my muse here and really feel tuned in!  I am writing the best songs I have ever written!  Having been writing/singing/playing for 30+ years, I am creating the album that I have always wanted to create!  I am working with an incredible producer and have already done the bulk of the recording.  These songs are sounding phenomenal and I have never believed in anything more than I do this project!

Perhaps, I am able to relate to these people and their tragedies because I have had my own demons and emotional turmoil to overcome.  Beautiful Things, the title track, is about my own journey to Oregon, and the transformation that we all go through.  The cover photo, of the reflection in the stream off of the Metolius River, I took on Easter Sunday this year...how symbolic is that?!

Beautiful Things (c)2015 Victor Johnson

We cast off from the shore
We sojourn into the rocky sea
Dim light through the rain
Sullen storm clouds seeking company
When the day is young
The thunder makes the morning cry
We look to the sun
Angels who’ve forgotten how to fly

We will carry on,
Love will come to us all.

We craved a love supreme
We sailed on merrily down the stream
But when our world was lost
We remembered life is but a dream
And so we stayed our course
Though our hearts were broken and blue
I closed my eyes to quell
The storm inside me, inside you

We will carry on,
Love will come to us all

We found our wishing well
I threw my cards down to see
The way the wind might blow
The beautiful things we might be
Then we spread our wings out wide
We floated beneath the silent moon
Making our way back home
Gone so long, but leaving so soon

We will carry on,
Love will come to us all.

This album, Beautiful Things, is dedicated to Ma Jaya Sati Bhagavati who taught me how important it is to love, to be kind, and to serve others.

The Gist

I am already 75% of the way through with recording.  14 songs!  I need to complete the recording, mixing, and mastering process...and then the manufacturing and promotion of the finished product, Beautiful Things!  I am seeking to raise at least $6000 to fund this process.  In addition to preordering the album, you can receive a private house-concert, an original song written for you, autographed CDs, one of a kind lyric sheets/books, and more...

The Impact

I have always had this natural, intuitive ability to write songs that sing of the sun, moon, trees, rivers and other images of the natural world.  I use unusual chords that take subtle shifts from major to minor.  I have been told that I write astonishingly beautiful songs.  I have always been motived by a deep sense of empathy and love.  And I have realized, here in Oregon,  that I have an opportunity to create some real healing with my music.  Music heals. Music is powerful.  With your help, I can complete my project and release "Beautiful Things", and honor Ana Marquez-Greene, Frank Barham, and the departed souls in Boston and Charleston.   This is my legacy and what I was born to do.  I only receive funding if I reach my goal of $6000, so your contribution is so important.

The world needs quality music that is handmade, organic, natural, original, and beautiful.  This is all of that and more.  I studied Reiki in Atlanta at the Kashi Yoga Ashram, all the way through to a level 3 Reiki master.  I like to think that I do Reiki through my music.

Risks & Challenges

I don't foresee any risks.  I am rising to the challenge!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with everyone!  Facebook, twitter, email, friends, word of mouth... This is my moment to shine and this whole project is guided by so much love.  THANK YOU VERY MUCH!  

Support http://www.sandyhookpromise.org/

http://www.charleston-sc.gov/index.aspx?NID=1330 (The Mother Emanuel Hope Fund)

story:
Short Summary

After four seasons on the decade’s long reality show Dog the Bounty Hunter, Justin Bihag makes a decision to launch his musical career.  Justin’s single Fly Away is being released June 22nd along side the launch of his crowd funding campaign to glean the support of fans around the world.   This first album contains music from himself and his partner Oso with his heart felt impressionistic flows.  The project seeks to engage youth and connect on an emotional level while embracing life to the fullest, responsibly.  Justin recently engaged in a law suit with the franchise and A&E claiming that the show capitalized on his hardships and loss of his leg.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are in need of $25,000 to fully launch our first national campaign.  These funds go to pay for:

 $1,500 merchandise 

$2,500 video production

$1,200 CD printing

$1,500 Radio Campaign

$2,400 Publicity 

$10,000 National Tour Expenses (Vehicle,TM, Stage Production, Hotel)

$5,000 for Misc Tour Marketing (Advertising, Print Materials, Gasoline)

The Impact

Justin and his musical partner Oso Menace plan to speak to inner city youth on their inaugural tour about personal integrity and the dangers of pharmaceutical medications and alcohol addiction.  Justin’s own battles with losing his leg in 2007 during season 4 of Dog the Bounty Hunter lead to his own battles with pain killers.  He has changed and improved his situation and wants to spread that message of internal strength, persistence and change to youth everywhere.  “We make decisions and encounter circumstances that we feel will break us, we want to fly away.  When we face ourselves and act like the person we want to be we change the world,” Justin says.

Risks & Challenges

The challenge is that the music industry has a life of its own and we need fans to support this new age of music.  Touring is expensive, video production is expensive and we have exhausted our lawsuit with dog and have literally become an underdog.  We need your help to show the big guys that its the fans that support the music.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please visit the fan site for more information at https://www.reverbnation.com/justinjbleezybihag  and the crowd funding campaign at http://igg.me/at/flyaway

Account Manager

Josh Ogletree

 (720) 451-1423

jogletree@whisperfiercely.com

Booking

Melissa Lycan

(720) 933-4868

Melissa@whisperfiercely.com

Publicist

Erin Perkins

(520) 255-1472

eperkins@whisperfiercely.com

story:
Short Summary

We're Beneath The Machine, a four piece metal band from Massachusetts. We've been recording an 18 track album, and it's costing a lot more than we thought it would. That's where you come in! We're offering some sweet stuff for anybody who helps us finish this album!

Here's a sample of what it's going to sound like:


What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $2000 to finish the album. In return for this, you'll get the album, and more, including:

  • T-shirts!
  • A chance to perform with the band
  • Some of our equipment used in the recording process


We want to finish this album and release it to the public, but we really want to survive as people while doing so. Every donation means the world to us, and we really hope that you'll like our album.

About us

We are a young metal band out of Massachusetts, and this album has been a huge dream of ours for years. We used to be a six piece band, but since our forming, two of our members have quit to pursue other endeavors. We have paid for the entire process up until now out of pocket. As for a  group of twenty-somethings with their first full-time jobs, it's taking a lot out of us. We want to provide backers and our fans with top quality music and products. You can listen to our music on our Bandcamp page, and if you want to hear more, please consider donating.

Other Ways You Can Help

Check out our social media platforms!
Facebook
YouTube
Bandcamp
Twitter: @BTM_Mass
Instagram: @beneaththemachine

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to my indiegogo campaign. I am Tru Advicate, a Christian Hip Hop Artist.  I am trying to raise the money to properly record and promote a new album for Christ to build God's kingdom.

In October 2014 I released a mixtape for people to download free. The mixtape was well received but only went so far because of the lack of funds to record it and promote it properly.

This album represents two things that is very important to me and very important to what I believe are the needs of this world. I believe that art as a whole is important to this world, specifically music.  I am a Christian man and I believe that people are loking for good, clean music that they can play with their children and families.  Music that is hot and music that makes you think.  Music with morals.  Music you can talk to your friends about. This is so important to me because music is taken for granted. So, I want to take good music and use it spread the gospel of Christ which tends to be either ignored or taken for granted.

Any artist will tell you that sometimes creating and distributing your art properly can be very expensive. The need for money is often exploited by those that feel they can profit from the art that the artists have created. Some join a corporate structure that will dictate your creation to maximize the potential of making money. Others will break the law or sell their art short to obtain the money they need to properly do their art. A true artist is so passionate about their art that they will do almost anything to be able to express themselves through their art properly.

Anyone that knows me knows that I hate asking someone for money. But the Holy Spirit has led me ask for support from the people that will either enjoy my art, grow from my art, or feel good knowing that someone else may be making positive changes in their lives as a result of Christ shining through my art. I am a hardworking musician who works 40 hours a week on my day job, drive a Honda, and support my wife and children.  I live a simple life and am not asking for support of a lavish lifestyle or ideals.  By contributing to my campaign, you are contributing to help potentially save an unlimited amount of souls while providing music you can rock to or relax to. What I want you to know most of all, is saving souls for the Glory of Christ is my number one objective.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will go to studio time to record the album, then getting the album properly mixed and mastered, making two professional videos for two singles, strategic promotion for the videos of the two singles, promoting the album, and getting the album distributed through online channels such as iTunes, Amazon, CD baby etc. etc.

We have some very exciting perks that I hope will excite you as much as it excites me. I am really looking forward to Skype with donors and getting a chance to thank you personally and to get any feedback or anything that you may want to say to me.

If I don't reach my goal, I will record the album and then mix and master it because nothing else matters if I do not have an album to promote. Then I will adjust my marketing plan budget to maximize the remaining funds that I have available to me.

riences 

The Impact

Let's be honest: Artists have put music in the hands of the large, major labels and the labels have released music that have been letting us down for years. They are not concerned with making good music but only concerned with making music that can push whatever product will make them the most money. 

By contributing to campaigns like mine, it gives you the power to say that you made a contribution to good music getting out in the world at a time when the world is starving for quality music. I truly believe that your contribution is a contribution to music that can offset the nonsense that is being popped into the atmosphere today. 

So many of our life experiences is tied to the memory of food, smells, and songs.  Why not tie your memories (and those of your children) to positive music for your soul instead of violent, profane, or stripper music?  Everyone comes for somewhere and I do not judge.  But shouldn't there be room made for the positive alternatives??? And shouldn't we support those artists keeping it clean?

Tru Advicate wants to bring music in this world that is hotter than hot, realer than real, and makes you ponder on life.  The impact of the music is changing minds, touching hearts, and enriching lives. 

Risks & Challenges

Any time you step out to try to do something there are risks and hurdles involved. The secret to my success in anything I have ever done was that I paid no attention to risk or hurdles. I am able to do this because I try to always be led by Christ.  I believe He will remove any hurdles from my path so that now I don't even have to jump them or go around them, I just walk right through.

Other Ways You Can Help

I would also appreciate it if you sent out your prayers for the success of my album and any other album by any other artists that is trying to represent Christ and spread his Gospel. You can also help by spreading the word of my campaign to others. I want to save souls.I want to bring clean music of substance for family and friends to enjoy. Regardless if you like the music, understand that every tool for Christ can be used to save souls and influence positive change. Look at it this way: the brick layer may not like the plumber but they are both necessary to building a house properly. That home can go on and become a refuge for a home for a loving family.

Your contributions in all forms are greatly appreciated praise God and God bless

story:
First off, THANK YOU, for stopping by! 

I will be available always to answer questions personally                                    
Email me at frankfishrub@gmail.com Subject “Ceph” and i will 
respond with a call if you wish or an email.
I am Frank “I.O.” Ferrante, I go by I.O. and I call myself an artist, but foremost I am a cosmic adventurer, trying to live to the fullest each day and create as many awesome things as the great Universe has for me to do! 
At the moment I have stepped into the most progressive ride in music and art and it is the internet! I am very active in the art community on Facebook, Patreon which is my office i suppose, and now on Soundcloud and on Bandcamp.  I basically am a “Busker”, a street performer sharing my world on the largest street in history!

“As I follow in the footsteps of the “ Godfathers” of this art form I am tempted, no, I am compelled to blaze new paths and find new adventure!” …I.O. 

This is the newest addition to this experience!
“I am using bits of the past and futuristic sounds to create a new experience and direction for music…”…i.o.
I love to create music, paintings, sculpture, film and more… I work often, with plastic 5 gallon water jugs as drums, a keyboard which is missing major notes, I work in a garage studio with no air conditioning so the paintings are often ruined by weather, and my art supplies are donated from neighbors and friends or found in refuse piles in good neighborhoods. I want to do more with my skills and it is often frustrating being limited by my tools. 

BUT, these setbacks or obstacles don’t stop my creations from coming to life. I just want to make bigger, better, and more epic art. 
I can do this with your support!

OK HERES THE CREATION!

“The Cephalopod”(basically a head with arms)

A MUSICAL INSTRUMENT CREATION OF MY OWN DESIGN! 

A percussive instrument composed of plastic water jugs and made to produce unique and strange music! 

The whole setup is similar to a guitarists rig and is accented by musically integrated lighting!

A show of light and music and sound to be experienced!
This is proving to be a little pricy to get started but is doable and will be epic. 
I wish to take the idea out and perform and promote the ways we can help the planet out. Plastics are a literal plague, no pun intended. One liter to one gallon of water is used to make one shopping bag at the grocery and departments stores!  We are in a water crisis and over run with plastics from the Mariana Trench, to the highest mountain peaks, even in orbit!  So I try to inform folks when i can. 

This new creation would allow me to launch live performances via webcast and podcast and as well broadcast live performances from wherever I am, for free, to all of you!  I always strive to be forthright and open and I dream of creating  an awesome network of ART and friends and fans of progressive ideas! 

 With this new experience, I believe this will something worth tuning in for! 

I.O. stands for 
“I owe someone, something, somewhere.”
This idea I have can be made smaller and personalized like a guitar and effects pedals and used on a plastic cup or a water jug!  And be made affordable so as  to be enjoyed by musicians and curious folks everywhere! 

My Latest Project is titled 
“The Earth Lives Within The Universe” 
composed and performed by me 
on a 5 gallon plastic water jug 
and edited in Final Cut Film Software 
so, it is very unconventional at the core.
Please Enjoy!  


Inspiration for this instrument comes from Mickey Hart from the Grateful Dead and his “R.A.M.U.” also known as

“RANDOM ACCESS MUSICAL UNIVERSE "

Ok so here it is in big print! I want to share all of the details and will update if new ones arise.  I hope to acquire a Drum Trigger Module and Triggers, this will run from the 200 - 300 dollar range for the model I believe will be adequate. And proves to be one of the pricier items on the list.  As I shop around, I hope to even get better equipment. I’m not looking to be greedy, just have at least the adequate tools as not to make this a half assed endeavor. 

Once this is running it will evolve! Ideas will come and the experience with grow better and more noticed! 


The other items include a bass amplifier and treble amplifier, cords, effects pedals, and microphones adding up to about 400 dollars.  I have been shopping around a want to get the most bang for the buck! The better the mixing hardware, the better the overall experience becomes and the amplifiers will be in that same category.

I am looking to be portable and sensory shocking, and the amazing sound operated lights will be about $20 a piece. Each drum having a light reacting to the vibrations like the brainwaves within our neural networks! These will respond to the music ands offer a thrilling light show entertaining crowds or playing with the band this will be magic like a Disney parade! 

This video is NASA footage edited by me and the audio arrangement is done with Final Cut Pro X Film Editing Software. With the new equipment I will be able to create experiences similar to this in real time rather than in post production.  All of this is performed on a plastic 5 gallon water jug. 

This video is GoPro Camera footage edited as sort of a promo for my “Patreon Street Performance life.” I love to surf, play the drums and perform and I know the heads will turn for this new sound and vibe. It as well is performed on a plastic jug and edited in studio, post production.  

What a great way to utilize the over stock of excess plastics around! 

Recycling burns off toxins into the atmosphere as well emits CO2, so, hey it is awesome that we can make beautiful music and help the planet doing it! At the very least, the noise we make will turn some heads and get some folks on the same page and jamming along! 

I love our little stone in the Cosmos and I love the gift that music it has bestowed upon me! I really feel a part of music itself. If I didn’t feel this connection I would feel undeserving of the beauty of music and life in general.

Yes, in life there are risks, I appreciate your daring sense of experimentation. I have taken my share of risks and many times succeeded, with arms raised in a V!

Other times, I fell flat on my face. But, this loud voice motivates my will and I always get up and go at it again with determination and integrity. 

After my journeys and experiences in life, I am certain in my skills as an artist and innovator to make this the coolest drum kit anyone could ever want! Launching percussion through the next dimension!

story:
Hello! We are The Lucky Jukebox Brigade, from Albany, NY. We are going into the studio at the end of June to record a brand new EP, and we want you to be a part of it.


The Story

For over four years, we have been a DIY band in every way. We have done our own touring, booking, financing, publicity, and up until now, our own recording. This time around, we are going to be working with reputable names in the music industry to help make our next release the biggest one to date.

On our last record, Familiar Fevers, we did all of the recording ourselves and sent the post-production to Mike Watts for mixing and mastering. After working with him briefly, we developed a creative bond, and now we are fortunate enough to be able to work with him as the producer of this next effort. Mike Watts is an incredible talent who has worked with some of our musical heroes—The Dear Hunter, As Tall As Lions, The Chariot, Tides of Man, and many others. We can’t possibly tell you how excited we are for him to put his signature on our new music.

We will also be working with a publicist to ensure that these new songs get as much attention as possible. Our goal has always been to take this band as far as it can go, and we are more committed than ever.


The Project

We are launching this IndieGoGo campaign to help secure the funds we need for our upcoming EP. We feel that our new songs are our strongest yet, and we want to give them the best release we can.

Our new EP will be free for everyone, whether you donate or not. We feel that releasing music for free is the best way to have people hear it. So, we’re hoping to reach our financial goals through crowdfunding. Of course, we want to make funding a free release worth your while, so we’ve come up with some pretty killer rewards for any budget.

In addition to the rewards, we want to thank you by making the most out of our time in the studio. While we are calling this project an EP, we will attempt to record enough material for a full length release. If we meet any stretch goals (see “The Budget” below), we will make this project even bigger.

If you have any questions about our project or if you just want to chat, post in the Comments section, email us at theluckyjukeboxbrigade@gmail.com, or message us on Facebook!


The Budget

$6000 will cover studio time, mixing, and mastering. We are saving up for additional expenses (publicity, music videos, and merch), but we are asking for help with the heart of our project.

Our studio schedule:

Days 1-2: Drums

Day 3: Bass and Ukulele

Day 4: Guitar and Synth

Days 5-6: Horns and Strings

Days 7-9: Vocals

Days 10-11: Mixing

Day 12: Mastering

We are confident that we can record the EP we want to release in this timeframe, but we will do even more if we exceed our goal.  


Stretch Goals

$7000 – 1 extra song added to the EP.

$7500 – 2 extra songs added to the EP.

$8000 – We will press physical copies of the release to be given to every backer at the $10 level or above.

$9000 – We will print exclusive, limited run t-shirts for our backers, given to everyone at the $20 level or above.

$12000 – For doubling our budget, you have given us the opportunity to turn our EP into a full length album!


The End

We are extremely excited to have a chance to record new music and to have such a close bond with our fans. From the bottom of our hearts, thank you so much for being here.

story:
Help Fund the Packway Handle Band Van

As you might be able to gather by now, the Packway Handle Band from Athens, Georgia is in need of a tour van. 

Our trusty van of over a decade, Big Red, broke down in Kernersville, North Carolina in December 2013 and we haven't been able to replace her quite yet (not that anyone could ever really replace a van like Big Red...).

Since the band is ready to hit the road for a 40+ date summer tour all over the United States from June until September, we need your help more than ever to purchase a new van and get back on the road.

What We Need & What You Get

A vehicle big enough for a five-piece band heading out on tour isn't cheap, so we're looking to unload some merchandise and other great perks in order to offset the costs of a 15-passenger van that we'll take on our Summer 2015 tour and, hopefully, for years to come. 

Here are just a few of the great perks we're offering to raise some money:

  • CDs, show posters/banners (like the one shown below) signed by members of the band
  • Personalized cover songs recorded by the band
  • Private lessons for guitar, banjo and fiddle
  • Your name listed in the liner notes of the next Packway Handle Band album
  • Private performances regionally and around the US
  • And more!

If we're lucky and we raise more than $25,000, additional funds raised on this campaign will go towards recording the band's new album, which will tentatively be recorded in late 2015.  

The Impact

If you've stumbled onto this campaign page, we're assuming that you're at least somewhat familiar with Packway Handle Band. As you might know, we aren't exactly strangers to the road -- we've played hundreds of shows in nearly every corner of the United States over the past decade or so. We proudly put over 300,000 miles on Big Red before she finally gave out.   

For any successful band, reliable transportation is absolutely essential in keeping a tour running smoothly and that's no exception for Packway Handle Band. 

Flying from town to town on the tour isn't remotely economically feasible and neither is driving in separate cars. 

Since Packway Handle Band will be playing to roughly 15,000 people each night on their summer tour, we'll potentially be winning over a HALF MILLION new fans on the road during this tour. 

You can play a crucial role in making sure that these crowds get to hear Packway Handle Band all summer long...

Risks & Challenges

We understand that you might be skeptical of throwing us your hard earned money, but remember that we're not looking for a handout. As we've already mentioned, you'll be getting something in return for your generosity. 

Many of the perks that we have listed are already in our possession (CDs, posters, etc.) -- it's just a matter of heading to the post office and mailing them to you. 

If you're interested in choosing a perk that would require the band to schedule an event or private lesson, please consider that we will do our best to fulfill these perks in a timely fashion. If fulfilling a perk is not possible by the time their summer tour ends in September 2015, rest assured that you will be a priority when the band returns home from tour. 

Please email us if you have any questions or concerns about fulfilling perks and we'll be happy to answer them. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially, you can still help this campaign tremendously by sharing the link to this page on your personal Facebook, Twitter and Instagram feeds or by posting in any online forums where you think people might be interested. 

Getting the word out is absolutely essential and we'd appreciate any help you can give us in spreading the campaign as widely as possible!

If you'd rather purchase music, we're also offering Name Your Own Price digital downloads over on the band's Bandcamp page during this campaign and throughout the summer tour. 

We'll be posting updates about the campaign all over our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram feeds during and after our fundraiser, so please take the time to follow us and stay up to date.

album vinyl cd and covers

We are The Mileage,we are looking to purchase a finished package for our 12 track self recorded and mastered album.

What We Need & What You Get

We need £2000 pounds for 500 copies of Vinyl look cd,s and digi gatefold cover and 6 page booklet..as in each perk or tariff every one will get a perfect Mileage product in the most professional way possible.plecktrums,badges postcards + limited goods are all up for grabs. 

Risks & Challenges

 This is a no risk campaign,The 12 track album is already a finished product,if the goal is reached all the merchandise will be posted around a month of the goal.

 Other Ways You Can Help
please share this campaign to your friends of family if you like what you see and hear..we would also thankyou for taking a look and hope you can consider us for your support.

story:
Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign!

My name is Weston Walls. How often have you made  a donation that paid off twice?.

For the past 10 years, I have worked as a DJ and Emcee at weddings, graduation parties, fundraisers and other events around southern California. It's been great fun! I have to admit, when the tunes are pumping, lights are flashing, people are dancing and it is all because of the good job I'm doing, there is nothing more fun and satisfying! The thing is, I've never had my own business or equipment. I've always accepted jobs from other DJ friends who have double bookings and I've rented or borrowed equipment from them. Now it is time to have my own equipment, start my own company and seek my own gigs.

I will match your donation to me, dollar for dollar, with a donation, in your name to The Peace Ridge Sanctuary in Penobscot ME. They are a no kill shelter specializing in farm animal rescue. This place is very dear to my heart because I grew up in Maine, my grandmother was raised in Penobscot, and I have visited the sanctuary on a number of occasions. Have a look at their Facebook page.

Meeting my campaign goal will allow me to have two complete setups which includes speakers, speaker stands, lights, mixers, etc. Plus a couple of suits so I can look sharp on the job, build a website, and launch a marketing campaign! It will also raise money for a worthy cause that is near and dear to my heart!  Please, be generous and have a great day!!

This place is very dear to my heart because I grew up in Maine, my grandmother was raised in Penobscot, and I have visited the sanctuary on a number of occasions. Have a look at their Facebook page.Meeting my campaign goal will allow me to have two complete setups which includes speakers, speaker stands, lights, mixers, etc. Plus a couple of suits so I can look sharp on the job, build a website, and launch a marketing campaign! It will also raise money for a worthy cause that is near and dear to my heart!  Please, be generous and have a great day!!

story:
Hi! We are about to step into the studio to record a new album, and we need your help!

The four of us - who in musical collaboration call ourselves ‘Shore Thing’ - rooted on the southern shores of Lake Ontario, gather to share in the friendship that our song-sharing and rhythmic creations encourage. It is this close connection that best represents our musical styling and live performance. Our embrace of natural beauty and its gifts, as well as our treasured relationships with friends, family and partners, generate the optimisms and humble energy that give life to our sound.

We have been creating with this inspiration for over a year now, having released our first EP ‘Outside Voices’ in September 2014. With much celebration and extraordinary support in response to our first production and growing live performance, we want to take our creations and offerings to the next level, as we tour and gig on a busy schedule throughout Spring and Summer 2015 to raise funds for our upcoming musical investment. To help us complete this project, we’re asking for your help in this two-way fundraising opportunity that allows you to choose a product/service of ours in exchange for your donation. Thank you for working on this with us together in inspiration and support.

If you have any questions regarding the perks please email us at - ben@shorethingtunes.com

All Perks include a digital copy of the album!

Where the Rubber Meets the Road

This is where you get to be a part of the process! Without a label we rely on you, the fans, to provide the capital to record and print the albums.  But we also want to give our album some legs. We want to broaden our community of friends and fans even more, so we will be hiring a great team to promote our album.

In return you get some great rewards. As a funder you will get the album first, and we have also put together some great packages of Shore Thing music, swag and services.

Where the Money Goes, and why should you donate?

For this new album, we have put together a world-class team of award-winning producers, and top-of-the-line audio engineers that will bring the absolute best out of our new songs. We also have a stellar creative team that’s designing the album art and packaging.

All of the fees add up very quickly, and after some number-crunching, we have calculated that everything will cost $13,100. Here is the breakdown:

  • Recording costs - $7,100
  • Guest artists - $500
  • Audio mastering - $1,000
  • CD and vinyl replication - $1,500
  • Radio publicity campaign - $900
  • Press campaign and tour publicity - $600
  • Music videos - $1,000
  • Graphic design - Ben (Cellist) is our in graphic designer!! [Big Head Ideas]
  • Indiegogo fees - $500
The reason that we have not asked for you to pay the whole amount with us is we want to show you that we are serious about our musical careers and endeavors.  We want to fund a big portion of this album ourselves.  Unfortunately in the time constraints of wanting to release this full length album, we will not have the time or the resources to come up with the full $13,100 on our own.  That is where you come in!  We feel that asking for $5,000 will help us out a lot, but is a reasonable and attainable help.

We have all kinds of great perks to incentivize you to contribute. You are making this album possible, and you deserve to be rewarded! There are different tiers of giving: the more you give, the more you get! Some awesome perks include being us recording a cover song of your choice, having us at your house concert, and free attendance to ten Shore Thing concerts of your choice.

You can find more detailed information about contribution perks in the right-hand column on our IndieGoGo campaign page. Some of the incentives are limited, and first-come-first-serve, so please, contribute early and often.

But what does your music sound like?

One of the most exciting parts about making this new album is that—however cheesy this sounds—we feel like we’ve finally found our sound and artistic voice as a band. It lies somewhere in between indie, folk and soul, and it’s awesome. But don’t take our word for it...Help us make this album possible so you can see for yourself.

To get a sense of where we’re coming from musically, you can find our old albums on iTunes, Spotify, Rdio, or anywhere else you like to listen to music.

How can I help in other ways?

Whether or not you contribute financially, we would really appreciate your help in spreading the word about our IndieGoGo campaign. Tell your friends about our campaign through Facebook, Twitter, and email! Do you know some people who love being part of projects like this? Send it their way! Do you know a millionaire who has a soft spot for DIY Folk music? Send it their way!

Please follow us:

Facebook: http://facebook.com/shorethingtunes
Twitter: @shorethingtunes (http://twitter.com/shorethingtunes)
Instagram: @shorethingtunes (http://instagram.com/shorethingtunes)
YouTube: http://youtube.com/shorethingtunes

Thank You!

Above all, we want to thank you for reading this and considering our project. It’s because of all the amazing people like you that we’ve gotten to where we are today. From the bottom of our hearts, we truly appreciate you.
