story:
Short Summary

"MUSIC at the INTERSECTION" : Two Concerts for Peace

We are global citizens (Armenian, English, Israeli, Palestinian) working and making music together through the UK based  charity "Spirit of Peace" which is committed to creating new pathways of dialogue, understanding and sustained positive action, bringing together people and communities who  don't usually meet.

If you'd like to know more about us, you can check us out at:

www.spiritofpeace.co.uk    www.lullabies-of-loss.org 

Click the following link to hear Hasmik in performance:

https://youtu.be/9ozY8LMwFAA

Coming soon in July there will be two concerts in Jerusalem and Nazareth  - a  hopeful sharing of  our rich musical heritages which exist alongside one another but  rarely intersect. We will not charge entrance to these concerts, because we  want them to be open for all communities to come together. 

We need your help!!

The Impact

We are bringing together audiences, musicians and community leaders in the spirit of hope encouraging them to be proactive for cultural dialogue and to make space to hear each other's narrative. People who have attended our events in the past have frequently described them as life and attitude changing and in particular they create understanding, and a decrease in anger and fear of the other. 

We will be working with local partners in each area who are deeply engaged in building stronger communities where all people can flourish, and these concerts will create a safe space for deeper cultural exchange and engagement. They will contribute to the ongoing community bridge-building work which has been in process, developing  understanding and strong cross-cultural relationships over many years. The relationships thus created are pivotal for lasting peace and security to be achieved for all of us.

"Hope is the faith that, together we can make things better" Rabbi Jonathan Sacks
"To be hopeful, do hopeful things" Father John Dear
"The wound is the place where the Light enters you" Rumi

And now we'll  introduce you to some of the performers:



 


There's going to be amazing music from the Armenian Christian, Jewish & Sufi traditions; a real tapestry of rich cultural harmony for humanity.

We are delighted that the highly acclaimed, award winning Armenian vocalist, Hasmik Harutyunyan, has agreed to come and perform for the diverse communities in Jerusalem and Nazareth.

It is particularly significant in this year which commemorates the Centennial of the Armenian Genocide. We hope it will create an awareness of the rich treasures of the Armenian Christian and folk heritage.

Refreshments will be served at the end giving the opportunity for people to meet each other and the performers and community leaders.

"The arts can be an important part of creating dialogue and sustaining peace. They offer tools to create the inner shifts in awareness which enable people to be more able to meet the other. Artistes are in the powerful position to bring people together and inspire them to positive action. They provide an alternative lens through which we can look at, and engage with the world".   Heather - Jane Ozanne in "Pathways for Peace"

Risks & Challenges

Well, first of all, its going to be challenging and embarrassing if we don't have money to pay the musicians!! 
 From our past experience of such events, initially some difficult questions and emotions can arise which need sensitivity and ongoing dialogue - this is the work of peace - building, which is not soft and fluffy!!

What We Need & What You Get

We need £2000 to cover musicians fees, publicity, sound, transport, venues (most of which has been volunteered) and administration costs.

Your support will enable us to invite the broadest possible spectrum of people to attend the concerts.  (We will also encourage donations at the concerts to support further  community bridge - building work.)


Your sponsorship will enable us to involve members of the community who do not normally have the opportunity or the funds to attend concerts, thereby enriching their cultural and community experience and appealing to a broad cross-section of society in Jerusalem and Nazareth.
As a way of saying THANK YOU,  we have some  interesting music downloads and CDs and other ideas for perks.

Other Ways You Can Help
We would love you to be involved and partner with us in these events.
  • We understand that many people  can't contribute financially, but there are other forms of support we would greatly value.
  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Could you volunteer catering skills or other help at the concerts?
  • Could you offer help with Publicity and inviting people to the concerts.

Could you volunteer catering skills or other help at the concerts?
Could you offer help with Publicity and inviting people to the concerts.

story:
So Why Did a High School Student Start This Program?

Music has always been a passion of mine, and this year I have had the privilege of helping at risk kids through my passion. Funding for arts education has been decimated in public schools nationwide, leaving many students without access to an integral tool--music education and under-served communities are usually the hardest hit. Music is the one language that transcends all socioeconomic barriers, providing ALL students with an equal chance to succeed. The benefits of music education include: increased attention in class, improved cognitive functions, better reading comprehension, higher graduation rates and higher SAT scores  - resulting in more prepared students with improved opportunity to succeed!

The Cantio mission is to make music accessible to all, especially the undeserved and provide research to benefit students, scientists, educators and ongoing music education studies. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are serving 1600 at risk kids this summer in a partnership with the Boys and Girls club - and need your help to support instructor compensation.
  • For a tax deductible fee of just $30, you can sponsor one child for the entire summer! $300 will help 10!!
  • Because we are a nonprofit, all of our funding goes toward helping at risk students - we receive no funds from the Boys and Girls club and our program is offered at no charge. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, you can still be a part of the Cantio community:

  • Spread the word! Share this campaign with your family, friends, coworkers, acquaintances and more
  • Spread the love! Like us on Facebook and twitter @cantiomusic 

Help us become, Instruments for Change

Whether your child is the next Beyonce or more likely to sing her solos in the shower, she is bound to benefit from some form of music education. Research shows that learning the do-re-mis can help children excel in ways beyond the basic ABCs.

More Than Just Music
Research has found that learning music facilitates learning other subjects and enhances skills that children inevitably use in other areas. “A music-rich experience for children of singing, listening and moving is really bringing a very serious benefit to children as they progress into more formal learning,” says Mary Luehrisen, executive director of the National Association of Music Merchants (NAMM) Foundation, a not-for-profit association that promotes the benefits of making music.

Making music involves more than the voice or fingers playing an instrument; a child learning about music has to tap into multiple skill sets, often simultaneously. For instance, people use their ears and eyes, as well as large and small muscles, says Kenneth Guilmartin, cofounder of Music Together, an early childhood music development program for infants through kindergarteners that involves parents or caregivers in the classes.

“Music learning supports all learning. Not that Mozart makes you smarter, but it’s a very integrating, stimulating pastime or activity,” Guilmartin says.

Language Development
“When you look at children ages two to nine, one of the breakthroughs in that area is music’s benefit for language development, which is so important at that stage,” says Luehrisen. While children come into the world ready to decode sounds and words, music education helps enhance those natural abilities. “Growing up in a musically rich environment is often advantageous for children’s language development,” she says. But Luehrisen adds that those inborn capacities need to be “reinforced, practiced, celebrated,” which can be done at home or in a more formal music education setting.

According to the Children’s Music Workshop, the effect of music education on language development can be seen in the brain. “Recent studies have clearly indicated that musical training physically develops the part of the left side of the brain known to be involved with processing language, and can actually wire the brain’s circuits in specific ways. Linking familiar songs to new information can also help imprint information on young minds,” the group claims.

This relationship between music and language development is also socially advantageous to young children. “The development of language over time tends to enhance parts of the brain that help process music,” says Dr. Kyle Pruett, clinical professor of child psychiatry at Yale School of Medicine and a practicing musician. “Language competence is at the root of social competence. Musical experience strengthens the capacity to be verbally competent.”

Increased IQ
A study by E. Glenn Schellenberg at the University of Toronto at Mississauga, as published in a 2004 issue of Psychological Science, found a small increase in the IQs of six-year-olds who were given weekly voice and piano lessons. Schellenberg provided nine months of piano and voice lessons to a dozen six-year-olds, drama lessons (to see if exposure to arts in general versus just music had an effect) to a second group of six-year-olds, and no lessons to a third group. The children’s IQs were tested before entering the first grade, then again before entering the second grade.

Surprisingly, the children who were given music lessons over the school year tested on average three IQ points higher than the other groups. The drama group didn’t have the same increase in IQ, but did experience increased social behavior benefits not seen in the music-only group.

The Brain Works Harder
Research indicates the brain of a musician, even a young one, works differently than that of a nonmusician. “There’s some good neuroscience research that children involved in music have larger growth of neural activity than people not in music training. When you’re a musician and you’re playing an instrument, you have to be using more of your brain,” says Dr. Eric Rasmussen, chair of the Early Childhood Music Department at the Peabody Preparatory of The Johns Hopkins University, where he teaches a specialized music curriculum for children aged two months to nine years.

In fact, a study led by Ellen Winner, professor of psychology at Boston College, and Gottfried Schlaug, professor of neurology at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center and Harvard Medical School, found changes in the brain images of children who underwent 15 months of weekly music instruction and practice. The students in the study who received music instruction had improved sound discrimination and fine motor tasks, and brain imaging showed changes to the networks in the brain associated with those abilities, according to the Dana Foundation, a private philanthropic organization that supports brain research.

Spatial-Temporal Skills
Research has also found a causal link between music and spatial intelligence, which means that understanding music can help children visualize various elements that should go together, like they would do when solving a math problem.

“We have some pretty good data that music instruction does reliably improve spatial-temporal skills in children over time,” explains Pruett, who helped found the Performing Arts Medicine Association. These skills come into play in solving multistep problems one would encounter in architecture, engineering, math, art, gaming, and especially working with computers.

Improved Test Scores
A study published in 2007 by Christopher Johnson, professor of music education and music therapy at the University of Kansas, revealed that students in elementary schools with superior music education programs scored around 22 percent higher in English and 20 percent higher in math scores on standardized tests, compared to schools with low-quality music programs, regardless of socioeconomic disparities among the schools or school districts. Johnson compares the concentration that music training requires to the focus needed to perform well on a standardized test.

Aside from test score results, Johnson’s study highlights the positive effects that a quality music education can have on a young child’s success. Luehrisen explains this psychological phenomenon in two sentences: “Schools that have rigorous programs and high-quality music and arts teachers probably have high-quality teachers in other areas. If you have an environment where there are a lot of people doing creative, smart, great things, joyful things, even people who aren’t doing that have a tendency to go up and do better.”

And it doesn’t end there: along with better performance results on concentration-based tasks, music training can help with basic memory recall. “Formal training in music is also associated with other cognitive strengths such as verbal recall proficiency,” Pruett says. “People who have had formal musical training tend to be pretty good at remembering verbal information stored in memory.”

Being Musical
Music can improve your child’ abilities in learning and other nonmusic tasks, but it’s important to understand that music does not make one smarter. As Pruett explains, the many intrinsic benefits to music education include being disciplined, learning a skill, being part of the music world, managing performance, being part of something you can be proud of, and even struggling with a less than perfect teacher.

“It’s important not to oversell how smart music can make you,” Pruett says. “Music makes your kid interesting and happy, and smart will come later. It enriches his or her appetite for things that bring you pleasure and for the friends you meet.”
While parents may hope that enrolling their child in a music program will make her a better student, the primary reasons to provide your child with a musical education should be to help them become more musical, to appreciate all aspects of music, and to respect the process of learning an instrument or learning to sing, which is valuable on its own merit.

“There is a massive benefit from being musical that we don’t understand, but it’s individual. Music is for music’s sake,” Rasmussen says. “The benefit of music education for me is about being musical. It gives you have a better understanding of yourself. The horizons are higher when you are involved in music,” he adds. “Your understanding of art and the world, and how you can think and express yourself, are enhanced.”

Glenn Schellenberg at the University of Toronto at Mississauga, as published in a 2004 issue of Psychological Science, found a small increase in the IQs of six-year-olds who were given weekly voice and piano lessons. Schellenberg provided nine months of piano and voice lessons to a dozen six-year-olds, drama lessons (to see if exposure to arts in general versus just music had an effect) to a second group of six-year-olds, and no lessons to a third group. The children’s IQs were tested before entering the first grade, then again before entering the second grade.Surprisingly, the children who were given music lessons over the school year tested on average three IQ points higher than the other groups. The drama group didn’t have the same increase in IQ, but did experience increased social behavior benefits not seen in the music-only group.The Brain Works HarderResearch indicates the brain of a musician, even a young one, works differently than that of a nonmusician. “There’s some good neuroscience research that children involved in music have larger growth of neural activity than people not in music training. When you’re a musician and you’re playing an instrument, you have to be using more of your brain,” says Dr. Eric Rasmussen, chair of the Early Childhood Music Department at the Peabody Preparatory of The Johns Hopkins University, where he teaches a specialized music curriculum for children aged two months to nine years.In fact, a study led by Ellen Winner, professor of psychology at Boston College, and Gottfried Schlaug, professor of neurology at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center and Harvard Medical School, found changes in the brain images of children who underwent 15 months of weekly music instruction and practice. The students in the study who received music instruction had improved sound discrimination and fine motor tasks, and brain imaging showed changes to the networks in the brain associated with those abilities, according to the Dana Foundation, a private philanthropic organization that supports brain research.Spatial-Temporal SkillsResearch has also found a causal link between music and spatial intelligence, which means that understanding music can help children visualize various elements that should go together, like they would do when solving a math problem.“We have some pretty good data that music instruction does reliably improve spatial-temporal skills in children over time,” explains Pruett, who helped found the Performing Arts Medicine Association. These skills come into play in solving multistep problems one would encounter in architecture, engineering, math, art, gaming, and especially working with computers.Improved Test ScoresA study published in 2007 by Christopher Johnson, professor of music education and music therapy at the University of Kansas, revealed that students in elementary schools with superior music education programs scored around 22 percent higher in English and 20 percent higher in math scores on standardized tests, compared to schools with low-quality music programs, regardless of socioeconomic disparities among the schools or school districts. Johnson compares the concentration that music training requires to the focus needed to perform well on a standardized test.Aside from test score results, Johnson’s study highlights the positive effects that a quality music education can have on a young child’s success. Luehrisen explains this psychological phenomenon in two sentences: “Schools that have rigorous programs and high-quality music and arts teachers probably have high-quality teachers in other areas. If you have an environment where there are a lot of people doing creative, smart, great things, joyful things, even people who aren’t doing that have a tendency to go up and do better.”And it doesn’t end there: along with better performance results on concentration-based tasks, music training can help with basic memory recall. “Formal training in music is also associated with other cognitive strengths such as verbal recall proficiency,” Pruett says. “People who have had formal musical training tend to be pretty good at remembering verbal information stored in memory.”Being MusicalMusic can improve your child’ abilities in learning and other nonmusic tasks, but it’s important to understand that music does not make one smarter. As Pruett explains, the many intrinsic benefits to music education include being disciplined, learning a skill, being part of the music world, managing performance, being part of something you can be proud of, and even struggling with a less than perfect teacher.“It’s important not to oversell how smart music can make you,” Pruett says. “Music makes your kid interesting and happy, and smart will come later. It enriches his or her appetite for things that bring you pleasure and for the friends you meet.”While parents may hope that enrolling their child in a music program will make her a better student, the primary reasons to provide your child with a musical education should be to help them become more musical, to appreciate all aspects of music, and to respect the process of learning an instrument or learning to sing, which is valuable on its own merit.“There is a massive benefit from being musical that we don’t understand, but it’s individual. Music is for music’s sake,” Rasmussen says. “The benefit of music education for me is about being musical. It gives you have a better understanding of yourself. The horizons are higher when you are involved in music,” he adds. “Your understanding of art and the world, and how you can think and express yourself, are enhanced.”

story:
WANT A FREE TICKET TO SEE THE GRATEFUL DEAD IN CHICAGO??  JamShalom is going to be there, and we want YOU to come along with US!!  We have 10 tickets to give away!!

SUPPORT THE JAMSHALOM SUMMER TOUR, AND YOU HAVE ODDS AS GOOD AS 1-IN-50 OF BEING CHOSEN TO JOIN OUR TEAM, WHICH INCLUDES A FREE TICKET TO ONE OF THE SHOWS!!


What is JamShalom?

JamShalom is a grassroots chill-scene that brings spiritual connection to jamband events and festivals across North America. Run by a dedicated team of volunteers, you've probably seen the JamShalom or PHISHalom tent at many a show, offering a shady place to hang out, eat and drink, throw down amazing Shabbat meals, enjoy musical prayer services, and have lots of meaningful conversations!  :-)


Last Year

Last year, the JamShalom crew was on the road for over 555 hours, hitting most of PHISH tour, and also Lock'n.  Over 2,500 Holy Chillers came through our tents, enjoying the free soda, water and beer, along with all kinds of grilled goodies and the great company of old and newfound friends.


Wanna Join Us??

Because JamShalom is all about new faces and friends, we thought we'd do something cool and different!  Why not combine a fundraiser for this summer's tour with inviting our friends and supporters to join us in the vibes and dancing??  So please, contribute to our campaign - as we NEED YOUR SUPPORT  to do this summer's tour!!  And then we hope that you will be one of the 10 people chosen to join our team in Chicago at Grateful Dead lot, which includes a free ticket to one night's show!!


Our Summer Plans

This year, we plan to make JamShalom bigger and more raging than ever! Starting our summer tour with the 50thAnniversary Grateful Dead Shows in Chicago on July 4thweekend, and once again ending with Lockn Music Festival in Arlington, Virginia, we have a JAM-packed summer schedule hitting up all your favorite festivals.

But making this summer even better means we need YOUR help! In order to cover all of our equipment costs and transportation we are asking for all our friends, both old and new, to chip in. The more we raise, the more festivals we can be on the road hanging out with you throughout the summer and into the fall.


Check Out Dem Perks!

If you look at the perks for each donation level, you’ll see that your chances of joining the JamShalom team in Chicago and getting a free ticket are pretty amazing!

Check out each donation level to know what you’re in for and what your chances are of becoming part of the team. You can donate as many times as you like within each levels supporter limit, increasing your chance of winning!

And please remember to spread the word and let your friends in on this awesome chance to be at the Dead shows in Chicago and be part of the JamShalom team!



*Note: Being chosen to be part of the JamShalom crew DOES NOT include accommodations or transportation to Chicago.

Like us on Facebook, Join our Community, Share this with friends!

QUESTIONS? Send us an email at info@jamshalom.com

story:
On July 26, 2015, Open Communities and a diverse group of amazing, dedicated individuals and group partners are sponsoring the 2015 Justice Project: The March Continues.  This event will be free, open and welcoming to everyone no matter where you live.  It will also feature some of the best-known leaders, past and present, of the civil rights movement, as well as some of today's local community activists.  This is a family event with artsand crafts activities for children, speakers, live music, and great food available (for a small price). 

OUR STORY AND WHAT WE'RE TRYING TO ACCOMPLISH: In 1965, our forebear, the North Shore Summer Project, galvanized thousands of residents to push for open housing and brought Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. to the Winnetka Village Green to inspire over 10,000 people to "go all out to end segregation." As we reflect upon our powerful beginnings, Open Communities is determined to honor the achievements of our founders by expanding upon them, not simply commemorating them.  We have developed clear criteria for the Welcoming Community that uphold justice for all and embrace people of every race, religion, ethnicity, ability, sexual orientation, and income bracket.

WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU,  OUR SUPPORTERS: Donations are neededto help us pay for transportation and housing for some of the speakers, as well as speaker fees, permits, music groups, food, stage and audio/visual equipment, and more, as we work towards getting people involved in what we see as very important goals for a better society. 

We are a 501(c)(3) and, therefore, your donations are tax-deductible.  The event will cost a lot more than $5,000, but volunteers are working very hard to raise money for the event locally as well as your generous contribution.  With so many cuts today by corporations and governments, raising money via those sources is much harder,  so we thank you for anything you can donate to offset our costs, and if you live anywhere in the Chicagoland area, please join us and tell your friends and family about the event.  



You can see more at:http://www.open-communities.org/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Open-Communities/344383882320615
Hashtag: @OpenCommNS

story:
Jettison. Reprise. (full-length album!)

Mighty Brother is a Bloomington-based folk-rock duo, but more than that, it is a confluence, a merging of creative energies and musical passions. The resulting currents have carved a composition more exciting and beautiful than we could have imagined!

We are Nick Huster and Jake Ryan, the guys behind the curtain, plucking our strings and frantically scrawling our hearts on paper, throwing spaghetti at the cabinets to see what sticks (rethink metaphor... why always food?). But what began as a common "let's jam sometime," quickly became Jettison. Reprise., our first full-length album. 

(Jettison. Reprise. album artwork by Rose Harding)

 And so, the music grew beyond us, joined by many streams and rivulets, to mobilize a rich community of artists and collaborators! (The album features 14 musicians in all!)

Every donation brings us one step closer to giving back! Giving back to everyone that made this album a reality, showcasing the outstanding talent of the Bloomington community, putting this collaborative thought-child into eager hands and curious ears, and most of all, returning all the positivity and inspiration we've found though friends and peers BACK into the community.  


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you are redeeming a download code, please visit mightybrother.bandcamp.com/yum

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


What We Need

Jettison. Reprise. is recorded and mastered, but we're still playing catch up. 
To move forward to printing the record and digital distribution, we are asking for $1500 to recoup costs associated with mixing and mastering.
Mixing            -     $1000  to finish it up
Mastering     -     $500    
Nothing too fancy, but printing CD's, global distribution through CD Baby, and a PR campaign are in our sights, and all must be squared away. And so...

JOIN US!

As if the comfort of knowing you'll be inspiring a community isn't enough, we want you to have Jettison. Reprise. the day it drops, no worries, no complications, along with anything else our whirling minds can conceivably deliver to show our immense gratitude for your love and support!
Perks will include any combination of the following (see side panel for full listing):
  • A BIG, BIG, BIG THANK YOU! 
  • You name in the Liner Notes
  • Hand/Type-Written Poetry
  • Digital Download of our Single in 2 months!
  • Physical/Digital Copy of Jettison. Reprise. 
  • Framed, Type-Written Poetry by Brother Blue
  • Digital Download of our comedy EP, van!
  • Digital Download of our LIVE album, LIVE Sessions, Vol. 1
Along with other fun things like contributor-chosen cover songs, Mighty Brother breakfast serenades, dinner with one or both or us, private shows, and much more! 
(Don't see the perk for you? Message us! We'll see what we can do:))


Got it! So What?

Our goal from the start with Jettison. Reprise. was collaboration. Once funded, we can move forward and onwards! You'll be joining our ranks with your donation and fueling the creation of future projects and collaborative opportunities!

In 8 short months, we have worked with videographers, artists, musicians, and tons of friends and fans to produce 9 Youtube videos, a 7-song LIVE album, a 3-song comedy EP, and our first music video coming very, very soon! Those endeavors alone have mobilized dozens!

Bloomington has been home to us for 5 years now, and it really is a fantastic town. This community is a spring of eager minds full of talent, ambition, and passion for creativity and creative expression. They have inspired us, and we hope to inspire many more, letting the positivity grow through us and all our collaborations with this project!

Long have we observed the endeavors of countless musicians and creatives in the Bloomington community. Their perseverance and enthusiasm has ferried us to this point, and we could not have done it without the help and support of our friends, peers, and fans! We want to make the true potential of this album a reality, not for ourselves alone, but for each individual that contributed! (Find a complete list of collaborators below!)


Risks & Challenges

The good news is that the biggest challenge has already been overcome-- the album is complete and ready for printing and distribution. This campaign was created because we now face those new financial challenges, and we realize that will present it's own set of hurdles to cross. 

  • We are still relatively new to Bloomington and it's artistic community. However, we have been ambitious and active in our community engagement, making Mighty Brother an opportunity for our creative fellows to participate with us, growing our network and visibility in a very short time.
  • Nick is in Ghana, but Jake (along with some help from his friends) is carrying the Mighty Torch. 
  • While this campaign is crucial to the success of many future goals (i.e. vinyl printing, more collab youtube videos, music videos, merchandise), it is not the the end all here. We intend to fulfill every perk and promise regardless of the campaign outcome. 

Stretch Goals

Any funds raised past our target amount will go right back into further collaborations and open exciting new possibilities for tee shirt printing, printing to vinyl, shooting future music videos, as well as enabling us to throw a HUGE bash for everyone on the album!
Seriously, if this goes super well, you best make it out to our show in September for some crazy shenanigans! 

The Great Minds of Jettison. Reprise. 

  • Eric Day  -  Mixing w/ Sleepwalk Recording
  • Kate Siefker  -  Mastering
  • Nick Huster  -  Vocals, guitar, alt percussion, wood block
  • Jake Ryan  -  Vocals, guitar, ukulele, coffee
  • John Valdez  -  Percussion, hugs
  • Quinn Sternberg  -  Bass, double bass, triple bass
  • Gabe Harlan  -  Keys
  • Andrew Henry  -  Violin, mandolin
  • Neal Anderson  -  Keyboard
  • Diederik van Wassenaer  -  String arrangement, violin
  • Aaron Smith  -  Viola
  • Hanearl Kim  -  Cello
  • Liaht Slobodkin  -  Violin
  • Lexie Signor  -  Horns arrangement, lead trumpet
  • Richard Marshall  -  Bass trombone
  • Ben Sachs  -  Trombone
  • Lauren Patin  -  Horn
  • Sean Burdette  -  Trumpet
  • Rose Harding  -  Album artist
And that's only on this album! A special THANK YOU to everyone who has helped us reach this point! Thank you to Kelsey Hahn and Michael Wissig for helping us shoot the video and for their all-around awesomeness!


Not Ready or Unable?

There are many more ways to help us reach our goal and make this dream a reality!
  1. Use the share tools to reach out to Friends and Family.
  2. Bookmark the campaign, check back regularly for updates, exclusive perks, and new video releases coming soon and share those videos w/ links to the campaign.
  3. Connect to Indiegogo through your Facebook and use the share tools to refer others to the page. On the last week of the campaign we will be launching a referral contest to reward our greatest advocates with something very special!
  4. Message us expressing your interest in helping! We have some big plans coming up that could use your hands-on expertise!
  5. Join us for our Single Release Show  in September, and invite your friends:)


Please Contact US

With any questions, concerns, suggestions, anything!
mightybrotherband@gmail.com

story:
Who we are

Hello, We are Diva Gash! A Dance, Rock, Electronic, Funk, Disco & House band, created in 1997, in Bogotá, Colombia (Not Columbia, haha).

As of now we carry 3 LPs (Long Plays) under our belt.

The Goal

We are currently working on the making of a new album; all of our music has been released independently, and so will this… But we’re looking for partners like YOU! You could possibly be one of ours.

Yes, YOU! You, could be one of our executive producers for that waited album.

So for all of those of you who don’t know how much a full album costs, well… It costs a lot!  Therefore we actually need your support.

So people around the world, we invite you to help us so you can become an important part of Diva Gash’s new material! 

The Perks

Through this indiegogo campaign, in exchange for your contribution, you´ll receive exclusive material from our forthcoming  album; we´ll press an special vinyl and also a CD version, T shirts, etc. so many Perks that we know you are going to enjoy so much!

Spread the word!

If you are not able to donate, there are plenty of ways that you can help us out. The best way to help is to tell your family, friends and anyone that you believe might be interested in contributing to our campaign. 

Please, share this link on your social networks. Thank you so much!

Thank You!

A Big Thank you very much for taking the time to check out our campaign. We are so incredibly grateful for your support.  

All our love, 

Camilo Ferrer & Javier Pabón

Diva Gash

Quienes somos

Hola, Somos Diva Gash. Una banda de Dance, Rock, Electrónica, Funk, Disco & House, creada en 1997, en Bogotá, Colombia 

Al momento llevamos 3 LPs (Long Plays) en nuestro haber.

La Meta

Estamos trabajando en la producción de un nuevo album; toda nuestra música ha sido lanzada de forma independiente y esta campaña no será la excepción. 

Estamos buscando socios y tu puedes ser uno de ellos!

Si, TU! puedes convertirte en uno de los productores ejecutivos para este nuevo disco.

Para todos los que no saben cuánto cuesta hacer un disco, pues cuesta mucho! Es por eso que necesitamos de su colaboración.

Las bandas de Rock en Colombia también sufren por el alza del dólar y la caida del petroleo! 

Gente de todo Mundo! Los invitamos para que puedan convertirse en una parte fundamental del nuevo Disco de Diva Gash!

Las Recompensas

A través de esta campaña de indiegogo, a cambio de su contribución, ustedes recibirán material exclusivo de nuestro próximo álbum; produciremos una edición especial en vinilo y también una versión en CD, camisetas, etc. Muchos beneficios que sabemos van a disfrutar mucho!

Riega la voz!

Si no estás en capacidad de hacer algún aporte económico, hay muchas formas en las que nos puedes colaborar. La mejor forma es decirle a tus familiares, amigos y cualquiera que consideres, pueda estar interesado en contribuir a esta campaña.

Por favor, comparte este link en tus redes sociales. Muchas Gracias!

Muchas Gracias!

Un gigante agradecimiento por tomarse el tiempo de chequear nuestra campaña. Estamos increiblemente agradecidos con su apoyo.

Con Cariño, 

Camilo Ferrer & Javier Pabón


T -SHIRT

story:
Liebe Freunde und Yogis,

Dear friends and yogis,

wir freuen uns riesig Euch unser erstes Mantra-Album vorstellen zu dürfen. Nachdem uns schon seit Jahren viele Menschen nach "unserer Musik"  fragen,  befinden wir uns nun endlich in der Endphase der Produktion unserer ersten gemeinsamen CD. 

we are ever so happy and excited to finally introduce our first MantraAlbum to you. Since many years people have kept on asking us for our music - and now we finally enter the finishing process of this first album.


Über diesen Link kommt Ihr direkt zu kurzen Hörproben aller Stücke unserer CD - noch ungemastert:

This link will guide you directly to a preview of all of our pieces on the album - not mastered yet:

http://soundcloud.com/laeela/sets/waves-of-blis...

Laeela

Wir sind "Laeela" - Katrin Neelam und David Mages. Vor zwölf Jahren haben wir uns Mantra singend auf einem Rainbow Gathering kennengelernt. Seitdem ist das Singen von Mantras, Bhajans und Kirtans ein Herzstück unseres gemeinsamen Weges. Schon lange teilen wir diese Liebe in Singkreisen, Konzerten und Gatherings. Seit Katrin's Ausbildung zur Kundalini Yoga Lehrerin, sprudeln eigene Melodien und auch englische Texte aus uns raus. Die Zeit des Aufnehmens war sehr herausfordernd für uns aber das Ziel in unserem Herzen hat uns über alle Hürden geholfen. So dass wir in diesem Prozess letztlich in die totale Leichtigkeit und unbändige Freude an uns, diesem wundervollen Leben und schliesslich auch unserer Musik ankommen durften - what a blessing. Möge diese Musik noch mehr Licht, Liebe, Mut, Gelassenheit und Freude auf diese Welt bringen !!! 

Über dieses Album

Die Mantras, die wir hier vertont haben, sind kraftvolle Instrumente, die uns helfen uns an genau die Kraft anzubinden, die wir brauchen für bestimmte Situationen, Probleme, Lebensphasen etc. und sie erinnern uns immer wieder ohne Umweg an unser spirituelles zu Hause. Umso schöner ist es nun diese Wunderwerke mit unseren Klängen zu vereinen. David hat sein begnadetes Talent als Multiinstrumentalist in all diese Stücke sehr intuitiv einfliessen lassen und produzierte das Album voller Hingabe, so dass wundervolle Arrangements, Stimmungen und Instrumentierungen ganz aus einem Fluss natürlich entstanden. Die meisten Stücke ruhig meditativ - einige auch mit brazilian vibes - immer wieder pure Freude das Album von vorne bis hinten durchzuhören. Hol Dir einen Vorgeschmack indem Du in die Vorschau unseres Albums reinhörst.

Laeela

We are Laeela - Katrin Neelam and David Mages. When we met twelve years ago on a rainbow gathering we both had already fallen in love with mantra singing. Ever since mantra, bhajan and kirtan singing has been an essential part of our way. For many years we've been sharing that love in chantingcircles, concerts and on spiritual events. The creative flow of our own Mantra compositions and lyrics began when Katrin started to deepen her yoga practice through the kundalini yoga teacher training. The time of recording has been quite a challenge for us but the fire in our heart helped us through every block. So that we finally reached a state of ease and pure joy about ourselves, this wonderful life and our music - what a blessing! May this music bring even more love, light, courage, relaxation and joy to this world !!!

About this album

The mantras on this album are very powerful instruments which help us connect to that force we need for certain situations, problems, periods etc. and they instantly remind us where we come from. We feel ever so grateful to be able to unite these ancient mantras with the sounds & music that come through us. David as a highly skilled multiinstrumentalist produced every song on the album with such a devotion and guidance so that amazing arrangements, moods and instrumentation just developed naturally - most of them calm and meditative - some with a brazilian rhythmical vibe. Get a taste by listening to the preview.


Das Album ist der Kundalini Yoga Tradition gewidmet

In tiefer Dankbarkeit für die Schätze des Kundalini Yoga und die Kraft, die es in uns erweckt, sind auf diesem Album ausschliesslich Gurmukhi Mantras und mit diesen in Verbindung stehende englische Texte mit wundervoller Instrumentierung vetont. Eine aussergewöhnliche Mischung aus beschwingter Leichtigkeit und berührender Tiefe. Die perfekte musikalische Begleitung zum Yoga machen, meditieren, entspannen und geniessen!

This album is dedicated to the kundalini yoga tradition

Mantras in gurmukhi and english lyrics woven into enchanting melodies and played with some wonderful instruments. An extraordinary mixture taking you from swinging ease to touching depth. The ideal companion for your Yoga practice and classes, for meditation, relaxation or simply for joy!


Wie lange arbeiten wir schon daran ?

Seit Januar sind wir nun voll dabei, haben bereits viel Geld, Zeit und ganz viel Liebe reingesteckt und ...... sind zu 95% fertig! 

How long have we already been in progress ? 

Since january we 've been working full on, already invested a lot of money, time and much much love - and nearly made it.


"Laaela" -  wie es dazu kam

So einige Male in diesem Zeitraum haben wir über einen Namen für uns "nachgedacht" und jedes mal kamen wir zu dem Schluss - entweder kommt der Name einfach oder wir bleiben bei Katrin & David. Während unserer ersten gemeinsamen Mixing Session in München kam dann "Laeela" vom Himmel geflogen. Ohne zu wissen, was es bedeutet, waren wir uns gleich einig, dass das unser Name ist. Als wir kurze Zeit später eine Freundin aus Tunesien fragten, ob sie wisse, was Laeela bedeute, bekamen wir zur Antwort "Engel"...

"Laeela" - the story of our name

While working on our album we tried to find a name for us but whenever we "thought" about a name we got pretty close to quarreling with each other. So we decided to leave that job to the universe. Then one day during our first mixing session in Munich "Laeela" came down from heaven and made us both smile. Later on we asked a friend from Tunisia if she knew what Laeela means and her answer was "angel"...


Dankeschön !

An dieser Stelle möchten wir uns erstmal bedanken bei all den lieben Menschen, die uns seit Jahren motiviert haben endlich unsere Musik aufzunehmen. Ihr seid alle eine große Unterstützung für uns. Nun wünschen wir uns noch Eure finanzielle Unterstützung um unser CD-Baby in die Welt zu bringen. Bestellt hier unsere CD oder einen anderen Perk vor und helft uns so die Kosten für die Produktion, Mastering, Photograph, Coverdesign, Presswerk etc. zu decken.

Thanks so much! 

We do want to give thanks to all the dear people who have been begging us for years to record our music. You are a major force in this wonderful process. Now we 'd like to give you the chance to help us even more in giving us your financial support  for the last stage of giving birth to our CD-baby. The costs of production, mastering, photo & graphic design, CDpressing etc. want to be paid.

Eure Unterstützung

Mit Eurer Unterstützung hier bei indiegogo können wir den direkten Weg von uns zu Euch gehen und ihr erhaltet als Erstes unsere Musik!
Your support
Through your support at indiegogo our music can go directly from us to you in a personal relation.

Wie funktioniert es ?

Suche Dir einen Perk aus und folge der Anweisung. Nach Beendigung der Kampagne nehmen wir Kontakt mit Dir auf und Du bekommst von uns was Du gewählt hast.

How does it work ?

Choose a perk and follow the instructions. After the campaign is finished we get in contact with you and send you what you have choosen.

Unser Ziel

Unser Ziel ist 5.000 Euro - ein realistischer Betrag bzw. eher bescheidener Betrag  für all das was wir bereits reingesteckt haben und noch reingesteckt werden muss um unser Projekt zu vollenden.

Our aim

Our aim is to raise at least 5.000 euros which is a realistic or to be honest a small amount of money for what we have already invested and still need to finish our project.


Die Mitwirkenden an diesem Album sind:

Here the list of artists and intruments:

David Mages - vocals, guitars, bass, ukulele, bansuri, silverflute, hulusi, sopransaxophone, piano, keyboards, harmonium, santoor, duduk, dilruba, percussion

Katrin Neelam Mages - vocals, sansula, frame drum

Chintan Relenberg - tabla, pandero, udu, mix

Loveenya Mages - piano

Iris von Boyen, Taisha Mages & CathaRani - vocals


in Liebe & Dankbarkeit
with Love & Gratitude

story:
One Machine are releasing our 2nd Album ‘The Final Cull’ worldwide on September 18th. This album sees One Machine at our very best so far, and also features new members Chris Hawkins on Vocals and Stefano Selvatico on Bass alongside drummer Michele Sanna and founding members and guitarists Steve Smyth and Jamie Hunt. We need to raise funds to recoup some of our production costs, but most importantly we need your help to back this record with a proper promotional campaign and put money towards touring, so we can get out and play for all of you across the world!


Recording The Final Cull saw us travel 1600 miles (round trip) to Death Island Studios in Denmark to work with engineer Marco Angioni, and Producer/Mixer/Co-Engineer Tue Madsen and lay down our best music yet. In a gruelling but immensely rewarding and successful 9 days of solid recording, we were pulling on average 15-18hr days, and drank about 15-18 litres of coffee ("Fresh Pots!")...each...per day. This wasn’t just some masochistic rite of passage however, we were hell bent on the goal of giving you the best live - that’s right, LIVE! - Heavy Metal studio record we could, regardless of time and budget constraints.

What We Need...

We have set our target to £5000 because this will cover the most important costs involved in taking the next steps - the remaining production costs (final mixes and masters), PR campaign, and tour support. However, realistically, all in, we are looking at something like £10,000 to really cover everything, so every pound we raise above our initial target will go straight into making The Final Cull as big, bad and brave as we always envisaged.

Tour Support - This includes travel costs, accommodation expenses, everything that goes into making a tour happen. Of course, it’s no secret that buy-ons are now a standard in the industry, and setting aside some of our budget to this will mean we can come see you guys on some fantastic package tours with incredible bands, so you can come see us at some great shows with great line-ups.

We’ve fronted as much of this budget as we possibly can, but we now need your help to get this album and this music out to the world, both in promoting the album in the press and online, but in performing it directly for metalheads and music lovers the world over. This album was recorded LIVE, because it was meant to be heard LIVE!

...What You Get






Contribute today and upgrade later! Indiegogo makes it very easy to upgrade your choice as new perks become available. See this page for more info.

We're in the works with lining up some fantastic perks (hey, that rhymed!) for everyone who backs this project. Of course, you can get hold of the album in various formats - Digital Download, Digipak CD, Special Edition Vinyl - but we'll also be offering limited edition T-Shirts and other merch and exclusive experiences with the band, from Backstage Passes to Music Lessons. We've even got some quality instruments available. Alongside that, EVERYONE who contributes towards this project will get exclusive access to behind the scenes footage and interviews before anybody else, along with contributor-only updates and thank yous from the band.

The Impact - What's so special about a 'live' studio album, anyway?

We feel that many, many of the great records of history are the ones that were recorded in an organic, live studio environment. By this, we mean that the main core of the music - the drums, the guitars and the bass - were recorded together, at the same time, with members sharing the same room and the same space whilst hammering out the kind of high-intensity performances that you just don’t get from recording separate parts in separate locations.

It’s become the standard now to lay down each instrument separately, to a click track, one at a time, in a way that strips away much of the humanity and depth that can only be created when the band members are performing together. There are good reasons for this, of course. One is time, ease and convenience, as musicians can fit recording around their other commitments by recording at home or at small project studios. The other is money. Sadly, very few artists and very few labels ever see the kind of budgets that made those classic records so great. The kind of budget where a band could write, record and even live together in a studio for the weeks or months that it took to make great music.

We want to prove, by example, that with the right planning and the right people, and with help from the fans, bands CAN still make amazing live studio records on modest budgets. Not only did we record this album together, live together, eat together and sleep together (ahem) for the full 9 days (even WITH Chris’s ass stanking up the place), we even WROTE much of the material whilst we were there! That's right, a good chunk of these songs actually came together as the band were jamming in the studio. You don't get much more FRESH and ORGANIC than that beyond the whole foods aisle at Waitrose. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, not everyone can contribute but there are so many ways you can help:

  • Use the indiegogo share tools to spread the word on social media

  • Tell all the metalheads in your local scene about us; down the pub, at gigs, send em a link, play them some of our music etc.

  • Post something on your blog about us

  • Post a message on your favourite forum or any online community where you’re active. Let them know about us, and why you’re excited about this release.


Plus, don’t forget to check our twitter and social media pages regularly, as we’ll be keeping you up to date on the campaign, ways to interact with us and other ways you can spread the word, such as facebook cover photos and other cool stuff. We’ll also be posting more sneaky album clips and info, so don’t miss out!


Be a part of The Final Cull...

THANK YOU for visiting our page and coming to see and hear what ‘The Final Cull’ is all about. With your help, we can prove that live studio albums are still achievable today for metal bands at all levels across the world. Not only that, but let us prove, when you hear this album, that they are well worth the blood, sweat and coffee. Most importantly, we can come to YOU and perform this album the way it was meant to be heard - LIVE and LOUD, and ON TOUR!


FAQ

Q: Where is the FAQ?

A: Coming Soon!!! Please comment or message us with any questions!


\m/ Feed The One Machine! \m/

However, realistically, all in, we are looking at something like £10,000 to really cover everything, so every pound we raise above our initial target will go straight into making The Final Cull as big, bad and brave as we always envisaged. Tour Support - This includes travel costs, accommodation expenses, everything that goes into making a tour happen. Of course, it’s no secret that buy-ons are now a standard in the industry, and setting aside some of our budget to this will mean we can come see you guys on some fantastic package tours with incredible bands, so you can come see us at some great shows with great line-ups. We’ve fronted as much of this budget as we possibly can, but we now need your help to get this album and this music out to the world, both in promoting the album in the press and online, but in performing it directly for metalheads and music lovers the world over. This album was recorded LIVE, because it was meant to be heard LIVE!...What You Get


Contribute today and upgrade later! Indiegogo makes it very easy to upgrade your choice as new perks become available. See this page for more info.
We're in the works with lining up some fantastic perks (hey, that rhymed!) for everyone who backs this project. Of course, you can get hold of the album in various formats - Digital Download, Digipak CD, Special Edition Vinyl - but we'll also be offering limited edition T-Shirts and other merch and exclusive experiences with the band, from Backstage Passes to Music Lessons. We've even got some quality instruments available. Alongside that, EVERYONE who contributes towards this project will get exclusive access to behind the scenes footage and interviews before anybody else, along with contributor-only updates and thank yous from the band.The Impact - What's so special about a 'live' studio album, anyway?We feel that many, many of the great records of history are the ones that were recorded in an organic, live studio environment. By this, we mean that the main core of the music - the drums, the guitars and the bass - were recorded together, at the same time, with members sharing the same room and the same space whilst hammering out the kind of high-intensity performances that you just don’t get from recording separate parts in separate locations. It’s become the standard now to lay down each instrument separately, to a click track, one at a time, in a way that strips away much of the humanity and depth that can only be created when the band members are performing together. There are good reasons for this, of course. One is time, ease and convenience, as musicians can fit recording around their other commitments by recording at home or at small project studios. The other is money. Sadly, very few artists and very few labels ever see the kind of budgets that made those classic records so great. The kind of budget where a band could write, record and even live together in a studio for the weeks or months that it took to make great music. We want to prove, by example, that with the right planning and the right people, and with help from the fans, bands CAN still make amazing live studio records on modest budgets. Not only did we record this album together, live together, eat together and sleep together (ahem) for the full 9 days (even WITH Chris’s ass stanking up the place), we even WROTE much of the material whilst we were there! That's right, a good chunk of these songs actually came together as the band were jamming in the studio. You don't get much more FRESH and ORGANIC than that beyond the whole foods aisle at Waitrose. Other Ways You Can HelpOf course, not everyone can contribute but there are so many ways you can help:
Use the indiegogo share tools to spread the word on social media
Tell all the metalheads in your local scene about us; down the pub, at gigs, send em a link, play them some of our music etc.
Post something on your blog about us
Post a message on your favourite forum or any online community where you’re active. Let them know about us, and why you’re excited about this release.
Plus, don’t forget to check our twitter and social media pages regularly, as we’ll be keeping you up to date on the campaign, ways to interact with us and other ways you can spread the word, such as facebook cover photos and other cool stuff. We’ll also be posting more sneaky album clips and info, so don’t miss out!Be a part of The Final Cull...THANK YOU for visiting our page and coming to see and hear what ‘The Final Cull’ is all about. With your help, we can prove that live studio albums are still achievable today for metal bands at all levels across the world. Not only that, but let us prove, when you hear this album, that they are well worth the blood, sweat and coffee. Most importantly, we can come to YOU and perform this album the way it was meant to be heard - LIVE and LOUD, and ON TOUR!FAQQ: Where is the FAQ?A: Coming Soon!!! Please comment or message us with any questions!\m/ Feed The One Machine! \m/

story:
Short Summary

What’s up!  We are LaRissa Vienna and the Strange!  As you know we are starting our life together not only as husband and wife but as this national touring musical project. 

We have come so far and our sole mission during this journey we embark on together is to bring the emotion that we find in music to those in the world that are open to experiencing it.  So we have decided to do something a little different leading up to the wedding. 

We are combining our efforts and asking our friends and family, instead of registering at some consumer retail outlet

We are opting to do a crowd funding campaign leading up to the wedding and broadcast our wedding vows to our fans world wide.  We feel that spending our money to further the fate of this musical journey would be the best way to show each other that we believe in the beauty that we each possess, Sooooo…..

What We Need & What You Get

We decided to go shopping for an RV that we can tour in. Most people will settle down and buy a house, OURS will be on wheels so we can tour with the band and truly acquire all of the tools to be successful on the road for the long haul. 

The needs of a touring band are many so we need a new video, a radio campaign, Publicity, distribution and of course the lovely expense of gas trying to reach each and everyone of our amazing fans face to face.  No matter what level you are at there is something for you.

Donate as little as $5 get the Single Package or toss in a little more and come have a night on the town with us for $75 and get the Girls Night OUT Package.  If you are really feeling frisky a donation of $750 gets you a 1 hour writing session with the band and a ton of other goodies.

The Impact

This project is a fun loving family friendly sound that gets people out of their seats.  By supporting us you are guaranteed to enjoy the benefits of of our music and personalities in a city near you very soon.  We wanted to truly take this time in our early years to go after our dreams before life gets the better of us.  We hope you enjoy the music because your belief in our art is what fuels the next album and the next!

Risks & Challenges

There are risks obviously to touring and we should be in a position to cover the cost of said risks quickly.  Insurance and the buffer is what we are saving now from the regular gigs we are playing.  

Other Ways You Can Help

There is a ton to do but with your help we can live our dreams through your support of this fresh fantastic union of heart, mind and melody!

Tell us “I DO” support LaRissa Vienna!

story:
Hello again!

Welcome to the pre-sale campaign for my first fully-produced studio effort, Break Me Down. The material for this record has been written over the last 3 years, and the album itself has been in the works for about a year and a half. I'm thrilled to report that we are entering the home stretch, and after months of hard work, a few setbacks, and a whole lot of support, I can't wait to share the final product with all of you.

Let's recap...

Back in May, I launched an indiegogo campaign to help fund the making of the album. So many wonderful people jumped on board in support, and in the end I raised over $7000 towards my goal. To all of you who contributed to the campaign, all I can say is THANK YOU! Your donations allowed me record the bulk of the album over the five days we spent at Afterlife Studios, and the results have far exceeded my expectations going into this project.

Summer put us in a bit of a holding pattern for production. We needed to schedule a couple more days in the studio to finish up vocals and explore ideas for extra touches to flesh out the album's sound. Festival season and summer tours saw the team scattering throughout the province, across the country, and all over the United States. I mostly stayed in Vancouver, busking heavily on the beaches to raise what was needed to complete the record. I'm happy to say that we have just completed another 3-day session in the studio to finish tracking, and we have welcomed to the team Tyson Naylor (Dan Mangan and Blacksmith, Tyson Naylor Trio) on piano and organ.

Pre-Sale Campaign

Since the completion of the first campaign, I've gotten a lot of great feedback and questions. A number of people commented that the deadline came and went too quickly, and asked if there was still a way to pre-order a copy of the album. A lot of the new folks I've met while busking have shown interest as well, saying they would like to pre-order if they could. In response to this feedback, and to help cover the last remaining costs of production (such as mastering, artwork and pressing), I have decided to use indiegogo again as a platform to set up a pre-sale option for the album.

Extras

Just for fun I've included some of the "perks" from the original campaign. If you'd like to be a part of the release of the album, you can pre-purchase 2 tickets to the release show along with your CD, or you can attend a private listening party with me, my friends, and some of the musicians who worked on the album. You can also choose from one of 3 signed art prints from Lauren Carr, who will be doing the artwork for the record. Or, if you really want to get personal, you can have me perform a private house show for you and your friends. You can find out more about these extras in the "Perks" section. By pre-ordering a digital download or signed CD, or choosing one of these extras, you're helping me in a big way to get the last of the work completed and get this album out into the world!

Welcome Tyson Naylor to the team, and meet the rest of the crew who have been working to make this album happen (clockwise from top left).

Wynston Minckler - Bass guitar
Paul Pigat - Electric guitar
Kenton Loewen - Drums, co-producer
Tyson Naylor - Piano, organ
John Raham - Recording and mixing
Joline Baylis Songwriter, vocals, guitar, co-producer

I first discovered Lauren's artwork last summer and instantly knew I wanted her to design the cover art for my album. I have brought back this "perk" for the pre-sale campaign, to share Lauren's amazing talent with all of you.

I have hand-picked three of my favourite pieces to offer as archival quality art prints. Choose one of the following, and receive an 8X10 print, signed by Lauren herself.

  • "Mermaid"

  • "Curious Ghosts"

  • "Swimmers"

You can check out more of Lauren's work at http://laurencarr.ca

If you are unable to pre-order or donate at the moment, there are still lots of ways that you can help.

  • Direct people to the indiegogo page
  • Share the campaign on your Facebook or Twitter
  • Email your family and friends around the world (this is most effective)
  • Spread the word to music magazines, websites, blogs and other industry folks about my album and campaign

Word of mouth is still the most trusted form of advertising, so if you think this project is worth supporting, please mention it to your friends and loved ones. Anything you can do to help get this campaign on people's radar is extremely important and so very much appreciated!

Joline Baylis is a Vancouver-based singer-songwriter, poised to take her music far beyond the city that has shaped her. With a voice reminiscent of Eva Cassidy and Ani Difranco, her original material is fresh, haunting, and deeply personal. Her lyrics explore the depths and complexities of her experience with honesty and vulnerability, inviting listeners to encounter and connect with their own emotions.

In the three years since Joline has been performing in Vancouver, she has crafted an intimate and powerful solo show. She has played in local venues such as Cafe Deux Soleils, The Railway Club and The Backstage Lounge, as well as festivals around BC, including Arts Wells and Harmony Arts Festival. Touring throughout BC and Alberta, she has performed at such venues as Nancy O's in Prince George, The Bear's Paw Cafe in Wells, Owl Acoustic in Lethbridge and Ellison's Market in Nelson, where she was featured in an interview on CJLY 93.5 FM.

She has also built a loyal following by busking extensively for the past two years, in beautiful and scenic locations throughout Vancouver. Joline brings her captivating live show to the unsuspecting masses by approaching busking as another chance to deliver a powerful performance, striving to create intimacy in an unlikely setting.

Now, Joline is taking her soulfully written songs to new depths and new heights, by welcoming Kenton Loewen on drums (Dan Mangan and Blacksmith, The Crackling), Wynston Minckler on bass (Bocephus King) and Paul Pigat on electric guitar (Cousin Harley, Neko Case). The band has played together at The China Cloud and The Media Club, and are currently starting production on Joline’s first full-length album, due out in March 2016.

If you have any questions about the album, the campaign, the packages, or anything else, please don't hesitate to email me at joline.baylis@gmail.com

story:
Several UNIQUE perks are offered:See the details in the right-hand column! --->


Résumé
  • Pour le 10e anniversaire d’existence de mon projet; Biobazar, je veux enfin offrir à ma musique un support fiable, haute fidélité et noble qui traverse les époques depuis plus d'un siècle, le tout dans un bel objet très graphique.
  • Depuis 2005 je pilote ce projet, je fais tout moi-même et je débourse tout de ma poches, tout les frais de pressage, de réplication, de mastering, la mise en marché, en passant par l’enregistrement, le graphisme, les communications et la visibilité (pub, clip vidéo, etc.), sans l'aide de subventions...sauf pour l'album "Ôbômkôntek" ou j'ai reçu une subvention de Musicaction, car l’aide gouvernementale au Canada, surtout apportée aux grandes compagnies déjà établies depuis longtemps, porte surtout sur la production, la composition, l’enregistrement et la mise en marché d’un album, mais pas sur sa duplication sur support physique. «Paréidolie» est déjà produit et ce à mes frais. C’est pourquoi j’ai besoin de vous pour m'aider à réaliser mon objectif. Avoir l'appui d'une communauté qui croit en ce que je fais serait le plus impressionnant des leviers pour me mener plus loin dans ma création et dans ma carrière, donc dans ma vie.
  • Petit aperçu de qui je suis : artiste multidisciplinaire et auteur-compositeur de musique électronique «chill-out», spécialiste d’électronica, d’IDM, d’ambient et de psybient. Fondateur du Net Label : Studio Stereo Records en 2005. Mon album «Festin Nu» ainsi que «Vitaphone» ont été en lice pour le Félix de l'album de l’année - musique électronique à l’ADISQ respectivement en 2009 et en 2014. Paréidolie est le 10e album complet de Biobazar.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez:

Voici le devis de production

  • Forfait pressage pour un vinyle simple + préparation
  • 2 matrices, 12 po, 33 RPM
  • 250 vinyles 12 po, noir
  • 2x250(chaque coté) full print label
  • 5 vinyles disque-épreuve
  • 250 jaquettes 12 pouces Discosleeve
  • Matriçage = 300$
  • 250 emballages sous film thermorétractable
  • 250 pochette carton simple
  • Grand total = 2200$ avant taxes
  • Ajoutons à cela les frais d’Indiegogo, de transport et un peu de publicité Facebook et on dépasse facilement 3000$

Plusieurs contreparties UNIQUES s'offrent à vous: consultez les détails dans la colonne de droite! --->

Si nous atteignons notre objectif ou (encore mieux!) que nous le dépassons, eh bien! Je promets, et ce, à mes frais la production d'un nouveau vidéoclip de BIOBAZAR et d'un nouvel EP (drone psybient) complémentaire à Paréidolie. 

D'autres façons d'aider

Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer de façon monétaire, mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas nous aider :

  • Parlez de notre projet autour de vous, passez le mot, propagez la bonne nouvelle : vous êtes les maîtres des réseaux sociaux, merci !
  • Utilisez les outils de partage INDIEGOGO !
  • Écoutez Biobazar 
  • Profitez de la vie

story:
Hallo wir sind die Jungs der F3 vom Djk Teutonia 
Mein Name ist Sven Pricken und ich bin Ehrenamtlicher Trainer und Spieler Vater eines Kindes .
Bitte schenkt den Jungs ein lächeln  ins Gesicht 

Da wir die erste F3 Mannschaft des Vereins sind und leider noch keine Trikots, Taschen und Trainingsanzüge würden wir uns freuen wenn ihr uns unterstützen könnt .
Unsere Trikots kosten 700 € mit beflockung.
Die Taschen kosten 400 € mit beflockung. 
Die Trainingsanzüge kosten 800 € mit beflockung. 
Wir würden uns sehr freuen wenn sie uns Kinder unterstützen damit auch wir uns wie unsere Vorbilder der Deutschen Nationalmannschaft fühlen .
lieben dank die Kinder der F3 des Djk Teutonia

story:
A couple years of composing, recording, mixing, designing, gigging, and more is finally coming to fruition.We want to give this album a proper send off and we need your help to do so.

One of our main goals with this CD release show is to come away with a professional video of the entire show. We will be able to use the video for future marketing and we can release the performance on our website and YouTube.

We were very privileged to have some of our favorite musicians join us to help take our music to new heights. These musicians include Mack Avenue recording artists Warren Wolf & Sean Jones and Pittsburgh native musicians: George Jones, Evan Hertrick, and Carolyn Perteete. Words cannot express how meaningful it is to us to have these amazing people be a part of what we are doing!

Right now we are completely independent and self-managed which is great because we are in complete control of how we want to present ourselves. The downside is we don’t have a record label’s funding to back our projects so that’s where we need your help. We have some great rewards to offer if you help fund this project. In addition, we promise the CD release concert will be one of the best jazz performances you see all year!

The CD release concert will be held in the theater of Manchester Craftsman’s Guild on Friday September 18, 2015 starting at 8:00pm

Here is a list of some of the expenses that go into getting this out to the world including our accrued debt for production costs:
- Recording
- Mixing/Mastering
- Artwork
- CD Duplication
- Travel expenses for the out of town musicians
- Payment for guest artists

And upcoming costs to put on a great CD release concert:
- Venue Rental
- Ticketing & Marketing fees
- Travel expenses for out of town musicians
- Payment for special guest(s)
- Pro Audio Recording of show
- Hiring Videographers
- Hiring a Photographer

And lastly the post-concert expenses:
- Audio mixing/mastering for video
- Video editing

Thank you all so much for your support! We can't do this without you and we will see you on September 18 at Manchester Craftsman's Guild

story:
Over the last 10 years, Daniel has written many personal songs. Without a proper audience they have laid in wait, rarely heard or shared. In 2014 Daniel set out to change this and Analog Existence was conceived. "The goal was to record an album, but we kinda started a band in the process." 

The point of this recording is to simply share it with everyone. Hopefully, it is engaging, moving, and thought-provoking. But it will at least be an enjoyable listen for everyone who loves good music.

Since the band started, it has been a journey of getting to know one another and making tons of new friends. Many of you have already supported in different ways. Now we are inviting everyone to be a part of this. To help us reach the goal of recording and to share it with all of you. 

All of the money received will go first toward the recording process. When everything is recorded it has to be mastered, printed, and distributed directly from us to you. Even if the cash goal isn't reached with this campaign, we are still pushing forward and won't stop until we get there. So, every donation gets us one step closer.

story:
Alchemy and Poetry 

"Alchemy and Poetry" is a melodic journey through seasons and time.
I have been dreaming of making this album for years. Many songs have come and gone through my idea of an album, but now I am at a comfort of the collection of songs I would like to share.This is also a wonderful time in my adventure of songwriting because I have great support from talented friends who volunteer their time to play with me. I am now lucky enough to have all the instruments and orchestrations I ever wanted for this album, as well as a producer who knows exactly what sound I am striving for. 

What It Sounds Like 

Sirens, folktales, gypsies and faeries. The album is a dark, piano driven adventure exploring fantastical stories.

Each song tells a story of its own, and as a collective they explore the tale of a traveller. You will delve into the world of a mad scientist creating her love in "Frankenstein", sailors meeting their fate with sirens in "O' Sailor",  and also hear some more personal songs I have written, like the song "Recover".

Please take a listen to a live performance of the  song "Frankenstein", one of the original songs on "Alchemy and Poetry" 

What I envision the album to sound like, only with better quality and live instruments: https://soundcloud.com/danasparrow/wishing-well-introduction

The Plan

We will be recording at  3 Pt Studios in Long Beach. The breakdown of studio time is:

$350/day for tracking
$300/day for mixing
$35/per song for mastering

It will take three-four days for tracking, two days for mixing.
I plan on 8 songs for the album.


With your help we can make this album a reality and share the story of "Alchemy and Poetry"!

story: On August 7th, 2015, our practice space was broken into and our gear was vandalized. There was over $3,000 in damages done. We are asking for the community's help in replacing the destroyed equipment. We thank you for all of your support.
story_txt: On August 7th, 2015, our practice space was broken into and our gear was vandalized. There was over $3,000 in damages done. We are asking for the community's help in replacing the destroyed equipment. We thank you for all of your support.

story:
Hey friends, it's your pal Huke. Since the release of my first solo endeavor Rustic Poet in the Spring of 2011 I've continued birthing stories in the form of song. I'm now at the midpoint of working on my next album Gravelhorse. This will be an independent release which I am working on in my home studio. Not having a record label provides the advantage of creative freedom. On the other side of the coin I have no financial backing that having a record label provides. 

As I'm sure you can imagine there are many working parts that go into being able to have a successful record launch. With this true grassroots effort it's lots of in house production of everything from the artwork on the hand stamped CD covers to the handmade leather-works therefore incurring much less overhead cost and I am very thankful for the many hands that are in this project and what they do for the love of the song. That being said there are still many costs associated with with the production side of creating an outlet for those songs. I work outside all year long to support my family as well as my music endeavors and we are able to make ends meet week to week but to be frank, it's hard to pull the trigger on expenses to further the music while we have kids in school that have needs to be met as well. If it comes to either creating physical merchandise or putting crumbs on the table... I'm sure you understand what decisions have to be made.

This friends, is where you come in... I've created this pre-order campaign to help provide an opportunity for your support which will actually make you an executive producer, which will be noted for all time in the liner notes on this album. I'm not shooting for the moon folks and your investment does not come without reward. With your help for the first time ever there will be merchandise to support this CD's launch.

++ There will be some exclusive perks only available through this pre-order campaign.  There are a few different options to choose from so take a look and see what might tickle your fancy.

If you are unable to support the project financially, you can still show your support by hitting the share button... help spread the word.

story:
Somos amantes de la Naturaleza, tenemos algo en común, la Montaña  y la pasion por lo que hacemos. nosotros somos 

Micher Quito

Alexander Estrada  

Higher Highline ubicado en Yanapacha montaña de 6480 metros msnm, ubicada en cordillera blanca .

6 dias de expedicion

necesito:

3 Porteadores por 6 dias 

Equipo de montaña para  - x   7personas

Alimentacion para los 6 dias - x   7 personas 

Transportes - x 7 personas

paneles solares, para cargar baterias de camaras y computadora

Tu dinero cera usado para cubrir todos estos gastos 

 Voy agradecer mucho tu ayuda...!!!!!
