story:
Short Summary

A little bit about us.
Well, my names Chris Hackett,
I am one of the assistant managers at Rhythm Fire Music School and owner of Bordeaux Artist Development Services. We work with youth all the time we provide lessons and services the average youth would not even know where to begin with. Specifically though, in the past year I've seen a lot of musicians grow and create art & emotions in our school, and I've seen about 90% of those musicians looking to record. Unfortunately though when we explain how much it costs locally a bunch of our students lose hope and give up on recording or we have parents that can barely pay the bills let alone pay $600-4000+ to record a music album especially when they don't know the impact of music as a musician. Its our food we eat sleep, and breath it.

We want to change that and YOU can make it happen.

We have a room cleared out and ready to go, we have a layout and are doing what we can to raise funds to provide not just this but a lot more awesome opportunities for youth in the area.
Such as seasonal compilations of local music to fund a local artist getting 100 free custom designed CD's because sometimes all it takes is those first 100.
If the studio is running we can provide those 100 CD's and a free recording session!

Even if your not local this is something that will inspire and help create opportunities for those that work so hard for it, and just can't cover it. 

What We Need & What You Get

Why do we need $3000?
Believe it or not $3000 may seem like a lot, don't get me wrong it is!
But when you break it down a new Stage quality drum set is going to run you around 1500, a new Gibson Les Paul is going to run you 2000+
When it comes to renovating, new gear, mics and much more 3000$ isn't asking much but its enough with what we've raised to make this happen.
What do you get as a contributor?
Our five top contributors will be given a free recording session at our in house studio, you can use it yourself, donate it to one of our in-house student bands or that local band that can't cover the funds to record, its your way to personally give back in the meantime and long run by helping fund a studio to stay.

What happens If we surpass $3000:

For every $500 past our goal mark we will personally record a local artist in need and provide them with 1000 Digital Download Cards to spread there music everywhere.
For every 1000$ past our goal mark we will personally provide a youth in six months of complimentary lessons at RFMS as well as an Acoustic or Electric Guitar!


The Impact

The impact on our local area could be huge. I know personally how many times as a musician I gave up on many projects and a lot of art & time because I couldn't afford to record. In this day and age it feels like a never ending circle you can't get shows without recording but you can't pay for recording without shows, thus getting you nowhere. At RFMS and BADS we already we provide shows to youth and anybody were not limited and there's no judging here just art. So help us get the last piece of the puzzle because who knows we might create a community, an outlet for teens and a way to express and maybe in a few years we can change the local area and provide some very needed new positive outlets for teens in the area!

All it takes is a vision, help us create it!


Other Ways You Can Help

All I ask is whether or not you can fund this sharing it is as good as gold because we can expose this to thousands even millions of people. an d lets say 1 million people saw this and only 10% donated just a dollar that's $10,000!!!!
Thats a full studio.
7 local youth getting 6 months of complimentary lessons and their choice of an acoustic or electric guitar.
14 students getting a free single recorded and 1000 digital download cards to spread their art around or even sell them for 1$ a piece and fund themselves!






Let's make a change.




Let's make THIS happen.

story:
THE PROJECT

This past winter, while attending the annual Midwest Band and Orchestra Clinic, Chicago Symphonic Winds came in contact with USBands. In our conversation, we were excited to learn that USBands’ Concert Series will be returning to Chicago on April 13 for a day devoted to wind band performances at Orchestra Hall in Symphony Center. In addition to providing adjudication opportunities for high school ensembles, this festival will feature headlining performances by some of the top local ensembles, and Chicago Symphonic Winds has been asked to perform. CSW is looking forward to joining with USBands for this performance in one of Chicago’s premiere venues, as well as helping to further our mission by teaching local high school ensembles about the tradition of the wind band medium.

While CSW is excited about the number of high school ensembles that will be participating on April 13, the high cost of attending a performance at this festival ultimately excludes many of the already limited music programs in Chicago Public Schools. Part of CSW’s mission is to promote and foster an inclusive community, and therefore we strive to make opportunities accessible to schools that otherwise might not be able to afford attendance.

As part of this effort, we are excited to be working with Ms. Shemeka Nash at Morgan Park High School. Chicago Symphonic Winds will be providing tickets to the festival allow the Morgan Park band students to attend the April 13 performances at Symphony Center. In addition to these tickets, CSW is looking forward to working directly with Ms. Nash’s students in a private clinic at Morgan Park High School to continue to help students learn about the rich music and history of the wind repertoire.


ABOUT THE MORGAN PARK HS BAND PROGRAM

Located on the far south side of Chicago, Morgan Park High School’s band program includes  beginning and intermediate/advanced level concert bands, a marching band, and a jazz band. Ms. Nash has served as Director of Bands for nearly 11 years, and has gone above and beyond to provide the best quality of education possible to her students.

Running a band program in an inner city school is never an easy task, but Ms. Nash and her students are working hard to overcome a number of challenges. The program works off of a budget comprised solely of student activity fees, which barely covers instrument maintenance and leaves no room for the purchase of new music or additional educational resources. Furthermore, it is rare for a student entering Ms. Nash’s bandroom to have exposure to instrumental wind music prior to grade nine. Despite limited experience, Ms. Nash strives to help her students reach a Grade 3 playing ability by the time they reach her intermediate/advanced band.

Since her tenure, Ms. Nash has created a jazz band at Morgan Park, allowed for students in the intermediate/advanced band to have group lessons to further their instrumental skills, and has ensured that students enrolled in marching band receive a class credit for their enrollment. Additionally, Ms. Nash has instituted a number of fundraisers to financially support the band program, and in 2009 Morgan Park and Ms. Nash received national recognition for the notable achievements within the band program.


WHAT DOES DONATING DO?

Donating to this fundraiser directly impacts CSW’s ability to donate these tickets to Ms. Nash’s students. As mentioned, the cost of attending the April 13th performances is quite high, and so financial support directly offsets the cost of each ticket we donate. In turn, attending this festival allows these students to meet and observe their musical peers, learn from ensemble adjudication, participate in seminars, attend performances by the top wind ensembles in Chicago - and most importantly, provide exposure and involvement to a rich musical opportunity that they might not otherwise be able to be a part of.

If we exceed our fundraising goal, all additional funds will be split between Chicago Symphonic Winds and the Morgan Park High School band program. These additional funds help secure future opportunities for Ms. Nash’s band program, as well as for CSW, including venue rental, musician payment, and funding for future commission pieces.


ABOUT CHICAGO SYMPHONIC WINDS

“It bothers me enormously that the wind ensemble and band medium is not yet perceived by our culture, by our musical establishment and by our tastemakers and cultural leaders as an important, viable, and integral part of this country’s musical life. … The next step must be the establishment of professional wind ensembles and band. … Where are all these fabulous young wind players going to go professionally? They can’t all become high school teachers, nor should they. … The symphony orchestras are full … a kid today can dream of playing in the Chicago Symphony because the institution of the symphony orchestra exists … Unfortunately, a young student can’t even dream about the wind ensemble because it doesn’t exist for the professional musician.”
-- Gunther Schuller; An address to the CBDNA National Conference, February 13, 1981, Ann Arbor, Michigan

34 years after Mr. Schuller’s address to the CBDNA National Conference, we continue to face the same issues within the wind band medium.

Dedicated to furthering the experience and tradition of wind music, Chicago Symphonic Winds was founded in 2014 to fill the need of quality performances of wind repertoire in the Chicagoland area. As a relevant presence within the community, CSW is actively involved in educational outreach and performances as well as partnerships with local businesses and community programs.

In its first year, CSW presented over a dozen successful performances that built on collaborative partnerships, focused on educational outreach, and teamed up with local businesses. Now entering its second year, CSW continues to gain support and momentum with larger concerts and more exciting opportunities to get involved!


WANT TO MAKE MORE OF AN IMPACT?

Tell your friends! If you are in the area, keep an eye out for our upcoming events! Learn more about what we are doing and who we are at: www.chicagosymphonicwinds.com and www.facebook.com/chicagosymphonicwinds

Please utilize the ‘like’ and ‘share’ buttons! They help spread the love!


With immense gratitude,

Chicago Symphonic Winds

As a relevant presence within the community, CSW is actively involved in educational outreach and performances as well as partnerships with local businesses and community programs.In its first year, CSW presented over a dozen successful performances that built on collaborative partnerships, focused on educational outreach, and teamed up with local businesses. Now entering its second year, CSW continues to gain support and momentum with larger concerts and more exciting opportunities to get involved!WANT TO MAKE MORE OF AN IMPACT?Tell your friends! If you are in the area, keep an eye out for our upcoming events! Learn more about what we are doing and who we are at: www.chicagosymphonicwinds.com and www.facebook.com/chicagosymphonicwindsPlease utilize the ‘like’ and ‘share’ buttons! They help spread the love!With immense gratitude,Chicago Symphonic Winds

story:
Español (English Below)

¡Muy buenas! Me llamo Josh y vivo en Santander, España. Formo parte de una escuela de discipulado (La Industria), soy líder de alabanza y soy gran fan del Liverpool FC! Llevo varios años llevando la alabanza en los Estados Unidos y también en España con un grupo de amigos molones (Proyecto EN). Sacamos un disco de alabanza con 11 canciones propias hace más que 2 años para regalar gratuitamente a las iglesias en España y otros países. ¡Fue una pasada ver hasta donde Dios lo llevó! 

Hace unos años empecé un proyecto como cantautor. Tuve ganas de compartir mi historia de una manera diferente de lo que estoy acostumbrado. Saqué 2 discos y disfruté muchísimo la experiencia. Aunque disfruté esa etapa, veo claramente que mi corazón esta con la alabanza y es una parte fundamental de mi llamado.

Así que te invito a formar parte de algo más que un simple disco. Con esto vas a formar parte de mi llamado en España. ¡Espero que sea de bendición para las iglesias y que este disco puede ser una herramienta para el avivamiento!

¿Porque quiero grabar un disco de alabanza?

No pretendo ser el más talentoso ni el mejor músico, pero estoy dispuesto a que Dios se mueva a través de las personas que forman este proyecto. La verdad es que tuve muchas excusas que me retuvieron durante años (soy extranjero, tengo un acentazo, muchas veces no me sale la doble "r", etc...).  Quiero ser una persona sin miedos, que desea traer el reino de los cielos aquí a España a través de la adoración.

He vivido experiencias impresionantes cuando los españoles cantan canciones compuestas en su propio idioma y en su propio país. Tienen una fuerza especial y quiero aportar más canciones así.

¿Donde va el dinero? 

Algo que siento muy fuerte de Dios es que debo hacer este disco en España. Quiero bendecir a los españoles con este álbum y también al increíble grupo de gente tan creativa que tengo aquí. Ellos me van a ayudar a sacar este proyecto. ¡Creo en los españoles y se que Dios quiere hacer muchas cosas a través de la gente de este precioso país! Estas son las áreas que necesitamos cubrir para llevar a cabo la grabación:

  • Productor, técnico del estudio y técnico de mezcla (todos españoles)!
  • Los músicos (hay mucho talento en España!)
  • Viajes entre Madrid, Burgos y Santander
  • La comida de los días de ensayo y grabación

Retos

  • Como vivimos en lugares diferentes, habrá poco tiempo para ensayar y alabar juntos. Necesitamos  que Dios nos junte de una manera sobrenatural. 
  • La meta es crear un disco de alabanza puro y duro. Tenemos que mantener esa visión porque como somos gente creativa, es fácil que nos desviemos de la meta con tantas ideas. 

Otras maneras de colaborar 

  • Oración: Aunque creo firmemente en la excelencia musical, mi prioridad es darle un buen enfoque a la parte espiritual. Puedes orar para que el Espíritu Santo nos invada en cada momento.
  • ¡Por favor comparte este proyecto con tus amigos en Facebook, Twitter y email!

English 

Hey! My name is Josh and I live in Santander, Spain. I serve at a discipleship school (La Industria), I’m a worship leader and huge Liverpool FC fan! I’ve been leading worship for years in the states and also in Spain with a group of friends (Proyecto EN). We released a worship album of 11 original songs more than 2 years ago to give for free to churches in Spain and other countries. It was amazing to see where God took it all!

A couple years ago I began a singer/songwriter project. I wanted to share my story in a way that I wasn’t used to at all. I released 2 albums and I had so much fun with those experiences. Even tough I really enjoyed that time of my life, I see clearly that my heart is with worship music and it’s a fundamental part of my calling.

So I want to invite you to be apart of something bigger than just a record. With this project you’re going to play apart in my calling in Spain. I hope that it’ll be a blessing to churches and that this CD will be a tool for revival!

Why do I want to record a worship album?

I don’t pretend to have the most talent or to be the best musician, but I am available for God to move through the people apart of this project. The truth is that I had tons of excuses that held me back for years (I’m a foreigner, I’ve got a strong accent, a lot of times I can’t say the double “r” correctly, etc…) but I want to be a man without fear, that desires to bring the kingdom of heaven here in Spain through worship music.

I’ve lived unbelievable experiences when Spaniards sing songs written in their own language and in their own country. They’ve got a special power and I want to contribute more songs like that.

Where's the money going? 

Something I feel very strongly from God is that I should make this record in Spain. I want to bless Spaniards with this record and also the incredible group of creatives that I have here. They’re going to help me make this project happen. I believe in Spaniards and I know that God wants to do lots through this precious country’s people! These are the areas that we need to cover to make this recording happen:

  • Producer, studio engineer, mixing engineer (all Spaniards!)
  • Musicians (there’s lot of talent in Spain!)
  • Trips between Madrid, Burgos and Santander
  • Food for the rehearsal and recording days

 Challenges 

  • Seeing as we live in different places, there’s little time to rehearse and worship together. We need God to join us together in a supernatural way.
  • The goal is to create a pure worship album. We need to maintain that vision and being creatives, it’s easy to steer off that path with so many ideas.

Other ways to support

  • Prayer: Although I strongly believe in musical excellence, my priority is to focus on the spiritual side. You can pray that the Holy Spirit wrecks us throughout the process!
  • Please help us out by sharing this project with your friends on Facebook, Twitter and email!

story:
Instead of being door to door whores begging for your money, love and acceptance The Mormon Trannys have decided to do what everyone else does and beg for money, love and acceptance on the internet! We're in the process of recording our second full length LP entitled, "Hymn or Her". We've already started recording at Cloud City in Portland, OR. Despite the fact that we're all incredibly good looking we don't have a lot of money. That's where you come in! We're looking to raise $3,000 which will go towards the recording, pressing and releasing of the album. 

Here's the cost breakdown:

$700 already paid for 6 songs we've recorded

$1000 needed to record the remaining songs

$500 for mixing and mastering

$800 for pressing of CD's and Vinyl. 

Here's what YOU can get!

$25 donation = Free Mormon Trannys T-Shirt

$50 donation = Free Mormon Trannys T-Shirt & Under The Boner of Heaven EP

$75 donation = Free T-Shirt, Under The Boner of Heaven EP, Divine Penetration LP

$100 donation = 2 T Shirts, all our previous recordings and a personal love letter

$150 donation = All of the things stated above AND free admittance to all our shows FOR EVA!!!!!!!

story:
About Stephanie

My name is Stephanie Wilson and I am an Inspirational Singer, Worship Leader and Song Writer! I've been singing for as long as I can remember and have come to understand that sharing messages, encouragement and sometimes education through MUSIC is not only what I am good at - it's what I am called and purposed to do. I am SUPER excited to start the journey of creating my very first SOLO project and would love to bring you along! My goal, through my music, is to encourage those that are discouraged, lift those that are low in spirit, empower those that feel like they are burned out and edify others through my personal experiences!  So I want to THANK YOU in advance for sewing into helping others! 

My Project

I am launching this campaign to cover the costs of the CREATIVE process of making an album. You may or may not know this - but it is EXTREMELY costly to produce an album with more than 5 songs PROFESSIONALLY! Ofcourse you can go into someone's basement and click around on a few keyboards and go into someone's closet and record vocals, BUT when you try to produce that, the unprofessional-ism with shine through. And I don't want that. Would you want to listen to something produced LESS than what is considered standard quality? 

So...I decided to take a shot at a crowdfunding campaign to allow YOU an opportunity to sew into the process and level of quality that I am seeking. The music you hear in the background of the video above is from Paul Richard. He is one of my VERY best friends and will be Producing this album with me. We currently have 10 songs on wax (that simply means we have done basic vocals and piano tracks to get the ideas of the songs down digitally). Now we need help getting to the next phase - which is actual production! 


What We Need 

Here is a list of what we need in order to get a completed album:

1. Pre-production fees 

2. Studio time for recording, mixing, and mastering
(This includes the live musicians needed to record, the live background singers to record, the engineers that are needed to record and additional producers needed to oversee the recording process)

3. Album Release Concert
(This includes the venue, the band, the singers, the lite bites, the photographer and videographer)

4. CD Pressing & Promotion 
(This includes the actual production of physical CD's and the promotion of the album online and in print)

The Impact

How many discouraged people have you come across recently?
How many music lovers have you come across recently?
How much would another POSITIVE platform improve the community and the world (especially in light of all the negativity that is easily accesible)?

I could go on and on. The reality is that my completing this project is a NECESSITY! Not only for me because it's my purpose - but because someone NEEDS TO BE INSPIRED, ENCOURAGED and EMPOWERED! 

And guess what? YOUR support will help make this a reality. This is also an amazing opportunity for us to collaborate as a community and make someone smile through music, together! 

What You Get 

There are some really special gifts for you that are ONLY available through this campaign AND some of them have limited availability! So be sure to read each one and pick the one that speaks to you. These are also GREAT gift ideas so don't be afraid to gift one of the perks to someone you love :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people are just not able to contribute, but it doesn't mean you still can't Help! Here's how:

  • Help get the word out on SOCIAL MEDIA about Stephanie's Campaign!
  • Take advantage of the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share the campaign with your CHURCH or COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION!

story:
Family and friends,

 

I have been incredibly blessed the last 22 years of my life because you have played a role in it. I wouldn’t be where I am today if God hadn’t put each and every one of you in my life! Thank you so much for your love and support all of these years! I really appreciate it!

As you know music is very dear to my heart. It is something that continually feeds my soul, and allows me to express my thoughts, feelings, and emotions. This most recent season of life has brought a lot of joy and trails. Through it my heart has been greatly tested but I’m glad to say I am coming out on the other side stronger. Over the last few months I have spent a lot of time alone with God and out of that time many songs have been written. There is one song that speaks to one my greatest struggle in life, finding my identity. The song is called, “Is This Who I Am”. I have asked the question, “Who Am I?” over and over again, not finding a solid answer. Finally one day while I was sitting alone with the Father I got my answer. The Lord’s voice spoke right to my heart saying that I am a child of the one true king.  In that next moment I came to terms with who I truly am. Though I may identify with many things, my identity can only come from one place, God. In Christ alone is where my identity is found.

This is the theme of my new album. It is going to tell my story, my testimony, through the songs God has put on my heart. I want this album to be heard. I believe its going to impact many people. That is where you come in. I can’t make this happen on my own. I need your support to get this project off the ground. Thus today I am asking you to come along side me and join in this project. I am asking for your prayers as well as financial support. For donating your resources I will gift you a free CD, as well as other surprises.

 

Thank you so much for your love and generosity.

 

Savannah

story:
Hi Friends,

I’m so excited to share my first EP with you! It has been a dream of mine for a long time to record a professional album.

My Story

Eight months ago, I quit my nine-to-five job, got rid of most of my stuff, left my hometown in Florida, and gave myself a fresh start propelled by my truest desires: music, nature, discovery, travel, and freedom. I was terrified...but I wasn't going to let that stop me.

I have since driven over 20,000 miles all over the country on my own. I've worked at Yellowstone National Park as a dishwasher and busser, worked with animals on a ranch, visited 15 states and tons of cities, played open mics, worked on my music, and I've done a lot of soul searching. This journey is about confronting fears, breaking free from expectations, searching for belonging, going after what you really want - even if it's hard or unconventional, and creating the life you want to live. 

It's a journey we all need to be on...which is why I'm bringing you along for the ride.

The Project

The album will feature songs I wrote inspired by my experiences through this journey. My vision is a raw, honest expression of struggle, beauty, longing, and personal growth. The album is now in progress at Basecamp Recording Studio in Bozeman, Montana with acclaimed producer and singer/songwriter Chris Cunningham of Storyhill. I can’t imagine a more perfect way to bring this music to life and bring it to you.

Listen to work-in-progress samples from the album here!

Where Your Money Goes

Your pre-order will help offset the costs of studio time, additional musicians, mixing, mastering, album design, album pressing, digital media, and marketing. With your help, I will be able to take this project to the next level, far beyond what I could accomplish on my own. Not only will you be able to enjoy the finished product before it’s released to the public, you’ll also be part of the process, get exclusive, behind-the-scenes updates, and hear the album before it's released to the public. I will be completely dedicated to this project for the next few months and will be using almost all of the money to my name to make it happen, so your support means the world to me.

Here’s the kicker: you only have until my birthday - March 28th - to take advantage of these perks! You can think of it as a birthday present you’ll get something back from. We’ll have a big online party to celebrate. :) 

My gift in return will be inspiring, relatable, creative music for you to jam to, cry to, dance to, or sing to (perhaps at the top of your lungs while driving on an open road…) and any of the perks I’m offering to include you in the experience.  

Tell Your Friends!

You can also show your support by sharing this opportunity with friends, family, colleagues, music-lovers, or anyone with a little wanderlust. 

Thank you for believing in me. Enjoy the ride! 

With love and gratitude,

Amber

   The Project 
The album will
feature songs I wrote inspired by my experiences through this journey. My vision is a raw, honest expression of struggle,
beauty, longing, and personal growth. The album is now in progress at Basecamp
Recording Studio
in Bozeman, Montana with acclaimed producer and singer/songwriter Chris
Cunningham of Storyhill. I can’t imagine a more perfect way to bring this
music to life and bring it to you.
Listen to work-in-progress samples from the album here!

Where Your Money Goes
Your pre-order
will help offset the costs of studio time, additional musicians, mixing,
mastering, album design, album pressing, digital media, and marketing. With
your help, I will be able to take this project to the next level, far beyond
what I could accomplish on my own. Not only will you be able to enjoy the
finished product before it’s released to the public, you’ll also be part of the process, get exclusive,
behind-the-scenes updates, and hear the album before it's released to the public. I will be completely dedicated to this project for
the next few months and will be using almost all of the money to my name to
make it happen, so your support means the world to me. 
Here’s the
kicker: you only have until my birthday - March 28th - to take advantage of these perks! You can think of it as a birthday
present you’ll get something back from. We’ll have a big online party to
celebrate. :) 
My gift in return
will be inspiring, relatable, creative music for you to jam to, cry to, dance
to, or sing to (perhaps at the top of your lungs while driving on an open
road…) and any of the perks I’m offering to include you in the experience.  

    Tell Your Friends! You can also show your support by sharing this opportunity with friends, family, colleagues, music-lovers, or anyone with a little wanderlust. 
Thank you for believing in me. Enjoy the ride! 


With love and
gratitude,
Amber

story:
Short Summary

6 years ago, Brian Gililland and Laney Coker began writing music together as friends. They called themselves "O Fidelis". Today they have been married for 3 years, and putting the final touches on their first full length album. But here's the kicker: they need your help to finish it. 

What We Need

The goal is to raise $5000 to be used for finalizing costs. This includes mastering, album artwork, CD and LP printing, and online distribution fees. What's leftover will be used to fund a music video shoot for O Fidelis' original song "Happy Song #2".

Risks & Challenges

We have been recording this record for over 4 years. Why has it taken nearly half a decade, you ask? Well the truth is: we're broke. We couldn't afford to go to an established studio, so instead we put our faith in some ridiculously talented friends of ours and tracked the songs whenever we could. And 4 years is the price you pay when you have no money and everyone has lives and careers they are pushing towards. It's been a long time coming, and we are finally ready to show the folks that have followed us for so long what they have been waiting for. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate, we totally get it! Word of mouth and using that little "share" button is just as valuable. Help us spread the word about this crowdfunding campaign!

story:
Straight to the Point


                 "Celtic Psalms" (Kiran Young Wimberly & The McGraths)
              Irish/Scottish traditional melodies with words from the Psalms 

                will be TOURING THE NORTHEAST US March 3-13, 2016!

                                                     And we need your help!

      Celtic Psalms builds bridges between divided communities, unifying  
 people through the moving melodies of Irish and Scottish traditional music
                and the uplifting, comforting, healing words of the Psalms.


       [Click the Youtube clip below for your background music, and read on!]



Our tour of the Northeast US will be March 3-13, 2016, and its purpose is to share Celtic Psalms with communities in the US and to offer fundraisers for causes significant to the communities we will be visiting.

We have asked that each venue help us cover costs by sharing a portion of entry, with the rest going toward their fundraiser. However, THE MORE YOU GIVE NOW, the more of the proceeds from our concerts can go straight into raising funds for causes!!

Our main costs for the tour are: approximately $2200 for the flights and $1000 for rental car/gas. We will be staying with family and friends to keep accommodation costs down.

                                    Any contribution, large or small, will help!

Here's a list of our tour destinations:

Friday, March 4th at 7pm – Miller Chapel, Princeton Theological Seminary, Princeton, NJ

Saturday, March 5th at 1:30pm – Doe Run Presbyterian Church, Coatesville, PA

Sunday, March 6th at 10:30am – Laurel Presbyterian Church, Laurel, MD

Sunday, March 6th at 4pm – St. Luke’s Episcopal Church, Alexandria, VA

Wednesday, March 9th at 6pm – Norfield Congregational Church, Weston, CT

Friday, March 11th at 7pm – Wellesley Village Church, Boston, MA

Sunday, March 13th at 3pm – Metro Baptist Church, New York City, NY



By supporting this tour:

  • You can help us share this beautiful music with a wider audience
  • You can help us continue to reach across community divides (read on to know more), and to encourage others to do the same in the communities we visit
  • Even if you don't live in the Northeast US, if we receive support this time, we are more likely to be able to plan a tour next time to wherever it is that you live!
  • Our concerts will be fundraisers for causes that people want to support in the communities we visit. We are not out to make money. We only want to cover our costs and join together with others to show compassion and care toward those in need.
If you're familiar with our music and its background, read no further - and check out the fun perks that you will enjoy.

                            We would be so grateful if you would consider donating!



The Bigger Story




I'm Kiran Young Wimberly, an American Presbyterian minister who lived for over six years in Belfast, Northern Ireland. During that time, I fell in love with traditional Irish music, but I couldn't figure out why I wasn't hearing more of it in church. In the States, Presbyterians break into Irish melodies without a second thought. But it took me a while to grasp that, generally speaking, Protestants in Northern Ireland don't do much traditional Irish music. They see it as something belonging to the Catholic community. And with the conflicted past of Northern Ireland, and the separation that still exists between these groups, Irish music seldom finds its way into Presbyterian worship services.

Yet, I was so completely drawn to these old melodies that I couldn't get away from them. They floated through my head, day and night. I was captivated. I became a 'trad' nerd, memorizing the names of the greatest singers, the airs, the fine differences between the versions, and their origins. Any time I was in the car, I had CDs from my trad singing class on repeat. I absorbed everything I could about this music - which of course, had once traveled across the ocean and into the Appalachian mountains and had influenced the very folk culture of my own American heritage. I felt like I was tapping into my musical roots: the music that touched my soul more deeply than any other.

But more than anything, I was struck by the sacred quality of this music. The soulful, heartrending quality of the melodies. The soulful stories of love and loss. I longed to hear this quality of music in the context of worship. These old songs reminded me of the ancient prayers of love and loss, joy and sorrow, hope and lament, that we find in the psalms.

So one day I sat down with my guitar, a psalm, and an old Irish harp melody floating in my head. What emerged that night in the quiet of my living room was my first "Celtic Psalm." After a few months I arranged another, and then another, and eventually, I had an album's worth of songs.

But I didn't want to record an album alone. I wanted harmony, and I wanted great Irish musicianship. When I thought about who I'd like to do music with, the McGrath family of Dungannon, Co. Tyrone, sprang to mind. I'd been enthralled with their singing at a service a year earlier, and finally I worked up the courage to ask them to record an album with me. Thank goodness, they said yes. In 2013 we recorded our first album with the brilliant producer and traditional musician Dónal O'Connor.

A month later, I moved back to the States. Little did I know - that was only the beginning. 

Since then, our music has been featured on Irish (RTE) television and British (BBC) television and radio. Our first album nearly sold out, and we recorded a second volume this summer. The BBC featured our music in a documentary on hymnwriting in Northern Ireland. For a second time, our music was featured in a televised Sunday service for the Week of Prayer for Christian Unity, which aired on the 24th of January. Click here to view it now (will be available until 14th February 2016).



Lifting Voices as One


People say they are touched by our music; that they feel inspired, uplifted, and comforted. The words of the psalms, combined with the soulful Irish and Scottish melodies, results in music that reaches straight to the heart.

It might simply seem like beautiful music, but in Northern Ireland, the fact that we are 'cross-community' - that is, crossing the separation between Protestants and Catholics in this post-conflict society - makes the Celtic Psalms project meaningful in a much deeper way. Through our music, we bring together musicians from both backgrounds, and we have shared our music at venues in both communities and in mixed gatherings. It is rare and significant when Protestants and Catholics come together to do music, and even rarer and more significant when that music is in the context of worship. Some of the most meaningful comments I've heard are: (from a Protestant) "I never thought these songs could belong to us," and (from a Catholic) "I never thought I'd hear our music in a Protestant church."

         Here, we forge a new opportunity for Protestants and Catholics to pray 
                   together through the psalms, and to lift our voices as one.

And in the meantime, we have a blast. We love doing this music together. The whole experience has been brimming with joy, laughter, and life. That picture right under these words? That was taken right after we finished recording our second album. See that rainbow? A sign of promise if there ever was one. 

That's our story.


And now, we are bringing our story - and our music - to the Northeast US. Though Kelly (the mom) lived here for a bit and Declan (the dad) has visited, it will be the first visit for Ellen and Chloe (the daughters and lead singers). We'll be starting in Princeton, New Jersey, and then venturing into Pennsylvania, Washington DC, Connecticut, and New York City.

Though we have invested in making this tour happen, we would be very grateful for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help


  • You can purchase our new CD online, or our first album, or sheet music!
  • Share this with anyone who is interested in #Irishmusic, #worshipmusic, the #psalms, #NorthernIreland, #peacebuilding or #reconciliation.
  • Let us know where you'd like us to head on our next tour!


Thank you so much for reading all the way to the end of this message! God bless you!!

story:
The Trio: Les Ordinaires

Les Ordinaires, a trio of critically acclaimed Baroque instrumentalists, brings to life both the grandeur and intimacy of quintessential 18th century chamber music and weaves the intimate expressive timbres of the traverso, viola da gamba, and theorbo into a conversational whole. My name is Leela Breithaupt, and I have the great pleasure of working with two fantastic colleagues and friends on this project - Erica Rubis on viola da gamba and David Walker on theorbo. 


The Project: Inner Chambers

Our first CD, Inner Chambers - Royal Court Music of Louis XIV, features music that explores the depths of human emotion couched within the formal and mannered style of the French Baroque period. Life at court was filled with strict hierarchies and social structures, lavish display of ornaments and affluence, love of allegory, and an affected nostalgia for the pastoral life and antiquity. At the same time, art sought to express human emotion in all its many shades and subtleties. All of these qualities merge in the music that Louis XIV enjoyed in the evenings in his inner chambers.

There were many fine musicians who played for the king's private enjoyment, known as les ordinaires du Roi, but it was the softly expressive combination of the traverso, viola da gamba and theorbo, called the Royal Trio, that accompanied the king's ritualized retirement to bed.   Although there are many written accounts from the diaries of courtiers describing these evenings, few recordings exist that try to capture the intimate spirit of these royal trio concerts. Repertoire on this CD will include pieces by Hotteterre, Couperin, Montéclair, de Visée, Marais and Lully.


The Research

Over the past year, we have developed this project through many stages: researching repertoire and court life, selecting pieces, purchasing a copy of the 300 year old flute that was played, rehearsing, and performing the program. This CD is the culmination of that artistic process. 


What We Need & What You Get

We are very excited to begin recording this project this month with our wonderful team of recording artists: sound engineer Jamie Tagg and producer, Jessica Davis. We are grateful to have received a generous grant from the Indiana Arts Commission toward making this CD. The maximum IAC grant covers $2000, and the total cost of making this CD is $10,000. We need your help in raising $8000 to complete this exciting project. Your donations will help cover the costs of sound engineer, producer, studio space, post-production, musician fees, CD manufacture and graphic design. Chose from one of our perks and help us reach our goal.


The Impact

We believe that audiences are yearning for a more personal and intimate connection to music and musicians. This recording tells the story of the king's private royal evenings and provides a seldom-heard intimate glimpse into the private realm of Louis XIV. Hearing the music performed in a declamatory way with the intent to excite the passions, listeners have the opportunity to immerse themselves in a uniquely intimate and historically informed soundscape.

story:
WHO, WHAT, WHERE, WHEN?

As some of you likely know, I am Kayla Howran and I am launching this campaign in hopes to raise enough money to fund the recording and release of my next full length album. 

We are set to hit The Bathouse Recording Studio in Kingston, ON with friend and producer, Colin Cripps in March 2016.  The Bathouse Studio offers the best in vintage recording and has been the walls which surrounded the making of Blue Rodeo records, Tragically Hip records and Kathleen Edwards’ records to name a few.  Colin Cripps is a Canadian guitarist and producer, as well as a member of Blue Rodeo and The Jim Cuddy Band.  He has performed with, produced, and written material for Kathleen Edwards, Sarah McLachlan, and Bryan Adams. 

WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM THE NEW ALBUM?

When I first recorded my debut record, Pistol, I had been exclusively listening to classic country music.  I remember being on tour playing DJ in the van when my drummer explained to me how imperative it was for my musical and creative growth to expand my music library beyond that of solely country music.  At the time I scoffed at him.  Over time I was introduced to CBC Radio and realized the great amounts of inspiring, current music and talent that exists.  In opening my ears to all of this new music and quickly growing into a fan, my songwriting and musical direction has naturally evolved.  

This upcoming album is premeditated, unlike my last.  In the past four years, I have learned so much and grown as both a person and a musician and you can expect this album to reflect that.  I have eliminated many of the distractions that used to hinge any personal creative achievement and I’m very excited about what I’ve come up with since.

HOW MUCH AND WHY?

The cost of making a record varies wildly and is dependent on many aspects of the process.  Expenses include the band, the studio, the producer, the engineer, mixing, and mastering.  This is where I’ve devised the $10,000 goal.  There are other expenses to consider however including photography, artwork, design, CD/vinyl duplication, the video, creation, and follow through of this campaign, as well as marketing.   

Alongside performing regularly, I waitress.  This has been supporting me financially throughout my entire music career and I’m saving my own nickels and dimes to put toward those other expenses not included in the campaign goal.  I’d do any side job on the planet (almost) if it allowed me the means to do what I'm most passionate about.  I feel lucky to be managing that.

PERKS!

There are benefits for your financial support as well!  They're called perks and each donation amount earns you at least one.

Jonathan Hall is a music connoisseur and visual artist.  You can find him spinning records and his artwork lining the walls at a little Peterborough watering hole called Spanky's.  Jonathan has agreed to design a limited edition Kayla Howran poster to use as one of the many perks you can choose from with your donation.  Another perk is to have the poster transferred to white pine board.  Photos will follow, so keep in touch!  You can check out Jonathan's work at www.trashjonny.tumblr.com and www.northernsoulartanddesign.tumblr.com 

Kate LeDeuce is a member of Canadian synthpop band, ROBOTEYES and founder of Atomic Film and Design.  She too, has agreed to create a limited edition Kayla Howran poster for this campaign.  This poster can also be transferred to white pine board as the perfect addition to your home/office wall art! You can check out Kate LeDeuce's work at www.atomicfilmshop.com and her band at http://robotey.es

A house concert is another perk and is performed within your home, office, backyard or wherever you'd like us really!  Because the performance is so intimate, it gives me the chance in-between songs to regale stories, give insight into my songwriting process, and try to tell jokes to make you laugh.   You are welcome to charge ticket prices for the event and that price would be set by you.

YOUR SUPPORT...

Your support be it financially or otherwise means the world to me.  If you can't donate to the cause please share the campaign in hopes it finds others who are interested in backing it!  If you have any questions whatsoever, feel free to email me directly at kaylahowran@live.ca.
Thank you so much for your time.  Wish me luck! xo

this campaign, as well as marketing.   Alongside performing
regularly, I waitress.  This has been supporting
me financially throughout my entire music career and I’m saving my own nickels
and dimes to put toward those other expenses not included in the campaign goal.  I’d do any side job on the planet (almost) if
it allowed me the means to do what I'm most passionate about.  I feel lucky to be managing that.PERKS!There are benefits for your financial support as well!  They're called perks and each donation amount earns you at least one.Jonathan Hall is a music connoisseur and visual artist.  You can find him spinning records and his artwork lining the walls at a little Peterborough watering hole called Spanky's.  Jonathan has agreed to design a limited edition Kayla Howran poster to use as one of the many perks you can choose from with your donation.  Another perk is to have the poster transferred to white pine board.  Photos will follow, so keep in touch!  You can check out Jonathan's work at www.trashjonny.tumblr.com and www.northernsoulartanddesign.tumblr.com Kate LeDeuce is a member of Canadian synthpop band, ROBOTEYES and founder of Atomic Film and Design.  She too, has agreed to create a limited edition Kayla Howran poster for this campaign.  This poster can also be transferred to white pine board as the perfect addition to your home/office wall art! You can check out Kate LeDeuce's work at www.atomicfilmshop.com and her band at http://robotey.esA house concert is another perk and is performed within your home, office, backyard or wherever you'd like us really!  Because the performance is so intimate, it gives me the chance in-between songs to regale stories, give insight into my songwriting process, and try to tell jokes to make you laugh.   You are welcome to charge ticket prices for the event and that price would be set by you.YOUR SUPPORT...Your support be it financially or otherwise means the world to me.  If you can't donate to the cause please share the campaign in hopes it finds others who are interested in backing it!  If you have any questions whatsoever, feel free to email me directly at kaylahowran@live.ca.Thank you so much for your time.  Wish me luck! xo

story:
Phase One is completed.  Now onto Phase Two.


The arrangements have been written.  Once again, Pete McGuinness has done an excellent job in making a seven piece band sound like a full orchestra.


Next:  the recording, mixing, mastering, art work and manufacturing.


In other words, the making of the record.


I can assure you that the quality of the recording and the music represented will be in quality second to none.


This is my fifth CD and there has been a real sense of accomplishment as to the way in which the music has been served.


Everyone associated with my projects has demonstrated top notch skill and the requisite passion to make these recordings memorable and enjoyable.


I hope you can help even with the smallest contribution to help us reach our goals.


Thank you very much.

story:
Hello friends and thank you for stopping by!!

I have some exciting news for you. I wanted to talk to you about my debut album I am working on entitled, “Journey to Love”.  Many of you know that I am a singer and you have supported me at several shows. The first question I am asked is, "Where is your CD?!" Each time I sheepishly reply, "it is coming soon..." You may be wondering what is taking me so long? Well, let me explain what happened...

In 2002 I was given a beautiful gift named Charlie and I spent the first 10 years of his life just being a working, single mother. I always loved to sing but I knew I had to be there for this amazing little gift so I laid music down for a season. All the while, the desire to follow my dream was still alive within me, but the time and resources were slim to none. In 2008 I, with the help of my good friends Anthony Jones and Jeffrey Mack (Antrax Studios), began to work on my first album, when suddenly my help was called away on a major tour with the famous "Pink Martini"! Who could refuse that?! As a result my first project died a slow death.

By 2011 I decided to take a leap of faith to start my own business coaching voice and pursuing music full time. Through many ups and downs I have had the opportunity to tour around the world as a background singer for Liv Warfield and the one and only PRINCE.  While on the road I became painfully aware that I was lacking in a very specific area. I discovered the main thing that separates a musician from artists is… you guessed it, a project. You must have a body of work that tells the world who you are and what you stand for if you desire to be a solo artist.

This is where you enter the picture…

I need the help of my friends, family, fans and supporters to finally get this project completed.   All the money raised will go towards production, musicians fees, studio time, and album artwork, and marketing. If we exceed our goal the remainder of the funds will go towards marketing and and distribution. I will be bearing gifts with your donation so I ask you to review the incentives and make your pledge today.

Over this 20+ year musical journey I have had many triumphs and setbacks, but I know the lumps and bumps I have endured were simply to build me into the woman I am today.  I am carrying a message of love, strength, forgiveness, and acceptance that I need to share with the world and I hope you will partner with me to do just that!

If you are unable to give at this time there is still something you can do to help.  I would appreciate you sharing this page with all your friends, family, and social networks.  

Thank you for your time, donation and for taking a  "Walk with me" on this Journey to Love. 

Love,

Saeeda “Mama Sae” Wright

story:
Short Summary

"Fru Skagerrak" is: Anna Lindblad, Elise Wessel Hildrum and Maja Kjær Jacobsen from Sweden, Norway and Denmark. We formed our trio in august 2014 - mutual love for Scandinavian traditional music from around the Skagerrak Sea and splashes from the Atlantic Ocean brought us together. All three of us are fiddlers, Maja is also a singer and Elise is also a recorder player.

Fru Skagerrak is unique as we are the only trio in the world with members from all three Scandinavian countries, all ladies, all fiddlers. Maybe you've heard of some of our other projects, such as The Duhks, LYY, Maja & David, and Gudbrandsdølenes Spelmannslag.

The name Fru Skagerrak means "Lady Skagerrak". Skagerrak is the sea that connects our countries and it has had a great influence on Scandinavian language, culture and music. We have a lot of fun exploring all the similarities and differences and we want to share it all with you!

To be able to do that we are recording our debut album in December 2015 and with your help, it will be released in the spring 2016. The album will contain tunes and songs from all three countries, as well as compositions by all three members, put into beautiful arrangements by Fru Skagerrak.

The funds raised for this project will go towards covering expences for mixing, mastering, cover artwork and printing of the album.

Making this album has been a dream of ours since 2011 when we met the first time at Tønder Festival in Denmark. It took us four more Tønder Festivals to realise what our little group could become, and a special bond was formed.

We have a goal: Spreading the word about the strong Pan-Scandinavian culture to the world. Scandinavia is a special place and Fru Skagerrak would love to be one of its ambassadors.

What We Need & What You Get

We need 5,000 USD to be able to finish the album. The money will go to covering these expences:

- Mixing: 1,700$
- Mastering: 900$
- Artwork & CD layout: 600$
- Printing: 1,800$

These are the perks we offer in return for your support:
(All physical perks ship worldwide)

1  Digital download of two tracks of your choice from the debut album - 5$

2  Digital download of the full debut album - 15$

3  Digital download of the full debut album + 2 fantastic can koozies with the unique Fru Skagerrak LOGO! - 25 $

4 Fru Skagerrak's debut album, signed by all three members! - 25 $

5  The Fru Skagerrak album pack: Signed Fru Skagerrak debut album + can koozie with the Fru Skagerrak logo - 40 $

6  The Fru Skagerrak mini CD-pack: Signed Fru Skagerrak debut album + 1 of the cd's from the "Exclusive CD-pack" (see perk no. 8) - 50$

7  Instrumental Lesson: Lesson in Scandinavian music with one of us! Specify who you would like your lesson with (Anna, Elise or Maja) and what instrument you play. If you don't live nearby, we can use skype :) All you need is a good internet connection - 60$

8  The Medium CD-pack: 2 Fru Skagerrak debut albums + 2 CD's of your choice from the "Exclusive CD-pack" (see perk no. 8) - 80$

9  The Exclusive CD-pack (collector's edition) - 120$
Includes 2 Fru Skagerrak debut albums + the following 5 CD's:

•  Maja & David: "NORD" (2013)
•  Maja & David: "CPH-Café-YUL" (2015)
•  Anna Lindblad: "Med Vänner" (2014)
•  Pelios: "Gourmet" (2012)
•  Gudbrandsdølenes Spelmannslag: "OSLO" (2015)

10  Skype Concert – 500$
Gather all your friends and get a 1 hour concert! Available anywhere - the only requirement is a good internet connection.

11 House Concert – 1000$
Invite all your friends to a special evening with Scandinavian folk music. Available in Scandinavia, or anywhere in the world depending on our tour schedule. Please contact us for more info!

The Fantastic Can Koozie with the Fru Skagerrak logo:



Maja & David: "NORD" (2013) "CPH-Café-YUL" (2015)

      


Gudbrandsdølenes Spelmannslag: "OSLO" (2015)


Anna Lindblad: "Med Vänner" (2014)


Pelios: "Gourmet" (2012)


Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our project, please help us by spreading the word!

- Share this page with your friends and network!
- Use the "share tools" to easily spread the word!

We appreciate all the support we can get.


--------------

Thank you and all the best from Fru Skagerrak,

Elise, Anna and Maja

story:
Short Summary

Big Shoals is a Gainesville, FL based Rock/Americana band. We've been a band for 3 years now, mostly playing around the Florida, Georgia, Alabama area the first 2 1/2 years, and now branching out to anywhere in the country we can afford to go to over the past 6 months. We released our debut album "Still Go On" in April of 2014 to great reviews, the first being in NO DEPRESSION stating:

**"This is a perfect example of an Americana Rock band."**

** "Well written arrangements and thought provoking lyrics are an understatement." **

Our plan for this album is to keep that momentum going and make the best quality album that we can possibly make. Something we can be proud of and that you'll enjoy listening to on repeat. The songs we've got in mind for this record, range from narrative story driven songs about the Civil War and Amelia Earhart, to heartbreakers, rockers and tales of broken dreams, as well as new dreams being realized.

  

What We Need

 We're trying to raise $4000 to finish recording the album, which is the minimum amount we'll need for studio time, mastering, and any guest musicians. *$1500-$2000 will go to studio time.
* $500 for Mastering
* $500 for guest musicians
*$1000 for pressing CD's/Merch/(possibly vinyl LPs depending on other final  costs)
Any extra funds raised will go directly to promoting the album.

The Impact

Every contribution made makes a HUGE difference.  We're not a band with a label or any financial backing. We're hard working musicians. We play any show we can, in any town that we can afford to go to and play songs that we believe in, for nice folks like you, making one fan at a time. Most of the time making enough to break even. We do it because we love it. Our goal has never been fame or fortune. It's to make a living doing what we love, and we're working hard to make that a reality. Without the potential funds raised here, it could take possibly another year, if not longer, to get this album completed and released.

We'd LOVE to get it to you guys by Spring next year.  

  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help! Give our FB page a like. Follow us on twitter @bigshoalsband. Check out our website at www.bigshoalsband.com. Buy our debut album "Still Go On" or any other merch in our store. Tell your friends about us. Come to a show! Give the link to this campain a share on your FB page. EVERYTHING HELPS.

story:
QUIEN SOY ?

¡Hola! Soy Martha Psyko. Mi pasión por la música inició desde muy niña y con ella llegaron mis sueños. Empecé a tocar el violín con apenas 8 años y desde allí no me volví a separar de él. Varios años después finalicé mis estudios formales de música y conseguí el que era hasta ese momento mi más grande sueño: audicionar en la Orquesta Sinfónica Nacional de mi país. Fui recibida y tuve la maravillosa experiencia de ser parte de ella durante 2 años. Pero un día sentí que podía llevar la música más allá de cualquier frontera, así que decidí perseguir este nuevo sueño:

Adquirí algunos equipos como una cámara, luces, micrófonos y empecé mi propio canal musical en youtube, donde cada semana interpreto melodías del mundo siempre acompañada de mi violín. Fue difícil al principio pero poco a poco el canal creció y ahora, en menos de 10 meses de abierto, ya alcanzó los 5.000 suscriptores y casi medio millón de visualizaciones; y, lo que es más importante, presenta una proyección acelerada de crecimiento. 

¡¡¡¡¡¡AQUÍ UN BREVE ADELANTO!!!!




Hello! I am Martha Psyko. My passion for music began when I was a little child, and with that started also all my dreams. I started playing the violin with only 8 years old and ever since, I did not get away from my violin. Several years later, after I finished my formal music studies, I worked really hard to reach the one that was so far my biggest dream: to audition for the National Symphony Orchestra of my country. I got in and I had the wonderful experience of being part of the Orchestra for 2 years. But one day, I felt I could take music beyond any border, so I decided to pursue this new dream. I bought some equipment like a camera, lights, microphones and started my own music channel on youtube, where each week I play music from around the world, always accompanied by my violin. It was difficult at first but gradually the channel was growing and now, in less than 10 months, I already reached 5,000 subscribers and nearly half a million views; and, more importantly, it has a rapid growth.



¿Cuál es el sueño al que te invito a apoyarme?

Ahora mi sueño es lanzar mi primer ALBUM como solista, para lo cual he elegido 12 obras de música académica para re-versionarlas con arreglos modernos tipo dupstep, música electrónica, disco, siempre respetando la obra base pero logrando una versión moderna y muy fresca. En estos temas he trabajado sin descanso los 6 últimos meses junto con mi arreglista. Después de estos meses de largas sesiones de grabación, finalmente estamos en el momento de la MEZCLA Y MASTERIZACIÓN para que el material quede listo y poder producirlo físicamente. Mi sueño final: compartirlo con ustedes.

---------------------------  

What is the dream that I invite you to help me? Now my dream is to release my first solo album. For this album, I have chosen 12 works of academic music to re-version it with musical arrangements as dupstep, electronic music, and disco. All this arrangements will respect the essence of the music pieces but also are trying to give a modern and very fresh version. In all these music pieces I have worked tirelessly the past 6 months with my arranger. After these long months of recording sessions, finally we are ready of mixing and mastering so the material is ready and able to physically be produced. My final dream: share it with you.



 ¿QUÉ OBTIENES TÚ A CAMBIO?

Sé que este sueño no se podría llevar a cabo sin ti y por eso, en agradecimiento por tu aporte siempre, siempre te daré algo a cambio. Puedes mirar aquí a tu derecha todas las opciones de aporte o patrocinio y lo que recibirás de mi parte. Desde el disco digital y físico hasta un concierto privado para ti. ¡Dale una mirada!

GRACIAS !!!!!!!

Finalmente quiero agradecerte por leer y comprender mi sueño. Éste es el resultado final de muchos años de ensayos, práctica y trabajo. Es un sueño de toda una vida que se va a hacer realidad gracias a ustedes.

                    ¡Me encantaría que seas parte de este sueño!

                                  ¡Muchas gracias por el apoyo!

------------------------


 WHAT YOU GET IN RETURN?

 I know that this dream could not be carried out without you and so, in gratitude for your contribution always, always I'll give you something in return. You can see at the right hand side of the page, the contribution or sponsorship options and what you get from me; such as the digital and the physical disk, or a private concert for you. Take a look! 

 THANK YOU !!!!!!! 

 Finally, I want to thank you for read and understand my dream. This is the result of many years of testing, practice and work. This dream of a lifetime can come true thanks to you.

                      I would love that you will be part of this dream! 

                                         Thanks for the support!

Después de estos meses de largas sesiones de grabación, finalmente estamos en el momento de la MEZCLA Y MASTERIZACIÓN para que el material quede listo y poder producirlo físicamente. Mi sueño final: compartirlo con ustedes.---------------------------  What is the dream that I invite you to help me? Now my dream is to release my first solo album. For this album, I have chosen 12 works of academic music to re-version it with musical arrangements as dupstep, electronic music, and disco. All this arrangements will respect the essence of the music pieces but also are trying to give a modern and very fresh version. In all these music pieces I have worked tirelessly the past 6 months with my arranger. After these long months of recording sessions, finally we are ready of mixing and mastering so the material is ready and able to physically be produced. My final dream: share it with you. ¿QUÉ OBTIENES TÚ A CAMBIO?Sé que este sueño no se podría llevar a cabo sin ti y por eso, en agradecimiento por tu aporte siempre, siempre te daré algo a cambio. Puedes mirar aquí a tu derecha todas las opciones de aporte o patrocinio y lo que recibirás de mi parte. Desde el disco digital y físico hasta un concierto privado para ti. ¡Dale una mirada!GRACIAS !!!!!!!Finalmente quiero agradecerte por leer y comprender mi sueño. Éste es el resultado final de muchos años de ensayos, práctica y trabajo. Es un sueño de toda una vida que se va a hacer realidad gracias a ustedes.                    ¡Me encantaría que seas parte de este sueño!                                  ¡Muchas gracias por el apoyo!------------------------ WHAT YOU GET IN RETURN? I know that this dream could not be carried out without you and so, in gratitude for your contribution always, always I'll give you something in return. You can see at the right hand side of the page, the contribution or sponsorship options and what you get from me; such as the digital and the physical disk, or a private concert for you. Take a look!  THANK YOU !!!!!!!  Finally, I want to thank you for read and understand my dream. This is the result of many years of testing, practice and work. This dream of a lifetime can come true thanks to you.                      I would love that you will be part of this dream!                                          Thanks for the support!

story:
What is Paul Klee: Painted Songs?

​Paul Klee: Painted Songs is an ongoing series of instrumental chamber works inspired by the visual art of Paul Klee and draws upon the wealth of inspiration from Klee's images, which are filled with musical references, textures, colors, and symbols that closely link musical concepts with Klee's philosophy of visual art. These compositions are musical settings of visual poetry, hence "painted songs."

Here is an example of three pieces performed by American Modern Ensemble at the 2018 Mostly Modern Festival:

To hear more of the music, visit Jonathan Posthuma's soundcloud page.
 

What is this fundraiser is about?

Several musicians and ensembles have expressed interest in Paul Klee: Painted Songs and are committed to perform selections from the series in the next 2 years. This fundraiser is organized completely on their behalf!

  • Musicians contribute $50 to be involved in the consortium.
  • They share and advertise the fundraiser among their friends and social groups.
  • Whatever we raise is divided between the projects (around $1,000 per project).
  • Funds are disbursed as musicians complete their project in stages.
  • If a project is cancelled, they receive their initial investment back and funds go towards the other participants.

This is a consortium of musicians, not a composition commission! By supporting this fundraiser, you support the work of dozens of musicians around the country and make these compositions a reality!

Who is involved?

  • Group 1 - Painted Song Ensemble (Saint Paul, MN)
    • Selection of premieres celebrating Paul Klee's 140th Birthday on December 19, 2019
      • Featuring various Twin Cities musicians in a casual concert / celebration in downtown Saint Paul, location TBD.
  • Group 2 - Allumer Quartet / Evan McAleer, horn (Louisiana)
    • Quartet IV
      • Excerpts presented at Texas Music Educators Association (Feb '20), Louisiana Horn Day (March '20), and other professional opportunities
      • Recording project in Summer 2020
  • Group 3 - Manhattan Experimental Ensemble / Joshua Weinberg, flute (NYC)
    • Portrait, Scene, and Symbol II
      • Premiere(s) in December 2019 / January 2020 in Mpls, MN and/or NYC
    • Gallery IVc (fl, cl, vln, vc, pno, perc) and/or Gallery XV (Flex-Ensemble)
      • Premiere(s) in Fall 2020
  • Group 4 - Kurt Hattenberger, saxophone (Minneapolis, MN)
    • Gallery I (selections for Sax Quartet / Choir)
      • Readings and/or premiere in Mpls, MN in Spring or Fall 2020
  • Group 5 - Shannon Murphy, organ (NYC)
    • ​Portrait, Scene, and Symbol XIX (organ)
      • Premiere in April 2020 as part of The Church of St. Paul the Apostle "Sacred Sounds" music series.
  • Alternates: Ensembles and musicians are welcome to join the consortium, but any groups joining after the launch date are only eligible for 50% of what the original ensembles would receive.

 

Why contribute?

Paul Klee: Painted Songs is a large and complex series, making it difficult to apply for grants and other funding. Additionally, some grants require partial funding before matching additional funds are granted. Because so many musicians and ensembles are interested, we want to share the project by combining our resources and supporters.

Our current goal is $5,000, which would fund 5 projects at $1,000 each.

Other reasons to contribute include:

  • Cross-disciplinary work between audio, visual art, and dance!
  • Educational opportunities for musicians who want to share the works in classrooms!
  • Supporting new music by living composers and hardworking musicians!

More About Paul Klee: Painted Songs

Each piece within Paul Klee: Painted Songs can be performed separately and is considered an independent, free-standing musical work. But, performers are encouraged to re-contextualize these pieces into "galleries." Like a curator of an art gallery, performers can combine these works in any order or number, interpolate them with other works by other composers, or arrange them for different instrumental forces. Currently, around thirty works are completed and over a hundred works are in progress or planned.

Major sections of the project include:

Solos (3 movement works for 18 wind, string, keyboard, or percussion instruments called "Portraits, Scenes and Symbols")

Quartets (2 movement works for consort ensembles, 4 flutes, 4 oboes, 4 trumpets etc., each quartet is inspired by paintings of birds or fish)

Galleries (5 to 9 movements works for mixed ensembles, such as Gallery II for Pierrot ensemble, Gallery IV for the "Quartet for the End of Time" quartet, or Gallery VIII "The Moon Dream" for octet)

Flex Ensemble (10 pieces for any size or type of ensemble using different forms of improvisation, graphic scores, instructional pieces, or conduction based on "magic square" paintings)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know any interested musicians or ensembles, please let them know it is not too late to join the consortium! They can contact Jonathan Posthuma directly through his website.

  • Attend our fundraiser kick-off concert on October 17, Studio Z in Saint Paul, MN
  • Attend Paul Klee's 140th Birthday Celebration on December 19, location TBD.
  • Share your donation to social media, explaining why you support new music!
  • Tell family, friends, or colleagues that may be interested!
  • Support each of the participating ensembles directly by attending their concerts, events, through a donation, or by subscribing to their newsletters!

Thank you!

story:
Hello beautiful human!

I've got a bunch of new studio songs to share with you, and the time has come to bring them into the world and make them real. I really want to give these songs their best chance with amazing physical media (including vinyl!) and a promotional campaign to help them get into as many ears as possible. You can help breathe life into this music, and I've put together a lot of cool perks and rewards to thank you. So please take a look at the different rewards on the page--I really think you're going to find something you love!

What's This Album About?

If you have been following me for any length of time, you know that I think music is a legit form of healing magic. When we hear a song that touches on our own painful experiences, we actually start to heal and feel better. We feel better because it finally lets us cry, or because it reminds us of how far we've come, or just because we finally feel seen and understood. Music lets us know we're not alone in our struggle. So--the short answer is that this album is about getting real and finding healing.

OK, So What Does "Shadow Work" Mean?

The phrase "shadow work" comes out of the Jungian pyschological concept of the shadow. Our shadow is all the parts of ourselves that we have hidden away for some reason over the years. Shadow work means showing up for every part of ourselves -- including the dark parts, and the parts that we pushed down because we didn't feel safe to share them at the time.

As we do this work, we get to understand ourselves better. Sometimes, this work is scary, because it puts us face to face with our inner demons. But when we look our greatest fears in the eye, we learn what's really behind them, and the truth can set us free. Shadow work gives us the opportunity to heal our wounds, and choose to live beyond them. 

This album is about my own personal journey with shadow work, and I hope it also brings hope and grace to your journey. 2020 really forced many of us to come face to face with our worst fears! I want this album to help you find the strength you need to get through difficult times, and to shine a light in the darkness. We have all had to struggle. But we don't have to do it alone.

What Am I Fundraising For?

Primarily, I am raising funds to make the digital and physical experience of this album as amazing as possible.

VINYL: I've never done a vinyl release before, and people have been asking for it for years. I did a lot of research, and also got feedback from you, to really figure out what would make it a supremely cool vinyl experience. What I've heard from you is that lyrics and production credits are a must have (I agree) and that a beautiful, exciting visual experience is really meaningful too. So I made those things a priority in my choices. 

CDs: I'm also doing a small CD run and I'm not skimping on that either -- if you have my last album, Rising Rising Rising on CD you know that it came with a beautiful ecowallet plus a lyric insert, and I'm going to be doing this CD at that same level of quality.  

Let's talk about artwork. I've commissioned Delia Stanley to do the artwork for the cover. She has shown me some early sketches and I'm so so excited -- this is absolutely going to be the most gorgeous art on anything I've ever released. As soon as the cover is ready I'll be sharing it here and on social media!

Physical media costs a lot to manufacture and ship - but it's really important to me to give you something really beautiful and special to hold in your hands, and play on your stereo. And yes, of course this will be released digitally too -- everyone who contributes at any level will be getting a digital download of both Mp3s and lossless FLAC files. 

T-SHIRTS, STICKERS, AND MORE: Overwhelmingly, when I asked you what bonuses would be special to have with the album, I got responses like: t-shirts, stickers, and buttons. Your wish is my command. If you've bought a shirt or other apparel from me before, you know I care a lot about making sure that it's something that feels great to wear -- as well as fair manufacturing practices that do not involve sweatshop labor. I've done the research and found really great providers to bring high quality, awesome merch your way.

PROMOTION TO GIVE THESE SONGS THEIR BEST CHANCE: My dad and I have spent the last several years working incredibly hard on these songs in the studio, and it's been an absolute labor of love for both of us. I want to honor these songs by putting them out into the world as powerfully as possible. I have found someone I know and trust to help me get them onto radio and playlists -- and ultimately into more ears. I believe my life's work is to connect and heal through music. By being a part of this album, you are helping me live that calling.

So...Go Pick Out Something Nice For Yourself!

Over the last few months I've been using social media and email to ask what would be most exciting and delightful to you. I've paid close attention and I've come up with a list of rewards and perks that I think you'll really love. If there's something that's NOT here that you want to see, please tell me! If I possibly can, I want to make it happen for you.

Thank you for being on this journey with me. I'm so grateful that you're in my world, and we get to share this magic together.

story:
Short Summary

Being a creative entrepreneur can be challenging but I am committed to constantly find new ways to bring my vision to life to entertain the world. By sponsoring this campaign you will help me complete my sophomore album, Harder 2 Love.  

My name is Richard "Rich Prince" Daniel and I am a South Florida -based entrepreneur and the founder of Visionary Music Creators. As a multi-talented creator, I spend my days navigating the South Florida entertainment scene as a rapper, singer, songwriter, harmonizer, influencer, producer, and creative director.  I have been involved in music from a young age as an active participant in my local church choir and an enthusiastic drum major in a local band. After exploring various career paths, in 2008 I took the plunge to further explore my music career.

After evaluating whether to dedicate my time to music or sports. My passion for music superseded, and eventually, I became fully consumed with music and entertainment. My current break out song, “TikTok” has gained local and international attention for its fun and true representation of the vibe and cultural diversity of the Miami music scene.

I can relate to the struggles of building from the bottom up and I am passionate about visiting as many Cities as possible across the world to help to support small local businesses. There are many motivated and driven business owners who may sometimes lack the resources and are rarely given the opportunity to take their product to the next level. I believe in creating opportunities for these businesses to help them grow. I look forward to partnering with these businesses to promote their art/service/product.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to complete the Harder 2 Love Album and fund the upcoming multi city tour. So far, six songs are ready to go but we need funding to complete another six tracks.  

  • Pay for studio time to record the last six songs (~$2000)
  • Pay for producing, recording, and mixing all six songs (~$5,000)
  • Get the album mixed & mastered (~$2000)
  • Professional photos to help with the promotion of the album (~$1000)
  • Album marketing and promotions (~$ 3000)
  • Album distribution (~$2000)
  • Make a music video (~$4000)
  • Begin Multi City Tour (~$6000)

We appreciate any size contribution and we hope to see you in your City soon.

The Impact

If we don't reach the goal we will delay the time between each tour as we continue to fundraise to cover the tour expenses. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate you taking the time to learn about the Harder 2 Love Tour. Please spread the word to help us reach out target. Share this campaign on your socials, or take it a step further by telling your philanthropic friends and family.

FOLLOW  @iamrichprince on | Instagram | Facebook | Spotify | YouTube | Twitter

LIKES, SHARES, COMMENTS go a long way!
