story:
Hola.

Soy Alejandro Biel, guitarrista y compositor de The Wall.

Con ya más de veinte años componiendo y tocando por toda España, The Wall y la música han sido mi pasión. El grupo se formó en los 90, en Montalbán (Teruel), tenemos ya 3 discos creados y varios conciertos a nuestras espaldas.

El grupo lo componen Oscar (cantante y guitarra), Boris (bajo), Edu (teclados y bateria) y Alejandro (guitarra) perfilando un estilo heterogéneo pero siempre enmarcado en un estilo pop rock cantado en castellano.

Este será nuestro cuarto disco "estrellas en el muro". Disco completamente conceptual, una obra que tiene que ser entendida como algo grandioso, un recorrido vital, un momento concreto en el tiempo, una historia en la que se ven reflejadas las vivencias, la evolución de una persona, un despertar, una ilusión, pero también su contraparte más cínica y pesimista.

Debido al tamaño y al número de canciones, el CD será doble, resulta imprescindible para hablar de todo aquello que nos apasiona, nos hace felices, nos pone tristes, nos hace reir y un largo etc... Toda una vida en la que atravesaremos varias fases, descubriremos el mundo y veremos su lado mas optimista y pesimista, las 2 caras de la historia.

Queremos que nos ayudéis con este proyecto tan complejo, tan importante y tan ilusionante.

Es un proyecto que lleva 10 años en mi cabeza, la idea de transmitir un concepto, una historia. Amasando ideas, letras, acordes..., todo que confluya en una obra que esperamos de corazón os guste tanto como a nosotros.

Que necesitamos.

Necesitamos de vuestra ayuda para hacer realidad el proyecto, se necesita mucho dinero para producir, editar y finalmente crear el CD físico.

Que obtendreis

Vamos a ofrecer diversas modalidades para conseguir "estrellas en el muro", desde una ayuda desinteresada, pasando por el CD físico, la descarga digital, una camiseta con el logo, una "clase privada", obtener otros CDs de The Wall.

El reto

Estrellas en el muro no va a ser un CD mas, no son canciones cualquiera, es una historia, una vida plasmadas en bastantes canciones.

Para las personas que nos ayudéis y coopereis, tendréis regularmente un video, en el cual se hablará de una canción y ayudará a identificar el contexto en el que se enmarca, daré unas pinceladas del tema, hablaré de como se creó, de que habla, etc...., para que ayude a entender toda la obra en su conjunto.

Otras maneras de ayudar.

Os agradeceríamos a todos darle la máxima difusión para que pueda llegar a la máxima gente posible, ya sea en redes sociales o boca a boca.

Gracias por anticipado por tu colaboración.
story_txt:
Hola.
Soy Alejandro Biel, guitarrista y compositor de The Wall.
Con ya más de veinte años componiendo y tocando por toda España, The Wall y la música han sido mi pasión. El grupo se formó en los 90, en Montalbán (Teruel), tenemos ya 3 discos creados y varios conciertos a nuestras espaldas.
El grupo lo componen Oscar (cantante y guitarra), Boris (bajo), Edu (teclados y bateria) y Alejandro (guitarra) perfilando un estilo heterogéneo pero siempre enmarcado en un estilo pop rock cantado en castellano.
Este será nuestro cuarto disco "estrellas en el muro". Disco completamente conceptual, una obra que tiene que ser entendida como algo grandioso, un recorrido vital, un momento concreto en el tiempo, una historia en la que se ven reflejadas las vivencias, la evolución de una persona, un despertar, una ilusión, pero también su contraparte más cínica y pesimista.
Debido al tamaño y al número de canciones, el CD será doble, resulta imprescindible para hablar de todo aquello que nos apasiona, nos hace felices, nos pone tristes, nos hace reir y un largo etc... Toda una vida en la que atravesaremos varias fases, descubriremos el mundo y veremos su lado mas optimista y pesimista, las 2 caras de la historia.
Queremos que nos ayudéis con este proyecto tan complejo, tan importante y tan ilusionante.
Es un proyecto que lleva 10 años en mi cabeza, la idea de transmitir un concepto, una historia. Amasando ideas, letras, acordes..., todo que confluya en una obra que esperamos de corazón os guste tanto como a nosotros.
Que necesitamos.
Necesitamos de vuestra ayuda para hacer realidad el proyecto, se necesita mucho dinero para producir, editar y finalmente crear el CD físico.

Que obtendreis
Vamos a ofrecer diversas modalidades para conseguir "estrellas en el muro", desde una ayuda desinteresada, pasando por el CD físico, la descarga digital, una camiseta con el logo, una "clase privada", obtener otros CDs de The Wall.

El reto
Estrellas en el muro no va a ser un CD mas, no son canciones cualquiera, es una historia, una vida plasmadas en bastantes canciones.
Para las personas que nos ayudéis y coopereis, tendréis regularmente un video, en el cual se hablará de una canción y ayudará a identificar el contexto en el que se enmarca, daré unas pinceladas del tema, hablaré de como se creó, de que habla, etc...., para que ayude a entender toda la obra en su conjunto.

Otras maneras de ayudar.
Os agradeceríamos a todos darle la máxima difusión para que pueda llegar a la máxima gente posible, ya sea en redes sociales o boca a boca.
Gracias por anticipado por tu colaboración.

story:
Hey!

I'm CAT, a 22-year-old singer/songwriter from Chicago living in Los Angeles. I identify as New Wave and Psych Pop. I've been writing music for over ten years in my journals and on piano. My music is heavily inspired by 70's and 80's pop culture, artists and musicians such as Prince, David Bowie, Blondie, The Carpenters, Fleetwood Mac, Nancy Sinatra and Van Halen with modern influencers such as Charli XCX, Carly Rae Jepson, Tennis and Angel Olsen.  

One of my favorite things about creating music is exploring and experimenting with different styles. I have FOUR songs I'm hoping to record and release that play around with DIFFERENT vibes and influences while still being fun and true to my writing. I'm hoping to bring back classic elements from cool earlier eras and merge them with a modern sound.   

I need YOUR help! 

Recording and producing each song is $900 plus $350 for mixing and $70 for mastering. I'm looking to raise $6,000 to record the four songs for digital release. I need to compensate other musicians and artists, as well as get some merch out there! Music and writing is my world and achieving this project would be a dream. It would also get some pretty catchy tunes out in the world and let me not eat only soup. 

There are some cool and fun perks to make things a lil more exciting including a free digital download of the songs. $1, 440 is the benchmark for each new song so it's up to us, my dear friends, to how many songs will get released this year! If you can't donate, no fret! We're still friends! I just ask if you could share with your friends, families, co-workers, and strangers at the bar to help spread the word!!

story:
Want to help produce the next Jane Getter Premonition album? 

JGP’s next album will continue my exploration of progressive rock/jazz. I’m really excited about my new music; the songs have power, heart and soul. I always love the writing process and can't wait to see it all come to life!

With your support, we’ll record and release the new album by the end of 2019. We hope you’ll join us on the journey by donating and/or spreading the word!

 

WHO IS JANE GETTER PREMONITION?

I’m Jane Getter - guitarist, composer, singer and bandleader. The guitar has always been it for me. When I was eight, I had the privilege of taking piano lessons, but I would secretly spy on my sister's guitar lessons. I felt pulled toward that instrument. The sounds it made and the strumming of the strings fascinated me. My parents eventually got the message and let me switch to guitar. I never looked back. By high school, I was writing my own music. When I saw Bonnie Rait, my first female role model, I saw something beyond strumming chords and singing, and started playing more intricate guitar riffs, phrases and solos. 

The many different kinds of music I love and appreciate come together organically in my eclectic style, from rock to jazz, metal to singer-songwriter, world music to blues and funk to classical. My playing and touring background has given me the opportunity to explore a range of styles and sounds while working with NBC's SNL Band, Brother Jack McDuff, Ursala Dudziak, The Roots the jam, Lenny White of Return to Forever, Jaimoe of the Allman Brothers and many more. Winning ASCAP’s Award for Music for Theatre and Dance was a high point for me; I don’t think my eight-year old self imagined winning an award as a composer!

My Band:

  • Keyboards - Adam Holzman currently plays and tours in Steven Wilson’s band. A former musical director and keyboard player for Miles Davis, Adam is also the son of Elektra Records founder, Jac Holzman. 
  • Guitar - Alex Skolnick plays in the band  Testament and has played with Ozzy Osbourne. In addition to his metal roots, he has performed with his jazz trio in festivals around the world.
  • Drums - Chad Wackerman spent ten years working with Frank Zappa. He has recorded and toured with Alan Holdsworth, Steve Vai and James Taylor, among others. 
  • Bass - Mark Egan has recorded and toured with Pat Metheny, Gil Evans, Stan Getz, Sting and so many more. 
  • -Stu Hamm is known for his live and session work for numerous artists including Joe Satriani and Steve Vai.
  • Vocals and other special guest artists TBA! Watch for updates!

 

Press Quotes:

"... the fieriest fret-boarding female ever to strap on a Stratocaster"...Guitar Player Magazine

 “.... an impeccable guitarist and a fine singer"...Rebel Noise

  "... a superb, genre-bending guitarist equally at home in the jazz-rock, progressive and singer-songwriter realms"...Anil Prasad / Innerviews

      “... electrifying brilliant blazing  -Jane Getter Premonition”...Contemporary Fusion Reviews

 

THE CAMPAIGN:

This will be my sixth album, and each time, recording my original music and having my vision realized is an amazing process. It’s always a thrill to hear my music played by my incredible band. As a professional musician for most of my adult life, I’m experienced in the process of making an album from start to finish, so this recording will happen! We hope that your support will be a vital part of our new music!

WHY AM I DOING THIS?

A fan messaged me to say, “You have given me such musical pleasure.” Many others ask eagerly when our next studio album is coming out. I’m so grateful for fans like these!

New songs and albums take time to create, evolve and produce. They also take money. With the huge changes in the music industry, artists are figuring out how to fund their projects and get them out into the world. Crowd funding this project means I get to interact more closely with people who love my music and oversee the whole creative process! This campaign and your contributions give me the gift of bringing my new music to life!

What We Need:

Our goal is $15,000, which will allow us to make the album from rehearsals and recording through production and promotion. The $15,000 goes to:

1) Studio costs - $2500

2) Musician and engineer salaries  - $6000

3) Artwork - $500

4) CD manufacturing - $1000

5) Mixing and mastering - $3000

6) Promotion -  $2000

We will get into the studio and start recording as soon as we are financially able. If we don’t reach our goal of $15,000, we will record as many songs as we can and release an EP!

What you get:

Every contribution over $15 to this campaign receives a perk! You can get involved and get cool stuff! Some of the perks include:

  • Pre-release digital download
  • Signed  pre-release CD
  • Guitar lessons
  • T-shirts
  • My back catalog of CD"s
  • Vinyl copy of "ON"
  • VIP passes to shows, plus meet and greet and sound check admittance 
  • Copies of original demos of songs
  • Input on deciding the song order of the CD 
  • House concert
  • Executive Producer title
  • Lunch with me in NY! 

Look to the right for more info on the perks and support levels!

Jane Getter CD Catalog 

JGP T Shirts 

"ON" Vinyl

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support financially, but everyone who wants to, can support! Spreading the word about the campaign and about Jane Getter Premonition helps us find new fans and supporters.  The Indiegogo share tools make sharing easy! If you have a blog or write for a music or culture mag or want to interview Jane and share the fundraising campaign, get in touch!

If you'd like to donate without using a credit card, please contact us directly.

Pre-release digital download

Spreading the word about the campaign and about Jane Getter Premonition helps us find new fans and supporters.  The Indiegogo share tools make sharing easy! If you have a blog or write for a music or culture mag or want to interview Jane and share the fundraising campaign, get in touch!
If you'd like to donate without using a credit card, please contact us directly.

story:
Summary

Hello all, my name is Mimi Nichole I have been singing, acting, and dancing since the age of 5. My foundation is rooted from the church, as I began to grow up I started to explore the ins and outs of my musicality by writing about life experiences and branching out to sing different genres of music. I am so happy to say that because of my exploration, I was blessed to turn songs that have been recorded over the past five years of my life into an album and I cant wait for you all to listen and enjoy ! 

This campaign holds great significance to me because of the hard work and dedication it took me to get to this point. As an artist I had to understand that I can not do this alone. My supporters have been patiently waiting on the release of the project and with your support a successful release will be possible.

I have always dreamed of being a performer and with your contributions you are bringing me steps closer to that dream coming true & for that I am very thankful ! 

How Funds Will Be Used & What You Get

The funds from pre-sales will help pay for CD duplication, posters, promotion, and merchandise.

You can pre-order:

A Digital download of the album

Physical CD's

Tickets to the album release

T-shirts

Posters

Young Dreamers Foundation

A percentage of album release ticket sales will also be used to help establish my foundation.

The Young Dreamers Foundation’s mission is to provide underserved youth with essential resources in order to help them develop their creative skill sets, regardless of their financial circumstances.

1. The foundation will help connect young artists with mentors in their respective field of interest.

2. Provide young artists with training in their craft.

3. Help pay for instruments and creative tools they otherwise could not afford.

4. All Young Dreamers will be provided with tutoring, if needed, to help maintain a high GPA

Qualifications to be a Young Dreamer

- Young Dreamers must uphold a 2.5 GPA

- Have a strong interest in the Arts 

- Complete an entry essay 

- Complete an in person / video interview 

- Overall family must fall below the poverty line; Household income must be $45,000 or  below yearly 

Risks & Challenges

People value transparency and we want to be transparent.

One of the biggest risk and challenges may be a slight change in the timeline. Sometimes mixes take longer for engineers to finish. Sometimes the merchandise graphics have to be tweaked and re-uploaded. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and thats understandable, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

One of the greatest ways you can still help is by getting the word out and sharing this campaign with your friends and family on social media.

story:
Hello! I'm RRO keyboardist and composer Gregg Fox. I just want to say thank you for helping me create something quite miraculous in the world of music! With the help and support of SO many of you through our first Kickstarter crowdfunding campaign the Renaissance Rock Orchestra was able to record and release an amazing album called "In Times Of Olde". This groundbreaking record featured performances by rock artists from legendary bands like AC/DC, Guns N Roses, Ozzy, Foreigner, Black Sabbath, YES, Heart & Whitesnake and has received rave reviews world wide!

 

 

We were even able to enlist Rock and Roll Hall Of Fame inductees from Yes & Heart  drummer Alan White and guitarist Howard Leese to join us on the record and the result was magical! "In Times Of Olde" has been praised by fans and reviewers around the globe and it has help create a super group of remarkable artists that is now preparing to tour worldwide...AND WE'D LIKE TO DO IT FOR YOU AGAIN on a new record called "Magic In The Air"!

HERE'S JUST A FEW TESTIMONIALS FROM OUR FANS!

“The amazing energy of brilliant rock musicians coupled with intricate and melodic arrangements make Renaissance Rock Orchestra a powerhouse group” - Jim Ervin, President, Warrior Records

"Unbelievable!! This is amazing!” - Phil Anderson

"It’s an AMAZING album! I love every song!” - Joanne Beverina Bilodeau

“Beautiful orchestral Rock and Roll majesty rolled into an all-star line up of players…. superb job!" - Adam Nicholson

“True musical mastery" - AlterMan

 Listen to a SAMPLER of RRO's last release "IN Times OF Olde"! :-) 

Please click here to take a look at the  ARTIST PRESENTATION DECK we prepared for the tour!

 

 

We'd like to move forward with a new record for you called "Magic In The Air"!

I have a VERY exciting line-up of rockstars who will perform on the new record along with many of your favorite and beloved artists from our prestigious list of world-class RRO alumni talent from the first 2 records! WHO WILL BE ON THE NEW RECORD?!!!!  

BECOME A CONTRIBUTOR AND YOU will be the FIRST to find out as the record is recorded!

The costs to produce a record of this quality and with artists of this caliber and notoriety make this a challenging proposition! Here's how we propose to do it.

It will be approximately $15,000 to record, produce, and master 5 songs with these ( and other) known and respected rock artists of this caliber. They are all extremely busy with very lucrative projects and the compensation to them has to be comparable and meet industry standards. Therefore our clever plan is to release a "Magic In The Air" EP if we only hit our first goal! If we surpass that and get to a minimum of $30,000 we will release a full 10 song CD!

Please remember that it takes a lot to hire a real rockstar so the more you contribute the BIGGER the stars! Can you just imagine... Mickey Thomas from Jefferson Starship? Neal Schon from Journey? Sebastian Bach from Skid ROW? Slash from Guns N Roses? Kevin Cronin from REO? The sky is the limit! 

Our last record hit a home run with guitar masters like George Lynch ( Dokken / Lynch Mob), Whitesnake/TSO gunslinger Joel Hoekstra and Guns N’ Roses/Sons Of Apollo guitar wizard Ron “Bumblefoot” Thal.

Check out this brilliant guitar solo from our last record “In Times Of Olde" by Guns N' Roses and Sons Of Apollo guitar wizard Ron "Bumblefoot" Thal!

 

 

If we hit $30,000 you will receive the digital download of the first 5 songs in April and we will continue on to finish the full 10 song CD and you'll get your physical copy by the end of August. 

We know times are hard and to complete a successful crowdfunding campaign to fund an epic project of this scope will be VERY difficult!

 

 

We can only hope that when you see and hear what we created on "In Times Of Olde" you will be moved by the musical mastery and the beauty of the music and help us finish another epic masterpiece! 

Please have a listen! Apple Music Spotify Bandcamp 

 

It will take ALL of you to SHARE with your friends and family and on all social media platforms and to DIG DEEPLY for us to reach this significant goal! ( We are very thankful our fan base is continuing to grow as more and more people become a part of Team RRO...and we will be counting on all of you!)

I can't tell just HOW MUCH I appreciate ALL of YOU who helped us record and release "In Times Of Olde"! It has turned out to be one of the greatest accomplishment of my life and I am forever grateful and indebted to you all!

Please consider one of our very prestigious PRODUCER rewards and you will be a huge part of something that will be of historical proportions in the world of rock! Your name will be listed on the CD as a PRODUCER and on all of our websites and our social media sites. IT WILL ALSO INCLUDE Back-Stage Passes and special VIP Meet & Greet opportunities! As an ASSOCIATE PRODUCER, EXECUTIVE PRODUCER, "GOLD" PRODUCER or MASTER PRODUCER you will receive VIP Back-Stage passes! 

Thank you for helping me create another beautiful Renaissance Rock Orchestra record! With YOUR HELP it will be another amazing journey forward in the evolution of RRO and another significant and historical collaboration that will be a piece of rock history!

This is amazing!” - Phil Anderson"It’s an AMAZING album! I love every song!” - Joanne Beverina Bilodeau“Beautiful orchestral Rock and Roll majesty rolled into an all-star line up of players…. superb job!" - Adam Nicholson“True musical mastery" - AlterMan Listen to a SAMPLER of RRO's last release "IN Times OF Olde"! :-) Please click here to take a look at the  ARTIST PRESENTATION DECK we prepared for the tour!  We'd like to move forward with a new record for you called "Magic In The Air"!I have a VERY exciting line-up of rockstars who will perform on the new record along with many of your favorite and beloved artists from our prestigious list of world-class RRO alumni talent from the first 2 records! WHO WILL BE ON THE NEW RECORD?!!!!  BECOME A CONTRIBUTOR AND YOU will be the FIRST to find out as the record is recorded!The costs to produce a record of this quality and with artists of this caliber and notoriety make this a challenging proposition! Here's how we propose to do it.It will be approximately $15,000 to record, produce, and master 5 songs with these ( and other) known and respected rock artists of this caliber. They are all extremely busy with very lucrative projects and the compensation to them has to be comparable and meet industry standards. Therefore our clever plan is to release a "Magic In The Air" EP if we only hit our first goal! If we surpass that and get to a minimum of $30,000 we will release a full 10 song CD!Please remember that it takes a lot to hire a real rockstar so the more you contribute the BIGGER the stars! Can you just imagine... Mickey Thomas from Jefferson Starship? Neal Schon from Journey? Sebastian Bach from Skid ROW? Slash from Guns N Roses? Kevin Cronin from REO? The sky is the limit! Our last record hit a home run with guitar masters like George Lynch ( Dokken / Lynch Mob), Whitesnake/TSO gunslinger Joel Hoekstra and Guns N’ Roses/Sons Of Apollo guitar wizard Ron “Bumblefoot” Thal.Check out this brilliant guitar solo from our last record “In Times Of Olde" by Guns N' Roses and Sons Of Apollo guitar wizard Ron "Bumblefoot" Thal! 

 
If we hit $30,000 you will receive the digital download of the first 5 songs in April and we will continue on to finish the full 10 song CD and you'll get your physical copy by the end of August. We know times are hard and to complete a successful crowdfunding campaign to fund an epic project of this scope will be VERY difficult!  We can only hope that when you see and hear what we created on "In Times Of Olde" you will be moved by the musical mastery and the beauty of the music and help us finish another epic masterpiece! Please have a listen! Apple Music Spotify Bandcamp  It will take ALL of you to SHARE with your friends and family and on all social media platforms and to DIG DEEPLY for us to reach this significant goal! ( We are very thankful our fan base is continuing to grow as more and more people become a part of Team RRO...and we will be counting on all of you!)I can't tell just HOW MUCH I appreciate ALL of YOU who helped us record and release "In Times Of Olde"! It has turned out to be one of the greatest accomplishment of my life and I am forever grateful and indebted to you all!Please consider one of our very prestigious PRODUCER rewards and you will be a huge part of something that will be of historical proportions in the world of rock! Your name will be listed on the CD as a PRODUCER and on all of our websites and our social media sites. IT WILL ALSO INCLUDE Back-Stage Passes and special VIP Meet & Greet opportunities! As an ASSOCIATE PRODUCER, EXECUTIVE PRODUCER, "GOLD" PRODUCER or MASTER PRODUCER you will receive VIP Back-Stage passes! Thank you for helping me create another beautiful Renaissance Rock Orchestra record! With YOUR HELP it will be another amazing journey forward in the evolution of RRO and another significant and historical collaboration that will be a piece of rock history!

story:
Music

Hello! I am Amy Duncan, a singer-songwriter based in Edinburgh currently working on my 7th album. I write from personal experience, and lately have found inspiration from my abstract photography. I am currently fully and joyfully immersed in the recording process!

I feel very excited about this album which I am producing with the brilliant engineer Cameron Malcolm.

There will be around 12 tracks on which I play guitar, piano, synths and electric upright bass. Guy Nicolson plays drums, tablas, and percussion.

In the lead up to the launch I am releasing 3 singles as animated music videos created by Tracy Foster who is using photographs which have influenced some of the songs as a starting point.

Here is the first single:

 

Results

All money raised will go towards PR and radio plugging which will start 4 months before the release. Your pre-orders will be vital in helping me to get the publicity that this album needs. 

Perks

You can pre-order the album in studio master quality; have a song written for you based on any image that you feel a connection with and buy these art prints of the photographs which have inspired the songs.

Follow this link to view the images at full size  Amy Duncan Photographs

 

Impact

Your contribution will greatly increase the potential for a successful release. PR and Radio plugging will introduce the music to influential press and radio, making the album visible in a way that I could never do on my own.

I have run 3 successful crowdfunding campaigns for previous  albums. The first, 'Cycles of Life' went on to be licensed by Linn Records which opened up doors to a whole new audience. I then recorded 'Undercurrents' and 'Antidote' with producer Calum Malcolm (The Blue Nile, Prefab Sprout) releasing through my own label Filly Records with distribution through Proper Music.

I think this album I am working on is my strongest to date. I am getting much closer to the sound I want to produce and greater clarity about what I want to say.

When I started recording in my late teens there was just a raw need to hear my voice and words singing back at me because it felt like proof that I exist. Songwriting became a way for me to work through many difficult times and has been the one constant throughout life.

It is the best feeling to find connections with people through my songs. Music is what makes my world go round.

"Amy Duncan’s music makes the world a better place, and right now we need her, and those like her, more than ever" Alistair Braidwood

"Melodies that haunt and lyrics that touch the soul" Folk Words 

"Exceptional and Powerful" Folk Radio UK

 

Sharing

I know not everyone is able to contribute, but if you like the sound of this and want to help in other ways, then you could share this campaign and my music video with any friends who might enjoy my music.

Thanks for your support!

story:
Love, dreams, nostalgia, regret, and hope.

Life is a rollercoaster of emotions.

 

Emotions such as these bring us together. They make us feel alive, and they make us feel human.

 

So much of the lyrical poetry that you hear in my songs is about our experience in this world. We must not only treasure the best moments we get but also strive to do amazing things to make the world a better place. We have to do our life’s work.

 

For me, my life’s work is my music. 

 

Perhaps I am a fool to dream of a better world, but if I can bring some peace to the souls and hearts of people from my words and melodies, then I am on the right path. Making music is, for me, a way to feel connected and connect with people all over the world. It's also for my listeners to connect with themselves and their emotions, their inner-selves. 

 

After releasing my first album, 'Life Rolls on By,' I was astounded by how well it was received.

 

Life Rolls on By cover image:

 

Of course, it was only a few people sending me messages telling me they loved it, a few radios having me in to do shows, and just a few blogs writing articles on some of the songs from it.

 

Nonetheless, receiving messages from fans telling how much they love your music is a beautiful reward for me, and it always warms my heart. 

 

We all have to start somewhere. Since January of this year, using only my desire to connect with people who might like my music, I have got my project to the stage where it now has serious potential to explode into something big. Something REALLY big. 

 

The future is what excites me the most.

 

But I am an independent artist. Even if I have been able to fund my music by myself from doing various jobs, it is not enough to push it further. It is not enough to bring it to a much bigger audience. 

 

I would like to remain independent for several reasons:

 

  1. Firstly, If I was signed to a record label, I would no longer own my music. 
  2. Secondly, if I stopped being independent, I would probably have to change my artistic direction based on the taste of a few businessmen who would not care much for my music..
  3. Finally, if I was signed to a  label, I would lose my authenticity, and I would no longer be able to connect with my audience in the way in which I currently do. And that close connection is something which I feel people who love my music really love.

 

But my fans, my supporters, my friends... If you are here today, it's because you know me and have heard my music before. If not, you can still discover it with the video below.

 

 

I just released a couple of singles called 'The World Won't Wait for You' and ‘Then You’ll Go Far’ to announce my new EP.  

 

EP cover:

 

With enough support, there will be more music after this EP too. It's what I do; I write songs about life and emotion.

 

Every day, I reach out to people to try and connect with them individually and listen to my music. By doing that, I'm proud to say that I have 1000+ people who really like my music. And I have exchanged messages with every single one of these people.

 

I am working hard at distributing my music in the cheapest way possible, and I know that even with a moderate amount of money (much less than what a record label would give me) I could really scale up this operation, make much more music, and make much more online content: live videos, music videos and more.

 

This upcoming EP needs to be heard by more people.

It's why, today, I'm asking for your help. No... I'm not asking. 

I'm inviting YOU to come on this journey with me and be part of this story.

 

All of the perks I have set up are tailored to help me invest in spreading the word and reach more people with my music.

 

A label will waste £150,000 promoting a project like mine. I'm working with talented friends willing to help me, and I know that with £15,000, we can do incredible things.

 

£15,000 is not a lot from more than 1,000 people who love my music.

It would completely pay for another EP, and it would allow me to market the upcoming EP well enough to be able to make more music and merch for everyone moving forward! 

Here is how I will spend this budget:

£4000 for the recording of the next 4 song EP. I'm lucky enough to have talented friends who are helping me by lowering their fees.

£1000  to make the merch.

£10,000 in press, radio placements, and advertisements. 

For marketing and communication, it's not that high a budget, but it would be enough to put my music in front of many more people with a similar taste.

 

Beautiful live videos and music videos will come soon after the lockdown.

 

I can give my best only because of people like you. All together, we can make things happen. Great things.

 

Thanks to you, my fan, my supporter, my friend...

Mungo Parker

story:
STARTING TODAY 2021 was inspired by a speech made by President-Elect Joe Biden and by the selection of VP-Elect Kamala Harris.  This song is a  a joyous choral work that was written to inspire and encourage the US and entire world with a virtual choral production and video, as we move forward with healing, hope and the promise of a new and wonderful future. 

Starting Today was written in the dark, literally. The composer, Patricia Tyson a hospice nurse by profession and musician by passion, wrote Starting Today 2021 during her difficult recuperation from major eye surgery- a macular hole repair. With one eye, Patricia was able to put together an amazing group of singers and production crew who will sing and produce this project, virtually. We are composed of stellar, world-class artists who live all over the US, and some have never personally met Patricia face-to-face, but we are all connected by our passion for music, desire to help others and our positivity! Our video presentation will feature the Divine 9, instrumentalists, dancers, singers and the American people who represent the diversity of WE, the people. Join with us as we sing and dance boldly into 2021, into healing and full of hope! 

We are hoping to raise at least $25,000 to cover the cost of production which includes music production, photography, videography, distribution, marketing, operating expenses and budgeting.  Anything raised over this amount will go to helping families directly affected by COVID-19. 

We will offer tier-based rewards to those who give, as follows:

$100 or more - you will receive a commemorative DVD which will be a keepsake reminder of Starting Today 2021 for your pledge of $100 or more.

$50 - the giver of $50 will receive an autographed copy of the lead sheet of Starting Today 2021. This song can be sung by other choirs or community groups. Share the hope!

$25 - for this $25 pledge, you will get a Starting Today 2021 t-shirt in your specified size. This can be a great conversation starter!

$5 - Everyone who gives $5 to Starting Today 2021 will get a washable, reusable face mask with our logo. Be safe, be happy!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Bri and this is my band, Divorce Care.

Three years ago I moved to my dream city, with the goal of starting a band and writing music I can be truly proud of. Through the beautifully connected music scene here, I've found myself surrounded by and working with people I admire and respect the most in the industry, and I am confident that the pieces are finally in place to realize this dream. 

This band and this album represent some of the hardest, darkest moments in my life, when the only positive thing I could do was write a song. Moments of healing, introspection, and acceptance were my muse. This collection of songs are distillations of some of these profound moments and I’m ready to share them, but I need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what it will take and where your money will go: 

  • Production, engineering and mixing the album.
  • Hiring two professional musicians to play bass and drums. 
  • Mastering the album for release.
  • Design of album artwork.
  • Distribution of album. 
  • Design, ordering and distribution of merch. 

I'll be working with an incredible producer, named Andy Park. There's nobody else I want to create this album with and I trust him entirely, knowing the quality investment he'll put into every song. The fact that he wants to make this record with me is beyond humbling - take my word for it. Want to see his work? Check it out here: www.andyparkrecording.com

The Impact

Taking almost three years to write this album, there's one thing I'm absolutely certain of at this point: I have to do this right. From start to finish, I want this album to be the absolute best it can be. I've never had this level of commitment to anything. Andy and these incredible musicians are what will see it through to that level of completion. 

While my story and journey are entirely personal and relative to what I've experienced, I believe that others who have been through or are going through similar things will find something in them. If nothing else, to know they're not alone. I hope this album can provide that.

Risks & Challenges

At this point, most of the risks and challenges are behind me. I've worked incredibly hard to get everything to where it is, ready to go for recording. I have 15 fully fleshed out demos, with everything written. The challenge in front of me is taking the years of my heart that I've poured into this and creating something truly wonderful.

I need you for that. 

If our world was in a different state, I would be working my ass off to organize my band and play shows to raise the required funds for this project. But this is our reality and the challenge is figuring out a way to make this happen, at its absolute fullest potential. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There is ZERO pressure to contribute to this. We're all in varying states of life, with varying means and this year has left us all over the place. I'm with you. If you feel in any way connected to what I'm creating, but cannot contribute financially, you can still be a part of this. :) Here's what you can do: 

  • Share on your social channels: Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat - even that cool new thing all the kids are doing, tik tok??
  • Send a good old fashioned email or text to those who may be interested
  • Or even *gasp* bring it up in conversation ;) 

Divorce Care Hoodie Design

story:
The Forge is the fruition of the brain child of founder Dale Weran. Originally started as Promotion Company in 2015, the general driving mantra behind us was simple yet elegant; by musicians for musicians.

We aimed to cater to the neglected music genres of the city while fostering an inclusive and inviting environment.  It began with several local shows and quickly escalated into us booking international headliners all over Alberta.  Justin Sturek was brought on board to provide a solid hand in the Hip Hop & Electronic communities. The partnership was blossoming and as a team we tried to take it to another level.   As our company grew our focus became more refined to be "Its not a show it's an experience".   This became one of our driving factor, make sure every show is an experience for audience as well as the bands. 

We faced our first serious blow as an enterprise when we threw a 2 city, 2 Day Festival.  What can I say? We all make mistakes and try to grow a little too quickly sometimes. Though having a lot of positive moments, financially the festival was less than successful and forced us to restructure and refocus.

Amidst this period restructuring it seemed the stars had aligned. Call it hard work, or being in the right place at the right time; we found ourselves with an opportunity to give Live Music a home in the middle of many establishments closing their doors to live music.  Business wise, the time to set up shop was not necessarily ideal, but we hoped we could bring a change to the existing landscape of the community and become a positive push towards re-establishing a prominent music community of the city as well as Whyte Ave. We pulled together several new members of the team and began to Forge a new hope in the old home of The Pawn Shop.

We took possession of The Forge in October of 2016 and began the transformation. February 2017 we had our grand opening and this crazy ride kicked into another gear. We were supported by several communities and we did our best to support them, housing many styles of events from Metal/Rock/Hardcore/Punk, Hip Hop, Electronic Dance, Goth, Indie, and even Comedy & Theatre. We climbed some mountains, we hit some valleys, we made mistakes, we learned, we made better decisions. Slowly the crowds started to average higher numbers, we started to book bigger shows, we blossomed beautiful relationships we many community members that showed untiring dedication to our home.

So we made it about 1.5 years into the journey and finally started to stand on stable ground. This only made the impending tragedy harder to swallow and left a dark pit in our stomachs.

A few weeks ago we were faced with a reality that nobody could have ever predicted. We all awoke that fateful Monday morning to news headlines and ringing phones from concerned family and friends. Reports of a fire at The Forge on Whyte began to break approximately 4:30 AM Monday morning. With little to no information from authorities, we were just as in the dark as our community surrounding us. We finally got the chance to get in and survey the damage and it was most certainly a grim situation. With that said it also could have been much worse.

The building itself suffered some serious burns in the green room & upon the stage. The electrical seemed to be shot entirely shot and the smoke damage was extensive to say the least. Most of the gear at this point appears to be ok. We won't know until further investigation and inspection what in our inventory is still fully operational, but we remain hopeful.

So what now? At this point it is pretty difficult for us to make a solid trajectory. What we do know, is that you have not herd the last from us. One of the following options will take place as we get a better idea of what resources we have at our support.

1) Renovate & rebuild The Forge on Whyte in its current location.

2) Relocation to another suitable building in the community.

3) The least likely option but still a possibility is building a location from the ground up.

The Forge has always consisted of people who are lifelong contributors of this community, and the wheels are currently turning into motion for us to bring the Phoenix that will rise from The Forge's ashes.
story_txt: The Forge is the fruition of the brain child of founder Dale Weran. Originally started as Promotion Company in 2015, the general driving mantra behind us was simple yet elegant; by musicians for musicians.We aimed to cater to the neglected music genres of the city while fostering an inclusive and inviting environment.  It began with several local shows and quickly escalated into us booking international headliners all over Alberta.  Justin Sturek was brought on board to provide a solid hand in the Hip Hop & Electronic communities. The partnership was blossoming and as a team we tried to take it to another level.   As our company grew our focus became more refined to be "Its not a show it's an experience".   This became one of our driving factor, make sure every show is an experience for audience as well as the bands. We faced our first serious blow as an enterprise when we threw a 2 city, 2 Day Festival.  What can I say? We all make mistakes and try to grow a little too quickly sometimes. Though having a lot of positive moments, financially the festival was less than successful and forced us to restructure and refocus.Amidst this period restructuring it seemed the stars had aligned. Call it hard work, or being in the right place at the right time; we found ourselves with an opportunity to give Live Music a home in the middle of many establishments closing their doors to live music.  Business wise, the time to set up shop was not necessarily ideal, but we hoped we could bring a change to the existing landscape of the community and become a positive push towards re-establishing a prominent music community of the city as well as Whyte Ave. We pulled together several new members of the team and began to Forge a new hope in the old home of The Pawn Shop.We took possession of The Forge in October of 2016 and began the transformation. February 2017 we had our grand opening and this crazy ride kicked into another gear. We were supported by several communities and we did our best to support them, housing many styles of events from Metal/Rock/Hardcore/Punk, Hip Hop, Electronic Dance, Goth, Indie, and even Comedy & Theatre. We climbed some mountains, we hit some valleys, we made mistakes, we learned, we made better decisions. Slowly the crowds started to average higher numbers, we started to book bigger shows, we blossomed beautiful relationships we many community members that showed untiring dedication to our home.So we made it about 1.5 years into the journey and finally started to stand on stable ground. This only made the impending tragedy harder to swallow and left a dark pit in our stomachs.A few weeks ago we were faced with a reality that nobody could have ever predicted. We all awoke that fateful Monday morning to news headlines and ringing phones from concerned family and friends. Reports of a fire at The Forge on Whyte began to break approximately 4:30 AM Monday morning. With little to no information from authorities, we were just as in the dark as our community surrounding us. We finally got the chance to get in and survey the damage and it was most certainly a grim situation. With that said it also could have been much worse.The building itself suffered some serious burns in the green room & upon the stage. The electrical seemed to be shot entirely shot and the smoke damage was extensive to say the least. Most of the gear at this point appears to be ok. We won't know until further investigation and inspection what in our inventory is still fully operational, but we remain hopeful.So what now? At this point it is pretty difficult for us to make a solid trajectory. What we do know, is that you have not herd the last from us. One of the following options will take place as we get a better idea of what resources we have at our support.1) Renovate & rebuild The Forge on Whyte in its current location.2) Relocation to another suitable building in the community.3) The least likely option but still a possibility is building a location from the ground up.The Forge has always consisted of people who are lifelong contributors of this community, and the wheels are currently turning into motion for us to bring the Phoenix that will rise from The Forge's ashes.

story:
Who We Are

Hi, we're the StarFinders, a team of 4 creative minds with an unconditional love for music and the geniuses who create it. Our quartet consists of a writer, Kiersey, a social media manager, NiaRuth, and a couple of old matrimonial lovebirds with a passion and an idea. A passion for music and an an app that opens the channels between musicians, artists and singers and the ears who love to listen.

What We're Creating

Our mission is simple: we want to bridge the "stage gap" between music lovers/fanatics and the artists who dream of performing for them, by eliminating the music industry's gate-keeping tactics and deliver a new live-competition + live-concert platform that evens the playing field for unsigned or independent artists. Our mobile app, SyrenStar, is that bridge.
 

What We Need 

Any quick Google search will show you that the average cost of an app (a cheap one) is between $50k and $100k. We've already poured our savings (~25k) into this because we believe in what it could mean for musicians and how it could change music on a global level. So our goal is $75k. 

The entire goal will fund the building of our own server (needed for seamless live-streaming, cloud storage for the databases of our artist and fan accounts, the in-app store where artists' music and merch can be purchased, continuity of our multi-algorithmic AI system to match fan music preferences with artists who create it + match similarly tagged songs for quarterly competitions and fan voting + multi-level "featuring" system which collects data on how often an artist's page is visited and each individual song they upload is played in order to feature hidden talents at a higher rate when they are going unnoticed, and many more technical aspects that our app developers would have to translate from a numerical and technical language only they seem to understand into plain English to explain), the development of the app itself, and marketing to lure fans and artists across the globe to the app.

What You Get 

 

To ensure this app remains helpful for artists, we are unable to offer discounts on any artist merch or album/song costs, but you will get:

  • A custom SyrenStar car decal

  • A SyrenStar keychain
  • A SyrenStar canvas tote
  • A SyrenStar phone case
  • A SyrenStar tumbler

  • A SyrenStar T-shirt  

  • The Full SyrenStar Fan Merch Pack | The Full SyrenStar Artist Merch Pack
  • A "Founding Fan" badge on your SyrenStar Fan profile | A "Founding Artist" badge on your SyrenStar Artist profile
  • An Honorable Mention as a Community Supporter in all 1st Year Concerts | Secured Spot in the Features promotion section for 3 months (artists only)
  • Free Concerts for 2 years + Physical Lanyard, Concert Bracelet & Custom Backstage Pass

  • 50% off annual subscription for the app for life
  • Automatic induction into the First Look Club where you see/hear newest artists before anyone else
  • Optional guaranteed entry into our Beta Program, no application required
  • Exclusive Access to our first Beta Concert (with or without being a Beta Tester)

 

The Impact & Our Inspiration

Our passion for this project comes from our own experiences as creative people. Each of us has a different story, but they all widely relate around the same plot. We all come from rural areas of North Carolina we call "molding plants" where creative individuals were chastised and challenged for having dreams outside of the "mold" of a farmer or factory worker. There's nothing wrong with physical labor, if that's where you find your purpose and joy in life. But not everyone exists for that purpose and no talent should go untapped because of tradition, insecurities or a fear of having big dreams. We're the dreaming, hopeful creatives who've cut out a nice little slice of the world for ourselves where we're free to work, cultivate and actively go after those dreams. But we don't want to stop there. We want everyone to dream and dream big. Art is big enough for anyone brave enough to share a little piece of themselves in their work with the world. There's no such thing as "too many artists." We firmly believe that. 

That's where our idea came from. In our respective families, we have musicians and talented singers and lyrical artists - many of whom were told by teachers, coaches and other adults in places of authority that they would "never make it" off their talents, no matter how great they were or how hard they worked. As adults, we now understand that those were just the callous, jaded words of a failure who never had the courage to get back up and try again, or maybe never attempted to seek out their real passions in the first place. 

NiaRuth has a sister with the voice of an angel. Kiersey has a brother with lyrics that would drag you down to the hidden depths of your own soul and feel every emotion imaginable. The lovebird duo has a son, several nieces and nephews and cousins aplenty with a plethora of musical talent. All these youths are being fed the same lie: "you'll never make it." But this generation is nothing if not resilient. They're retorting with a collective, "oh yeah? Watch me!" and we're here for it! 

We put our minds together and thus the SyrenStar Mobile App was born. We've paired with a group of freelance app developers to bring an entirely new app with the power to make waves in the music industry as a whole. Gone are the days of being force-fed whatever "the industry" decides should be relevant. Music fans and unsigned artists want to take control of the music they hear and create. No musician should ever have to water down their talent under the guise of paying "petty dues" for some other artist to get their shine and no music fan should be limited to hearing only 29% of music that exists. That's right, the "music industry" monopoly controls over 70% of everything you hear! There are independent artists out there your soul has been waiting to discover. SyrenStar can make that happen.

We understand how life-changing success is for anyone, but especially how rare and unlikely it can seem for musicians and other creatives. In a world where everyone loves music, but not everyone sees the costly demands behind its creation, we want the majority of our app to be free to musicians striving to turn their art into a livable career. The only cost for artists on the SyrenStar app is the one-time fee (of no more than $0.75) to enter a song into the season competitions which occur 4 times a year. At minimum, at least 80% of all artist-related revenue to go to the artist directly so they can keep living their purpose and making this ball in space we exist on a little brighter with their musical creations.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk we face is not achieving the funding goal needed to bring the app into reality at the highest standard possible, but that won't stop us from moving forward with our plans. Our tiers are set up so that even if we don't meet our funding goal, we can still afford to ship out all physical perks and rewards. For perks directly reliant on the app, things would be a little trickier, but in the event we can't draw in enough for the app we would those backers upon request.

Challenges are a dime a dozen. We live in an uncertain world, still dealing with a global plague, a shaky economy, and a society well overdue for an overhaul. Navigating entrepreneurial channels is as difficult as its ever been, but we believe in our team and where one of us falls short, the others are right there to pick up and shoulder a little extra responsibility when needed. We are looking into expanding our team and are in the process of interviewing for three more positions as things proceed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone can help make SyrenStar a reality and every effort counts! If you're not able to support us by being a backer right now, you can still help out by:

Sharing! Share, share, share the campaign:

  • By word of mouth
  • Thru Facebook, Twitter or other social media.
  • On Discord/Twitch/TikTok and other streaming platforms
  • On your blog or website by copying this link 

Applying to be a Beta Tester!

  • Are you and artist or music lover? Sign up here for updates on our Beta program and apply to be a Beta Tester!
  • Know an artist? Send them the Beta Application link here!

Becoming an affiliate!

  • Join our Affiliate's program and get a percentage of every pledge you recommend to us! The more we get, the more you make!

story:
what's going on?

Hey everyone,

Thank you for stopping by my campaign for the debut solo album release 'Music I Had to Write' - a deeply reflective vocal and piano album of electronic music that I have written and produced over the last 10 months. For many of us, this year has been really tough mentally and if like me, potentially brought forward many of those challenging thoughts and aspects of life that have been somewhat hidden away in the busyness of modern living. With no gigs and reduced interaction life became pretty quiet for me, and at the same time my inner monologue and memories of past traumas (that I strongly work to avoid) suddenly got very loud and hard to suppress (...my usual coping mechanism). As I journeyed  through the inner work of recognising, starting to accept and gradually letting go (still working on this one) of the heavy armour of my childhood, this music, which has always been a creative therapy for me, started to appear to my mind. This not only helped me to document my emotional progression but also helped me to heal in a wonderfully creative and intimate way. This record marks the first chapter of this journey, producing a very personal and somewhat magical collection of music that I now feel (just about) ready to share with the world.

why I need you!

The album, which is planned to be distributed around November this year (with the first 'single' being out in June), will meet with many 'post-production' costs such as the music mastering, promotion, album artwork, video production and much more. And with this year being financially so difficult, to accomplish this release I am gratefully looking for donations to help cover the costs for the services mentioned above, so that I can release the album this year and ensure it is of the highest standard to reach a big audience. This creative venture is also a stepping stone for my musical career, which will help propel me into a new world of music (and a new chapter of life). For those who don't know me, here is a little overview of my journey so far...

my journey so far

'Ben is an award-winning saxophonist spearheading Sax Every Weekend, where he collaborates with a multitude of DJs around the UK and Europe. Hailing from a small town in Nottinghamshire, UK, Ben discovered his passion for music at age 11 when he was gifted keyboard and saxophone lessons by his grandad. By age 14 he was awarded a scholarship to Chetham’s School of Music in Manchester and then advanced his musical education by completing his degree at The Royal Northern College of Music, Manchester. Since then Ben has had many musical credits to his name including radio play on BBC Radio 1, performing saxophone with The Killer’s frontman Brandon Flowers and notable performances at Glastonbury Festival in 2017 with DnB godfather Tony Coleman (Hospital Records), as part of the London Elektricity Big Band. In his spare time, Ben teaches meditation and is a keen advocate of mental health awareness. He encourages meditation and mindfulness as a means to a healthy life and follows the Buddhist path.'

what you get

As many of you coming to this page will know me from the saxophone world, I have catered many of the 'perks' to be based around this. If you don't yet know how this works, you can select one of the 'perks' which range from costing £5 to £500 (for example, if you choose '£50 Sax Song Request' you will receive a personalised video of myself performing the saxophone to a song of your choice - anything goes :p), or you can simply donate any amount of your choosing by selecting the donate option on the page.

sharing the love

Thank you so much for stopping by and all your help so far. I am deeply grateful to you all.

If you have any questions or would like to have a chat  feel free to send me a message at benwatte@hotmail.co.uk or add me @ben.everything on Instagram. It would also be a great help if you could share this page with anyone you feel would be interested. Much love to you and hope to connect with you soon, Ben.

story:
IMPORTANT UPDATE:

 

 

We’ve officially entered into an agreement with a brand sponsor to co-produce the next set of Sanborn Sessions episodes! That means we’ll be going back into production mode and working hard to bring the next set of episodes to life! We’ll be announcing our partner soon but we wanted to offer an update to our backers first. As of 11/22/18, this page will no longer be updated or active. Your support throughout this campaign has meant the world and we will, of course, still be fulfilling all of the perks and promises we made to you! 

 

We can’t wait to bring you more episodes and continue to bring Sanborn Sessions to life!

 

Yours truly, 

 

David Sanborn and Team 

 

 

 

 

Why Sanborn Sessions?

 

Hi World. David Sanborn here. You may know me for my solo saxophone career or my collaborations with some incredible artists from all kinds of genres.

 

You may also know me as the host of the iconic Night Music show on NBC. 

 

I believe that music needs a home online where genres don't matter, musicians can explore their boundaries, and the world gets to watch. A magical thing happens when musicians are allowed to break preconceived notions of their categories and just create. Starting in 1988, Night Music gave the world an incredible look into what happens when amazing artists are allowed to explore music while the world watches.  Night Music carved out an illustrious place in music and pop culture history. 

 

Now, I am hoping you will join me in my dream of bringing Sanborn Sessions to life, and revitalizing the iconic show that's so near and dear to all of our hearts. 
 
Together, we can create a new series of Sanborn Sessions episodes that honors the music exploration we all remember and love while paving the way for the future of digital musical content. 

 

In the late 1980s, Night Music used television to deliver this amazing content to a captive worldwide audience, meeting them where they wanted to be. Now, in 2018, TV is not that place anymore. That's why we decided to create Sanborn Sessions; to bring a new spin on this amazing show to the computers, tablets and phones of music fans worldwide. 

 

We think it makes for a pretty cool concept. So cool, in fact, that we decided to pull together a test pilot episode with some of my friends to see what it would look like. 

 

The outcome was amazing: 

 

 

 

 

 
But, despite the encouraging outcome of Session 01, we still face challenges in bringing Sessions 02 and beyond to life.
 
 
Since we've announced this project to the world, we've gotten countless numbers of ideas and requests for guest artists, songs, mashups, stories to tell, and everything in between. It's clear we need to bring more episodes of Sanborn Sessions to life so we can show you what can happen when musicians are given the forum to explore music without boundaries. 
 
We need your help to bring these episodes to life. Your support allows us to keep creating these episodes and bringing them directly to you. 
 
 

Our Vision 

 
 
Sanborn Sessions creates a modern take on the cult classic in Dave's home studio. This new show brings top artists from all genres to discuss, explore and play music while the cameras roll. What makes this show different is the audience's ability to actually see how music gets made, from concept to execution, and everything in between. We (team Dave) want to let you, the audience, be a fly on the wall as legendary musicians push the boundaries of genre and share the stories that shaped them as artists and individuals. 
 

The funds from this campaign go directly to the production costs of the show. We film every episode in my home studio so we can create as much content for as little as possible. The more we raise, the more episodes we can make! We want to bring Sanborn Sessions into the homes of every music fan in America. And to do that, we need to create more episodes and make sure you're able to see them! 

 

We can't make more Sanborn Sessions episodes without your support and contribution!

 

 

I always think that experiencing to the music is the best reward. But,  if you're going to join our cause, we also have some wonderful rewards for you. But, don't take my word for it... take a look at what you'll get if you get involved!

 

Sanborn Sessions is a dream for me. If we can pull this off, we'll make music history together.

 

That's why I hope you'll join our mission and help us bring it to life and make history!
story_txt:
IMPORTANT UPDATE:  We’ve officially entered into an agreement with a brand sponsor to co-produce the next set of Sanborn Sessions episodes! That means we’ll be going back into production mode and working hard to bring the next set of episodes to life! We’ll be announcing our partner soon but we wanted to offer an update to our backers first. As of 11/22/18, this page will no longer be updated or active. Your support throughout this campaign has meant the world and we will, of course, still be fulfilling all of the perks and promises we made to you!  We can’t wait to bring you more episodes and continue to bring Sanborn Sessions to life! Yours truly,  David Sanborn and Team     Why Sanborn Sessions? Hi World. David Sanborn here. You may know me for my solo saxophone career or my collaborations with some incredible artists from all kinds of genres. You may also know me as the host of the iconic Night Music show on NBC.  I believe that music needs a home online where genres don't matter, musicians can explore their boundaries, and the world gets to watch. A magical thing happens when musicians are allowed to break preconceived notions of their categories and just create. Starting in 1988, Night Music gave the world an incredible look into what happens when amazing artists are allowed to explore music while the world watches.  Night Music carved out an illustrious place in music and pop culture history.  Now, I am hoping you will join me in my dream of bringing Sanborn Sessions to life, and revitalizing the iconic show that's so near and dear to all of our hearts.  Together, we can create a new series of Sanborn Sessions episodes that honors the music exploration we all remember and love while paving the way for the future of digital musical content.  In the late 1980s, Night Music used television to deliver this amazing content to a captive worldwide audience, meeting them where they wanted to be. Now, in 2018, TV is not that place anymore. That's why we decided to create Sanborn Sessions; to bring a new spin on this amazing show to the computers, tablets and phones of music fans worldwide.  We think it makes for a pretty cool concept. So cool, in fact, that we decided to pull together a test pilot episode with some of my friends to see what it would look like.  The outcome was amazing:  


 
 

 

 
But, despite the encouraging outcome of Session 01, we still face challenges in bringing Sessions 02 and beyond to life.
 

 
Since we've announced this project to the world, we've gotten countless numbers of ideas and requests for guest artists, songs, mashups, stories to tell, and everything in between. It's clear we need to bring more episodes of Sanborn Sessions to life so we can show you what can happen when musicians are given the forum to explore music without boundaries. 
 
We need your help to bring these episodes to life. Your support allows us to keep creating these episodes and bringing them directly to you. 

 
 

Our Vision 
 

 
Sanborn Sessions creates a modern take on the cult classic in Dave's home studio. This new show brings top artists from all genres to discuss, explore and play music while the cameras roll. What makes this show different is the audience's ability to actually see how music gets made, from concept to execution, and everything in between. We (team Dave) want to let you, the audience, be a fly on the wall as legendary musicians push the boundaries of genre and share the stories that shaped them as artists and individuals. 
 
The funds from this campaign go directly to the production costs of the show. We film every episode in my home studio so we can create as much content for as little as possible. The more we raise, the more episodes we can make! We want to bring Sanborn Sessions into the homes of every music fan in America. And to do that, we need to create more episodes and make sure you're able to see them! 
 
We can't make more Sanborn Sessions episodes without your support and contribution!
 
 
I always think that experiencing to the music is the best reward. But,  if you're going to join our cause, we also have some wonderful rewards for you. But, don't take my word for it... take a look at what you'll get if you get involved! Sanborn Sessions is a dream for me. If we can pull this off, we'll make music history together.  That's why I hope you'll join our mission and help us bring it to life and make history!

story:
Short Summary

WE ARE JEWELSTONE!!! Ranie Cunningham is the lead singer and sings soprano & alto, Re'Sann Cunningham is our high-range soprano who sometimes sings alto, and Larsira Cunningham-Winston sings tenor and bass and sometimes alto as well.   We are an inspirational gospel group brought up in Detroit, Michigan.  Where we started singing in church. Our father Bishop Cunningham raised us in the church and we grew to love God. Our lives were changed forever on Easter Sunday, April 12, 1998, when our mother Missionary Denise Cunningham suddenly passed at the tender age of 38.  To honor her memory we changed our group name from the Cunningham Singers to "Jewelstone". The name represents who she was plus our father always referred to her as "Jewel", so it was only fitting to call ourselves Jewelstone.  As young women growing up in Detroit we learned quickly that the world wasn't a pretty place, times were hard and unkind. But God was our escape and we are grateful for His mercies.

We have teamed up Elrico Tunstall, owner of "Manager of the Year" and business partner Craigh Minc. They have used their knowledge of the Entertainment Industry to benefit our goals in music.  Together we are working to get this project off the ground.

Elrico Tunstall, manager and his partner Craig Minc

 

Our new project Luv(ed) One is very near and dear to us. As women we have experienced many things over the years and through it all we learned to depend on God. Not everyone knows that God can love on you when things happen out of your control.  But, this album will be full of love songs to you expressing how God can change the way you see yourself and others. This project is about loving yourself and all the things that make you "you". These songs will deal with self confidence, self esteem, self love, encouragement, fighting through, standing strong, keeping your head up and most importantly moving forward. "Don't let your circumstance define you, let your actions do that!" God is real and he is an untapped source that will help you deal with the most painful, ugly and discomforting situations. We don't have to deal with things alone. Our goal is to reach everyone with the power of positive thinking and love.

Now this is where you all come in.  The out of pocket expenses for this project is great so we need your help to make it a reality! We are offering you incentives for donating and assisting us in accomplishing our goals!

The studio we are working with is the Terminal Recording Studios, 370 Towne Center Pl., Ridgeland, Mississippi. We have chosen  producer and gospel recording artist  Paul Porter to produce this project; he is doing great work in the music industry. We will also be working with classical musicians such as violinists, flutist and even a xylophone player to create some mind-blowing music, we are very excited to work along side these inspiring musicians. Your contributions will fund the pre-production, production, editing, mixing, mastering, graphic design, CD pressing, distribution, marketing and PR. 

 

Engineer at Terminal Recording Studios in Mississippi

 

We reside in Pensacola, Florida and will be traveling to Jackson, Mississippi to record this project.  Our tenor and bass singer Larsira is also a wife and mother of four children. Her youngest is 2 and oldest is 14 and they are very busy and productive young people.  Mother's know how hard it is to juggle family and career but you do it to provide and secure a future for your children.  It is important for all mothers to achieve their personal goals in life. So to be able to work outside the home supplies identity, self-confidence, and drive. "We women have to stick together!" So we need your assistance to make this project happen! We are looking to raise $20,000.  If we do not meet our goal, we will use the contributions received toward studio time, pre-production, production, musicians. We have to start somewhere!

Jewelstone, Larsira Cunningham-Winston, with 2 of her children Alaya and Amira

 

We have booked the studio for a week and a half to start recording in May. We plan to have the first single completed and ready to be released by the end of June 2019.  The first offering we will record is entitled "Luv Me", the "U" in luv is geared toward you knowing that God is speaking directly to YOU. This single is a contemporary upbeat song a "Love Anthem" from God to you. 

Please pledge to this project you will not be disappointed. We need you all to get on social media and tweet about this project, share the link, like and help us alert the world about the Luv(ed) One Project it will touch the deepest part of your soul. Talk about it, post about it, tweet about it, use Indiegogo share tools to make a noise about this campaign! Pledge today!!

story:
Quick Overview:

My name is Sahil Bahl and I am a singer-songwriter from LA, now based in Holland. I am recording my second album (an EP this time). It is a concept album to be paired with a series of 4 interconnected music videos. I have self-financed the recording of two songs and I could use your help in finishing the recordings, post-production and financing the videos.

You can choose from some "perk" packages and receive some unique rewards for specific donations. Click the "perk" boxes to what is included or scroll down for descriptions.

Or if you'd like to simply contribute, you can click "back it" or fill in an amount under "make a contribution" to donate an amount of your choosing.

If I do not reach the goal I have set, I will use your contributions to finance what I can and I will complete the project. You will be a big part of this production, so from the start of this campaign until the project is finished, I will keep you informed of the progress.

 

 

 

The Concept:

Songs:

The EP is called Ask the Child.

During the period when I was writing these songs, I noticed this theme of childhood often coming up. I realized that I had hit a point in my life where I, someone with very much a "do first, think later" attitude, was actually taking a hard look back at what got me to where I am. I guess I was finally doing the "think later" part.

The album is therefore a cross-section of different periods of my life: childhood, adolescence, becoming an adult, even having a child of my own.  There is also an underlying theme of respect for the child. Whether it be the inner child or one you may have around, sometimes when you are really searching, a child can have the simplest answers. Quite often, that is exactly what we need.

 

Videos:

There will be four interconnected music videos, each of which will reference and pay homage to a different film that struck me at a different point in my life. These are true classics that you will surely recognize.

 

 

What is Needed and What You Get:

What is needed:

Recordings:

Recording, mixing, and mastering

Paying the musicians, producer, and engineers, as well as the studio

This totals €4,000.

 

Merchandise:

Vinyl, T-shirts, digital download postcards, stickers

This totals €2,100.

 

4 Interconnected music videos:

Paying the director/editor, equipment and production team

This totals €6,400.

 

What You Get:

Depending on your donation, you can choose from the following unique rewards.

Vinyl

For certain amounts, you will receive a 10" limited run vinyl.

 

Artwork

All perks include a Digital  EP Download and a digital booklet with hand written lyrics and artwork for each song.

The vinyl package Personal Touch includes a hard copy hand drawn/handwritten booklet with lyrics and one-of-a-kind illustrations as well as your name in the album credits.

The Listen in Style vinyl package includes an album artwork T-shirt and your name in the album credits.

 

Lessons

Choose from two skype lessons: Music Theory for Guitar or Fingerstyle Guitar, two unique subjects that can both be introduced in a one hour lesson. You will learn several warm-ups and exercises so that after the lesson is over, you can continue to explore what you learned and grow in your guitar playing and songwriting. You will also receive the digital EP, digital art/lyric booklet and your name in the album credits.

 

Youtube Cover Songs:

Choose a song you would like me to cover from several different genres. I'll make a live video on my channel and dedicate it to you. You also get the Digital EP and Digital art/lyric booklet and your name in the album credits.

 

House Concert

You get me for a 1 hour solo gig at your home. You can request a cover of any song of your choice and I will perform it live. Outside of the Hague, Netherlands, additional transportation/accommodation costs will apply. You also get vinyl, digital EP, art/lyric booklet, T-shirt and your name in the album credits.

 

Custom Cigar Box Guitar:

Choose for a handmade instrument! In addition to the vinyl, digital EP/artwork, T-shirt, and your name in the album credits, you will get a 3 string cigar box guitar (slide). Choose from an assortment of cigar boxes and we'll talk over string guages, tunings, bridge/nut materials, and size/materials for the fret markers (dot inlays) so you can have your guitar customized to your tastes.

 

Original Song for You or a Loved One

You come up with an idea and we sit down on skype or in person. You can tell me a story that you would like a song about, or maybe you want to dedicate one to a loved one. I'll take it from there and write it. I will then perform it live in a youtube video and dedicate it to you. If you would rather keep it private, then I can share it via private link. You will also get vinyl, digital artwork and EP, a T-shirt and your name in the album credits. Let's see what we come up with!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, not a problem! Sharing the campaign would help immensely to reach more people. Try out indiegogo's share tools to share via facebook, twitter or to copy a link. Thank you for your support!
