story:
What a rare occasion that on the heels of shut-down and loss comes something so personal, expansive, and refined. If you promise “It’s ok to try new things,” well then you’d better follow your own advice, right?

So every time I came to a fork in the road I veered away from my usual path. My friends surprised me with their musical invention, prowess, and camaraderie. Because when the going gets weird, the weird turn pro. 

I won’t dance about architecture here but there is no reason to hurl another record into existence unless it’s worth every inch. It’s a double LP and it’s the best I can do.

With your help and support we can get this full color 180 gram double record into stores, out on those turntables, and into your hands.

Yoko says a dream you dream together is reality.  Let’s dream together.

 

Love, Vess

------

"We Control The Weather" first vinyl pressing limited to 300 total copies. 200 black, 100 red.

------
Key Players:

Vess Ruhtenberg, played guitars, bass, drums, sang, paced, and talked (emphatically).

Adam Gross, who among other things sang my imaginary vision of his European trip. 

Emily Watkins, simply the most valuable player. 

Andy Fry, he’s the reason it looks so good and he is the Hall to my Oats. 

Devon Ashley, saves me from my own drumming, he could save you too.

Jordan Munson came over and blew our minds. 

Rob Dixon, who I want to be when I grow up, scored and played saxophone.

Courtney Kaiser sings on one.

Corey Barnes came by to play drums and xylophone one evening.

LonPaul Ellrich played drums on one I finally finished. 

Pat Spurgeon played drums on the opening, title track

Jeb Banner played, programmed, edited, and really put in the passionate time a project like this needs.

Paul Mahern mastered it. 

Carl Saff cut it. 

Smashed Plastic Chicago pressed it.

story:
STRETCH GOALS!

We've reached and even surpassed our initial goal in just 14 days! Please continue supporting this campaign with these stretch goals and together we can #KeepBhajansAlive.

£15,000 (FUNDED) -  Album Production & Music Licensing
£4,500 - 3 Month PR Campaign (to ensure this music reaches as far as possible)
£3,000 - Advertising Budget

Hello!

Some of you may know me as the guy who was singing Bhajans live on social media, or through YouTube videos, or you may have seen me perform at a venue near you. 

Now I’m inviting you to join me on this special project to #KeepBhajansAlive.

I know we are living in a major world crisis right now. And I have to confess, I didn’t know whether I should release this now or later, but you know what - we need the power of music more than ever right now.

The Project 

Together with you, I would like to produce a 7 track Bhajan album to help #KeepBhajansAlive. This will be an album that brings together musical elements from both traditional Indian and Western cultures to inspire the next generation and spread the love for Bhajans. For example, a traditional Dhun, combined with some melodic Drum & Bass or a Bhajan fused with a Qawwali vibe.

In addition to the musical tracks, I would like to create a mini-book to share the meaning of the Bhajans on the album and the lyrics for everyone to be able to sing along!

Our goal is £15,000 which is inclusive of music licensing, production and delivering the album.  Anything over this will go towards the PR and marketing budget for launching the album. Creating the album is the first step.

Perks & Rewards

To show my everlasting gratitude and as a token of appreciation for your support, I have put together a selection of rewards to share with you which you can find on this page. From digital downloads, tote bags, vinyls, exclusive private performances and more. Simply select a perk that works for you.

The Impact

I believe that there is a lot more to Bhajans than just the religious elements. Listening to Bhajans helps us connect with our inner self, relax and focus on the peaceful positive vibes. 

Especially in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment, like the world we live in today, surrounded by stress, uncertainty and negativity - it's a way to zone out, bring calmness to the mind, regain inner strength, find a source of comfort and embrace the present moment you are in..

If you aren't able to pledge anything right now, - you can still help by sharing this with your friends, family and networks on your social media pages - share the love, it's free and very much appreciated!

Thank you

As always, I have to say, from the bottom of my heart, thank you for your continuous love, generous contributions and all the different ways you have supported me on my mission so far. It doesn't go unnoticed and it means the world to me.

Bhavik

And I have to confess, I didn’t know whether I should release this now or later, but you know what - we need the power of music more than ever right now.The Project Together with you, I would like to produce a 7 track Bhajan album to help #KeepBhajansAlive. This will be an album that brings together musical elements from both traditional Indian and Western cultures to inspire the next generation and spread the love for Bhajans. For example, a traditional Dhun, combined with some melodic Drum & Bass or a Bhajan fused with a Qawwali vibe.In addition to the musical tracks, I would like to create a mini-book to share the meaning of the Bhajans on the album and the lyrics for everyone to be able to sing along!Our goal is £15,000 which is inclusive of music licensing, production and delivering the album.  Anything over this will go towards the PR and marketing budget for launching the album. Creating the album is the first step.Perks & RewardsTo show my everlasting gratitude and as a token of appreciation for your support, I have put together a selection of rewards to share with you which you can find on this page. From digital downloads, tote bags, vinyls, exclusive private performances and more. Simply select a perk that works for you.The ImpactI believe that there is a lot more to Bhajans than just the religious elements. Listening to Bhajans helps us connect with our inner self, relax and focus on the peaceful positive vibes. Especially in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment, like the world we live in today, surrounded by stress, uncertainty and negativity - it's a way to zone out, bring calmness to the mind, regain inner strength, find a source of comfort and embrace the present moment you are in..If you aren't able to pledge anything right now, - you can still help by sharing this with your friends, family and networks on your social media pages - share the love, it's free and very much appreciated!Thank youAs always, I have to say, from the bottom of my heart, thank you for your continuous love, generous contributions and all the different ways you have supported me on my mission so far. It doesn't go unnoticed and it means the world to me.Bhavik

story:
Hey there! We're Jesse, Charlie, Glen, Eli, and Nick, and together we are Love & Valor!

Love & Valor is an Americana/Folk band that we started in 2012 with the goal of creating lyric driven songs that were able to connect with people not only through music and melodies, but on a deeper, more personal level. Telling stories of love and loss, growing up in a small town, traveling the world, friendships and family. It's been almost 10 years since we played our first show, and we are still playing every weekend! Seeking to build relationships with people that come to shows, create a concert experience that is both intimate and exciting. 

"Old Oak" is our biggest album yet, with 15 songs! We've had the absolute pleasure of being able to work on this record at the Bunker Sound Studio in Chapel Hill. Having heard some of the partially recorded tracks already, and spending the past few years honing them at live concerts. We are SO EXCITED for you to hear them! 

In order for us to be able to have the finished product be as good as it can possibly be, we need your help! Our goal for this campaign is $10,000, which will go to: Tracking, Mixing, Mastering, Distribution/Printing, and PR for the release. 

We really believe this album can be a huge step for us towards touring and being able to support ourselves through music! 

We would be honored if you would consider taking this journey with us!

story:
J. S. Bach completed his Six Sonatas and Partitas for Solo Violin in 1720. Considered as "The Himalayas of violinists", these compositions include all possible human emotions on a celestial way.

To record these works is the most complex and challenging project to undertake for any violinist. One must be ready both physically and spiritually.

Antal Zalai, whose musicality and talent have impressed Lord Yehudi Menuhin, Isaac Stern, Lynn Harrell, Igor Oistrakh as well as Hollywood superstar Monica Bellucci and Charles, Prince of Wales among many others is working on this recording project.

The total time of the recording is about 140 minutes. It will be released in both audio and video format; the audio files will be available on all of the major on-line music stores, such as iTunes, Amazon MP3, Google Play as well as on streaming sites such as Spotify or Deezer. There will be a limited number of copies on physical double CDs. Videos will be available to stream on Antal's official YouTube channel, youtube.com/antalzalai and to stream or purchase on Amazon Video Direct.

Antal, for whom artistic freedom is essential, released several self-produced audio-video albums in the past few years on which he performs pieces of the violin repertoire requiring the utmost technical mastery. The collection on his YouTube channel and Facebook page with several million views includes Paganini's 24 Caprices, which have proved to be a grandiose success shared by several thousand viewers, and led to a number of requests for performances. The audio files of the videos – together with his previous CD recordings – are available on all of the major on-line music stores, and can also be bought in video format.

A recent comment on YouTube:
"If someone would say that Antal Zalai was the greatest living classical violinist, he certainly wouldn't be wrong about that because David Oistrakh and George Enescu are both gone. The hope is with you my friend. Thank you for the effort to stay true to the music. Rare indeed.﻿"

All the previous audio-video recording projects were funded from Antal's own resources and he will continue to do so in the future as well. However it has been a great financial burden for him for several years, so he is hoping you can help defray the costs of this magical undertaking - to record J. S. Bach's Six Sonatas and Partitas for Solo Violin - via this Indiegogo campaign.

Below are the actual costs he is trying to cover. If you’re interested in donating beyond Indiegogo, simply write him a message at antalzalai.donation@yahoo.com.

RECORDING $6000 (studio rental/time, recording engineer, travel/accommodation, videographers, editing)

MANUFACTURING $2000 (CD artwork, cover design, CD pressing/burning/copying, digital distribution)

The recording will take place in fall 2018 and will be released by 31 December, 2018.

Thanks for considering this campaign!

story:
Burn Out Bright by WthCnvctn

 

WthCnvcn consists of Singer Sabian Ryan, Guitarists Jamie Enke, Keelan Roussel & Kyle Johnson and Drummer AJ Howse. Starting off in 2015 based out of Edmonton, we released 1 EP and 4 Singles on all major digital platforms. After composing, producing and recording since early 2017 we're finally ready to release our first full length album. This summer, we'll be travelling to cities across Western Canada promoting this new release and we're looking forward to sharing this new sound with our fans.

This campaign is important to us because we want to release the best possible version of this album that we can. We plan on expanding on it in the future with special edition versions including B-side tracks, acoustic covers, remixes and more. 

By preordering your copy of Burn Out Bright, you're helping us fund our release to make it as big as we possibly can. We're looking to make an impact and your support is going to make a huge difference in what we're capable of doing.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To break it down for you, we're looking to raise enough money through presales & packages to help with the many costs that come with releasing & promoting a debut full length album. Behing the many production, studio & printing costs, there's marketing & music videos, lyric videos, photoshoots and more! 

If we're unable to reach our entire goal, we'll still be able to deliver our product to those who contribute!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't contribute right now, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or ANY of your favourite socials! Another great way to support is just to follow us on Spotify or YouTube and stream some of our latest tunes!

You can find us at the links below!

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/0vQOPz0Q8pKrwlH...

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC-RNNaBkWZVTca...

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wthcnvctn

 

Thanks for your support!

story:
About Milena & Project

My name is Milena and I'm a singer, flutist, and composer. When I talk about my musical background I always mention I was raised on a farm, because that makes me very proud and I was really born into an environment where music was cherished and treated as something precious. It was my family that saw potential in me and has supported me from my first performances all the way throughout classical and jazz education.

Here I am now, ready to record my Debut ALBUM "Colors of Within". It has been my dream since I was little to be able to write my own music and lyrics, arrange it for voice/flute and the band, then go to the studio and record it. 

What makes me extremely happy about this ALBUM is, that in this process of writing the music and lyrics I have experienced healing within myself. Words supported by music are talking about the topics of self-development and internal process that every one of us goes through. If we admit it or not.

If you decide to support this project, you'll be supporting my dream and potential of this music to envoke change in anyone who'll listen and be ready for it.

What We Need & What You Get

Where will your funds go?

  • Paying 5 Awesome Musicians (excluding me) on 2nd Voice, Guitar, Piano, Bass, Drums
  • Professional Recording Studio Costs
  • Track Mastering 
  • Design and Art for Album Cover
  • Marketing & Distribution

What do you get in return?

  • I have created interesting perks that you can choose from. Of course, if you contribute you'll get the end result  ALBUM "Colors of Within"... :) 

The Impact

Your contribution will:

  • change the stream of my career tremendously
  • empower listeners to look within, at the things in life that truly matter
  • give you my endless gratitude and love
  • give you a warm feeling for being part of the bigger change

Risks & Challenges

For the past few years, all the savings I had and earnings from different jobs were invested in studying, getting better at what I do and living abroad to be able to learn from the best.  So I'm relying on the crowd to really contribute to this project.

The risk, in that case, is that the project might stretch over the deadline (the end of 2018) in case the goal of this campaign is not reached.

I will work and do all that is in my power to execute this project as planned. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some of you won't be able to contribute financially, so you can help me in other ways:

  • Get the word out, over social media, messages, E-mails, or any other possible way. Maybe you can attach little story that you have with me if you know me personally. That might be fun.
  • Using Indiegogo page sharing tools might be the most effective way to share this campaign.

Thank you all so much for the support and being a big part in my story,

Milena

story:
I am truly excited about my first Album.  I must confess that this is harder than producing Singles.  This album however is a journey through my Pop Rock  addictions, poetic mood swings into my wild and crazy Soca flings.   I am from the Caribbean islands of  Trinidad and Tobago hence the  10, 61  at the end of my name which represents the latitude and longitude coordinates for the island of Trinidad - actually its -61.    I am influenced heavily by  Soca, Rapso, and Calypso of my Caribbean home.  My home was always filled with music and my parents: an SDA pastor and mother who was a nurse provided my brother and I with a stable and humble life. 

Beside working on this Album and singing I am an English teacher who works with many teens who don't know how to read and write. I have many boys - especially - who build great self esteem from reading.   Some even learn to write poems and great songs.  Many are motivated through my music to work harder.

Your donations are crucial to the fulfillment of my life's dream and future goals.  This album - "Dariot" is just the beginning of my international goal to Tour Canada and Europe. My West Indian culture is vibrant and unique.   My brand is new and original.  

I am in need of $1500 USD to complete the Album and secure marketing opportunities. 

$1000 USD - will pay off my production team

$500 USD -  will go towards my marketing campaign

In today's "indie" circuit it is crucial to have a solid online campaign before and after the launch of the Album.  

Once you donate to my worthy cause you will benefit from:

  • Free merch and music
  • The chance to be part of my music videos
  • For donations outside my territory I will send gifts via mail suchas; Caribbean rum, spices, cakes. 
  • Personal performances
  • My free pepper sauce (in selected Territories)
  • Free/discounted Guest Appearances at your events
  • A chance to witness the recording process

The Impact

Caribbean music is diverse and I believe its infectious.  This is my first campaign and I trust you would donate to my cause.  My music can save lives and motivates many to greatness.  The students I teach all become motivated to want more to become a "Do'er."

Risks & Challenges

Frankly I am from the Caribbean - my location may biggest obstacle.  This album wants it is successfully launched and released will ensure that my music not only reaches to you but it also will help me to physically meet you in the future.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I thank you for your time and consideration.  If you cant afford to please share my campaign and share my current music via my website and please use the Indiegogo share tools...

Thank you for you positive vibe and open spirit.

www.darius-music.com

story:
Who is the artist?

My name is Joanne Togati and I'm originally from Brooklyn, NY.  I started studying opera when I was 15 and joined the regional theater company at Regina Pacis, a local company operating through the Church.  I majored in musical studies in college, studied and sang in German, Italian, French and English.  I appreciated my classical studies which taught me about discipline, grace of line, vocal beauty and a myriad of other fine qualities that a classical education can offer.  My heart just wasn't in it the way an opera singer needs to operate.  I wasn't ecstatic and after each performance, I never had the desire for "more".  As a young child, I also had a fascination with literature and poetry.  I walked away from my university education at NYU in comparative literature studies, and eventually earned my BA in English Literature. A poetry award later, I was still longing for the stage so I auditioned for Broadway and got to my 4th callback on the show La Boheme which ran for a short time.  I didn't make the final cut but it told me that singing was not something I should give up.  Years later, I was in a rockband, teaching myself how to sing pop music, no easy task for a former opera singer.  I stayed with it and before long my band was playing music conferences and festivals on the East Coast.  We were making it but band member problems cut our success short.  The band broke up and I was solo.  For the first time in my life, I was literally at the end of the road.  But I couldn't accept defeat.  I went on to gather a great group of jazz players and set out to make a jazz album instead.  Pressing on, I was introduced to Joe Galaxy in 2016 and was soon on the Ford Stage at Sunfest 2017 opening up for Joe who was opening up for Pitbull.  I couldn't believe my music career had taken me in this direction, but I simply rose to the task and wrote my first EDM song called Vine.  I felt that tingle that I had felt with my rockband and by the grace of God was resurrected back into the music industry.  

Now I need the support that will help me truly succeed on this path.

Soon after, I funded 4 tracks that cost me a total of $15,000 with photoshoots, wardrobe, video shoots and travel that brought that number up to $30000.  In order to continue, I spent $10,000 in marketing but that is just the beginning.  A true investment in the music business can easily cost $100,000 in the first year with everything being done properly.  

Other important details about me that can help you contribute.

 In 2016, I was also managing my first 1 acre farm which I had built single handedly.  I had imported over 150 trees both exotic and domestic and discovered a superfood formula that cured Eczema as well as helping with a host of other skin conditions.  Music and my formula were now the 2 focuses of my life.  I envisioned buying hundred of acres and choosing to grow it all organically, supporting the permaculture effort so very needed today.  As a contributor you will be definitely helping me with both efforts by contributing to my campaign. I feel now that my life has a mission and if both music and the earth are yours, and even if they're not, you will be contributing to excellent causes.    Even if I don't meet my goal of $30,000, I will at least be able to  continue creating music to finish my album.  My goal ultimately is to work with a professional team to direct a truly artistic and well shot music video.  

 During my filming of my first music video in Paris, I met the owner of Juicy Empire who offered me my first grand debut on New Years Eve at Nouveau Casino, Paris France, no easy feat for a budding EDM singer.  The funds I raise will help me operate while I am here in Paris, collaborating on my next album which is actually retro RnB in nature,

You can contribute on various levels which include merchandise, and an exciting opportunity to be part of a live show experience.  My music has been making an impact in Europe and doors started opening. I am now meeting with Dj's worldwide so I truly believe there is a future there for me but I do need your help now more than ever!  Follow my story on social media like Facebook and Instagram under Joanne Togati.  

This career is not for everyone.  The travel and preparation alone are not for the meek at heart but I have the drive and passion to do it.  I look forward to working with excellent music video directors and creatives in the arenas of fashion, production and photography.  I employ a number of individuals in the creative arts and they are all rooting for my success!  Thank you for being part of my journey!

Soon after, I funded 4 tracks that cost me a total of $15,000 with photoshoots, wardrobe, video shoots and travel that brought that number up to $30000.  In order to continue, I spent $10,000 in marketing but that is just the beginning.  A true investment in the music business can easily cost $100,000 in the first year with everything being done properly.  
Other important details about me that can help you contribute.
 In 2016, I was also managing my first 1 acre farm which I had built single handedly.  I had imported over 150 trees both exotic and domestic and discovered a superfood formula that cured Eczema as well as helping with a host of other skin conditions.  Music and my formula were now the 2 focuses of my life.  I envisioned buying hundred of acres and choosing to grow it all organically, supporting the permaculture effort so very needed today.  As a contributor you will be definitely helping me with both efforts by contributing to my campaign. I feel now that my life has a mission and if both music and the earth are yours, and even if they're not, you will be contributing to excellent causes.    Even if I don't meet my goal of $30,000, I will at least be able to  continue creating music to finish my album.  My goal ultimately is to work with a professional team to direct a truly artistic and well shot music video.  
 During my filming of my first music video in Paris, I met the owner of Juicy Empire who offered me my first grand debut on New Years Eve at Nouveau Casino, Paris France, no easy feat for a budding EDM singer.  The funds I raise will help me operate while I am here in Paris, collaborating on my next album which is actually retro RnB in nature,
You can contribute on various levels which include merchandise, and an exciting opportunity to be part of a live show experience.  My music has been making an impact in Europe and doors started opening. I am now meeting with Dj's worldwide so I truly believe there is a future there for me but I do need your help now more than ever!  Follow my story on social media like Facebook and Instagram under Joanne Togati.  
This career is not for everyone.  The travel and preparation alone are not for the meek at heart but I have the drive and passion to do it.  I look forward to working with excellent music video directors and creatives in the arenas of fashion, production and photography.  I employ a number of individuals in the creative arts and they are all rooting for my success!  Thank you for being part of my journey!

story: The Waymores is made up of country songstress, Kira Annalise, and the legendary Willie Heath Neal. The couple have years between them with their separate full band careers but when they got together to form this duo, something magical happened. They tour about 200 days of the year together and they do it all out of their little Ford Edge. Well, they used to. In February, the duo were in Kentucky and a snow storm hit. An Icy patch of road and a tree wound up being the demise of the car they earned their living in. Things could have been a lot worse, we all know, but now The Waymores are without a tour vehicle and they can’t make their living. They’re on tour in Europe right now and they’re coming home to a scary situation: A new album out and no way to bring it to you! Please help these talented folks reach a down payment for a new tour vehicle. We’re asking $5000 so that they can get something reliable and comfortable. Whatever you can donate is helpful and  no amount is too small. If you can’t donate, please help by sharing the campaign with your friends who may be able to help. Our friends are in need and your donation won’t be in vain...

story:
Be a part of helping me record my first worship EP

My name is Seth Fowler and one of my greatest joys is to be a worship leader and to adore Jesus through the creative vessel of music. I am passionate about seeing the Church encounter God in times of worship and I have been working diligently to write songs specifically for the Church to sing out to the Lord.

There is no shortage of worship music out in the world, but still I believe there is a need for fresh songs that are inspired by the Spirit and curated for the Church to sing. Songs that are simple and enjoyable, yet deep and meaningful. I have specifically focused on writing those types of songs, which has taken years of study, practice, and lessons in song-crafting. It's been a long journey to reach this point but it's been exciting and rewarding. 

In April of 2019, I took steps to reach out to Paul Arend (Producer/Mixer/Worship Leader) about recording and producing an EP. I reached out to him specifically because of the years of worship leading and mixing experience he's had at Bethel Church and Vineyard Anaheim. We are currently in the process of refining and arranging songs. At the moment, we have scheduled a tentative recording date in August, 2019. 

I believe the labor of songwriting for many years has produced fruit that is ready to be released. I am not looking to quit my day-job or become "known" but simply wanting to use the creativity that God has placed in me to lead people into worshipping Christ deeper. After all, our gifts from the Lord are meant to be used, not buried. Recorded music is the way people listen to worship music the majority of time, so I think its time to steward the vision God has given me and jump into the process of recording an EP.

Thank you for reading so far, and I hope that you will consider partnering with me by pre-ordering the EP and contributing to this project. I've prayed about recording for many years now and I feel that God has made it clear to me that the time is now for me to pursue it--regardless of how much I am able to raise. I will be taking a step of faith in order to pursue this, so EVERY dollar helps!

story:
Why make an album now?

I've held off on truly making my own music for awhile... it's always been for someone or something else (which isn't bad BTW), but with the urging & support of family and friends, it's finally time. It's time to get that raw soulful country rock sound deep within my heart out to the family, friends and people that want it. Even just seeing the responses from KSON (103.7fm) playing our rendition of the National Anthem... made me realize that this is the time and place. 

Why Indiegogo?

It takes some money to do it right... I can do this at home and make something pretty cool on my own, but to make something that I can look back on and be proud of for years to come... I need to include the right talent, the right producer, the right recording scenarios... it takes funds. And so instead of seeking a record deal, I'd rather include my friends, family and anyone else interested in this... by basically doing pre-sales through Indiegogo. And whatever comes in, I'll put it right back into the project.

 

Contributor Levels

So the goal of this whole thing is to get you to share this and get more people involved. So how do we do that? Well, my thought is Contributor levels... the idea is this... if you get in and contribute during this campaign, even if it's at the bottom level, but it funds all the way up to Tier D, I would love for you to be rewarded for that.... So here's the deal, each contributor level has a basic "reward"... but if the total project funding bumps up, so does your "reward".

Check it out...

$10 Digital Contributor

  • If Tier A reached - a Digital copy of acoustic album 
  • If Tier B reached - a Digital copy of full studio album
  • If Tier D reached - a Digital copy of the live album / private concert featuring Brad Fite of The Whisper Mill

 

$20 Standard Contributor

  • Digital album copies of all project tiers
  • Physical album copies of all project tiers
  • Your name included in the credits of all videos
  • If tier C reached - T-shirt to the first 100 contributors 
  • If tier D reached - Entry into private recording concert (travel not included)

 

$50 Silver Contributor

  • All lower contributor level rewards
  • Hand written letter of my sincere gratitude that you’d care enough to put in this much to see this project come together
  • If Tier C reached, a vinyl copy of the album to the first 100 contributors
  • If Tier D reached, 1 ticket to the private live recording, & show  (excludes all travel or accommodations to show)
  • If Tier E reached, any and all merch produced including T-shirts, mugs, etc... (shipping to USA only)

 

$100 Gold Contributor

  • All lower investor level rewards
  • A Personal live solo recording from any of the songs from the album catalog 
  • If Tier D reached, 2 tickets to the private live recording, & show & wristband for the BBQ!  (excludes all travel or accommodations to show)
  • If Tier E reached, 2 tickets to a show with a private meet and greet (excludes all travel or accommodations to show)
  • If Tier F reached, 2 tickets to a show with a private meet and greet (excludes all travel or accommodations to show)

 

$1000+ Platinum Contributor

(Well that escalated quickly gif)

  • Message me and let me know what you'd like!

 

If you can't contribute...

Doesn't mean you can't share this. It's crazy how all it takes sometimes is one person letting someone else know about something... and then world changing happens. 

 

Project Funding Tiers

There's two initial funding stages, Tier A at $5k, where I would essentially produce it all myself, is the first step. 

Tier A

//Here's what will be produced once Tier A funding is achieved:

  • Acoustic 10+ song album
  • Digital release
  • 2+ music videos

Money would be distributed accordingly:

  • $1000 - recording equipment (cables/mics/strings/etc...)
  • $3000 - to musicians, musical accompaniment 
  • $1000 - preproduction (rehearsals / etc...)

 

However, I would also love to see the project go full fledged studio status... which bumps us up to  $12k for Tier B;

Tier B

//Here's what will be produced at Tier B

  • Full studio album
  • Physical CD release
  • Digital album release
  • 3+ music videos

The financial breakdown would look like this:

  • $1500 - recording equipment (cables/mics/strings/etc...)
  • $3k+ to players
  • $1000 - preproduction (rehearsals / etc...)
  • $2000 - Producer
  • $2000 - studio/recording engineer
  • $1000 - video shooting / editing
  • $1500 - physical CD reproduction

 

And why stop there?! Here's where the project can go if additional Funding Tiers are reached:

Tier C

//Here's what will be produced at $17k Tier C 

  • Vinyl Press of the album
  • Merch (shirts, Mugs, etc..)

 

Tier D

//Here's what will be produced at $25k Tier D

  • Live album / private concert / video
  • Live album Physical CD’s
  • Digital album release
  • Full concert music videos
  • Fly out Brad from The Whisper Mill to perform w/me

 

Tier E

//Here's what will be produced at $50k Tier E 

  • 10 date tour

 

Tier F

//Here's what will be produced at $100k Tier F

  • Buy onto National tour

(Do I expect it to go to this level? C'mon, a bald bearded old guy from Lakeside raising $100k in a little over a month? Yeah, I doubt it... but I've seen crazier things done :P)

 

 

Interested in hearing what an "Acoustical Scratch Preview" sounds like?

    

 

Thank you for considering being a part of this project!!!

story:
Short Summary

We are a team of students from various backgrounds, including two Taiwanese girls that are passionate about culture and arts, and who found in Paris a lot of curiosity about their culture.

We decided together to organise an high standard event with different aspects to let Paris know about Taiwanese culture and its sophistication.

Here is our team:

  • Lin Huang, former cultural event organizer of NewArt Foundation (Taiwan) and our artistic director.
  • Juno Chao, former intern at Tadao Ando museum (Taiwan) and our administrative director.
  • Lauriane Paulhiac, current intern at Agence Profile, former employee of Pole to Win Europe and our marketing and communication director.
  • Eddie Vann, who participated many event related project previously.

By helping us, you will bring to life a wonderful event that will allow you to travel miles away from Paris to Taïwan, to a beautiful island full of poesy in every detail.

Résumé

Nous sommes une équipe d'étudiants de différentes origines, dont deux taïwanaises passionnées par l'art et la culture, qui ont rencontré à Paris beaucoup de curiosité à propos de leur culture.

Nous avons décidé tous ensemble d'organiser un événement de qualité avec plusieurs facettes pour faire découvrir à Paris toute la richesse de la culture taïwanaise.

Voici notre équipe:

Lin Huang, a été organisatrice d'événements culturels à New Art Fundation à Taïwan, et est notre directrice artistique.

Juno Chao, précédemment stagiaire à Musée Tadao Ando et notre directrice administrative.

Lauriane Paulhiac, stagiaire à Agence Profile et anciennement employée à Pole To Win Europe. Notre directrice marketing et communication.

Eddie Vann, qui a participé à de nombreux événements culturels.

En nous aidant, vous permettrez à notre événement de voir le jour, et vous aurez l'opportunité de voyager à l'autre bout du globe, sur une île magnifique, pleine de poésie.

What We Need

To make our event happen, is here what we need:

  • Stipends for our artists: a soprano, a flutist, a pianist and a guest speaker
  • Technical fees for equipment rental (light, sound and recording equipment)
  • A venue for our event

Ce dont nous avons besoin

Pour que notre événement voit le jour, voici ce dont nous avons besoin:

  • De quoi rémunérer nos artistes: une soprano, un flûtiste, une pianiste et une conférencière
  • Frais techniques pour louer du matériel (système lumière, son et équipement d'enregistrement)
  • Location d'un lieu pour notre événement

The Impact

All of your contribution will go to our artists to reward them for their performance and their work. You will help raise awareness about Taïwan and its specific culture and music, and make people discover new things.

Votre impact

Toutes vos contributions iront à nos artistes pour les récompenser de leur prestation et de leur travail. Vous nous aiderez à promouvoir Taïwan et sa culture si spécifique, ainsi que sa richesse musicale, souvent méconnue. Aidez-nous à faire découvrir à Paris toute la beauté du raffinement taïwanais !

story:
Short Summary

How much would you pay for good sax?

What would you do if I could show you, not only how to legally pay for good sax, but to also get incredible incentives on top of it?

If there were a possibility of your body resonating afterwards, would you do it?

With all the stressful day-to-day news and activities we are all experiencing, there’s nothing like coming home to have good sax waiting for you. We as vibrational beings can benefit from a vibrational retuning of our body mind and spirit.

(NOW THAT I HAVE YOUR ATTENTION) 

This is why I always desired to create a project such as this. As a saxophonist and producer, I wanted to not just rerecord Aaliyah’s music but to arrange them using different styles while keeping the integrity of the original composition. The mission or purpose of this recording is to emanate Love, Healing and good vibrations in the world. You will walk away feeling positive and resonating with the intentions that created the music.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a breakdown of the more immediate need for funds. There are other needs and obstacles afterwards, as far as promoting, but this is the first major hurdle that we need to get over ASAP to meet the deadline. 

1. Recording sessions (paying engineers, artists and musicians) = $2000

2. Mixing and Mastering = $3000 (by Mike Parlett of Talent Records in L.A.)

3. CD Manufacturing = $2000 (initial order from discmakers)

4. Graphic Design = $500 (for cd jacket, insert, and promotions)

5. Photo Shoot = $400 (For promotions)

6. Licensing= $1100 (Mechanical licensing for permission to record cover songs)

Total= $9,000

By helping us with your contributions you will receive the music before it is released, access to behind the scenes of finishing up the recording, free merchandise, free unreleased material, a personal look under the hood to see how it is being created, as well as other great incentives.

If there is the unlikeliness of not reaching our goal, the funds raised will go to the recording and mixing and mastering portion because that is the most important.

The Impact

The success of this project with your help will allow me to do more important works in the future. I have so many other ideas that are going to be monumental but the only thing in the way of making them happen is the capital to get it done. I believe it takes ideas to make money, not necessarily money to make money. With the power of numbers (all of us), we can "get 'er done!" (in the voice of Larry The Cable Guy)

With 9 independent records under my belt, I know what it takes to complete a project and every project I have done has gotten only better and better. I have always wanted to have a way to interact and work directly with my fans and supporters with my past projects. This platform is that interface to connect us. I only wish I had this platform in the past for my other recordings. Here is our chance to work together and collaborate on the first of many projects in the future! 

Risks & Challenges

The major risks and challenges for this campaign frankly are just not being able to get the word out quickly enough so that people are aware of it, meeting all the deadlines in time, and being able to complete the rest of the recordings. This is one of the busiest times of the year for me so being able to organize my time and coordinate with other busy people will be challenging. Sometimes trying to bring musicians together is like trying to herd cats together. Lol But fortunately, 80% of the material is complete already and we are down to the last 20% stretch. So it shouldn't be too bad to get everything complete in time.  

I have always been good at organizing my time and planning things in detail. I think it's because I'm a very involved dad of 2 girls, the middle child of 6 kids and a Libra. ;o) I like and need balance and structure.

Other Ways You Can Help

There is no amount that is too small. Please share this with as many people as you can. Thank you soooo much, to those that have already joined us! I need for everyone to blast this out to everyone you know! Don't fret not being able to directly contribute to this campaign. It is invaluable for you to share this to people you know. Use the link(s) that got you here and that is listed on this site. Lets work together and do our part to help bring peace, Love and harmony back into the world we live in.

What We Need & What You Get
Here is a breakdown of the more immediate need for funds. There are other needs and obstacles afterwards, as far as promoting, but this is the first major hurdle that we need to get over ASAP to meet the deadline. 
1. Recording sessions (paying engineers, artists and musicians) = $2000
2. Mixing and Mastering = $3000 (by Mike Parlett of Talent Records in L.A.)
3. CD Manufacturing = $2000 (initial order from discmakers)
4. Graphic Design = $500 (for cd jacket, insert, and promotions)
5. Photo Shoot = $400 (For promotions)
6. Licensing= $1100 (Mechanical licensing for permission to record cover songs)
Total= $9,000
By helping us with your contributions you will receive the music before it is released, access to behind the scenes of finishing up the recording, free merchandise, free unreleased material, a personal look under the hood to see how it is being created, as well as other great incentives.
If there is the unlikeliness of not reaching our goal, the funds raised will go to the recording and mixing and mastering portion because that is the most important.

The Impact
The success of this project with your help will allow me to do more important works in the future. I have so many other ideas that are going to be monumental but the only thing in the way of making them happen is the capital to get it done. I believe it takes ideas to make money, not necessarily money to make money. With the power of numbers (all of us), we can "get 'er done!" (in the voice of Larry The Cable Guy)
With 9 independent records under my belt, I know what it takes to complete a project and every project I have done has gotten only better and better. I have always wanted to have a way to interact and work directly with my fans and supporters with my past projects. This platform is that interface to connect us. I only wish I had this platform in the past for my other recordings. Here is our chance to work together and collaborate on the first of many projects in the future! 

Risks & Challenges
The major risks and challenges for this campaign frankly are just not being able to get the word out quickly enough so that people are aware of it, meeting all the deadlines in time, and being able to complete the rest of the recordings. This is one of the busiest times of the year for me so being able to organize my time and coordinate with other busy people will be challenging. Sometimes trying to bring musicians together is like trying to herd cats together. Lol But fortunately, 80% of the material is complete already and we are down to the last 20% stretch. So it shouldn't be too bad to get everything complete in time.  
I have always been good at organizing my time and planning things in detail. I think it's because I'm a very involved dad of 2 girls, the middle child of 6 kids and a Libra. ;o) I like and need balance and structure.

Other Ways You Can Help
There is no amount that is too small. Please share this with as many people as you can. Thank you soooo much, to those that have already joined us! I need for everyone to blast this out to everyone you know! Don't fret not being able to directly contribute to this campaign. It is invaluable for you to share this to people you know. Use the link(s) that got you here and that is listed on this site. Lets work together and do our part to help bring peace, Love and harmony back into the world we live in.

story:
Every now and then, a songwriter is gifted by their subconscious — or perhaps even a higher, more mysterious power — with a song in a dream. It might be just a fragment: a key line or chorus, a snatch of melody that lingers through the fog of waking up, or perhaps even a world-shaking riff on the order of "Satisfaction." Dustin Welch can attest to the phenomenon himself, having been blessed with not just a couple of legitimate "dream songs" over the years, but something on a far grander scale. Once upon a time, he dreamed a whole sound.

"It was profound," he would recall years later, "and I'd never heard anything like it." It was a chaotic but surreally harmonious maelstrom of ramshackle folk, stomping blues, gypsy jazz and driving rock that was gritty, raw, and archaic but also somehow futuristic, like a steampunk chamber orchestra playing a backwoods hootenanny or a post-apocalypse dive-bar. He didn't just hear that sound, either; it was a full-sensory experience that he could see and feel too, "like horses running wild." 

Welch would spend the better part of his teens and early 20s chasing that sound/vision before finally cornering it on his 2009 debut, Whisky Priest — but he knew from the very start of that project that one album alone would not be enough to corral its full sonic and thematic scope. It demanded, at the very least, a trilogy. And time: time for each of the songs to reveal themselves in full, unforced, and find their own alignment in the cycle, and time for the songwriter himself to continue to grow along the way. Thus it would be four years before Welch delivered the second chapter (2013's Tijuana Bible), and another six years after that before bringing the trilogy to its proper close. Not, as he'd originally predicted, before the altar of some church (be it sacred or profane), but rather full circle to a stage where art — and dreams — often as not don't end, but begin. 

Welcome to Dustin Welch's Amateur Theater. 

"I just thought the theater was more appropriate than a church," he explains with a grin, "and I kind like the chaos of the amateur theater in particular. But I also like the implied freshness of it, too. There's a line in the song 'Poster Child': 'The entire audience suffocates on opening night.' I like the idea of it being opening night ... again, where it all becomes new again, reborn."

That there's also more than a hint of devilish mischief and outright menace in that same line of course goes without saying; going all the way back to "One False Move," the bracing opening track on Whisky Priest, the entire trilogy has been fraught with a palpable sense of danger and adversity at every turn. But through all that darkness there's always been a thread of hope, too: either running parallel to the despair, just beneath the surface, or dangled just out of reach like the proverbial carrot. At its bleakest, Amateur Theater at times feels even more harrowing than either of its two predecessors. But it's also the light at the end of a tunnel and, true to classical form, a sort of homecoming. 

"It's the Hero's Journey," explains Welch, a voracious reader and student of literature, philosophy, and history who could spend an entire evening discussing Joseph Campbell and mono-mythic theory as happily as he could swapping songs anywhere from Austin to Amsterdam. Needless to say, he knows his Dante, too. 

"It's pretty loose," Welch says of his trilogy's debt to Alighieri's Divine Comedy, "but I was definitely conscious of it, as far as the first record being the descent into hell, the second one being purgatory, and this one being sort of the redemption. And in a lot of ways it sort of resembles my own life and what I was going through at the time. But the character in all of these songs is really just that archetype of anybody that is looking for truth, looking for some kind of value and redemption for the soul. In any kind of mythology, you establish the struggle and conflict, and how does that resolve itself? By holding onto by some kind of faith. That's the little glimmer of hope that I keep striving for, and I feel like by the end of Amateur Theater, this character has finally achieved that. You've come out on the other side, and that's where the character becomes the hero."

Of course, none of this mono-mythic "hero" talk would matter if the actual songs didn't hold up. But from the fearsome opening salvo of "Stick to the Facts," a swaggering tall-tail wagger boasting "the means to take your dreams and tear them all apart / or turn an empty canvas to a priceless piece of art," straight through to the redemptive closing prayer of "Far Horizon," Amateur Theater is more than "just" the triumphant culmination of a decade-long trilogy; it's a compelling document of a years-in-the-making epic journey unto itself. The earliest tracks were recorded back in 2014 at a state-of-the-art studio in Copenhagen, where Dustin and his father, renowned Americana singer-songwriter Kevin Welch, had originally planned to work on a different project entirely, using many of the ace Danish musician featured on Kevin's 2002 album, Millionaire. Unfortunately, almost as soon as they got there, Kevin ended up laid out with three herniated discs in his neck. Having travelled halfway around the world and already booked the studio for a full week, though, they decided to make the best out of a bad situation. 

"We were able to cut a couple of songs with my dad at the beginning, but after it got to where he couldn't even play, most of the week just ended up being my session," says Dustin. "We had this fantastic band come in, and we cut like 16 songs in five days. Those guys were incredible — you could throw anything at them! A lot of the songs we got were first takes."

As productive as that first session in Denmark was, though, Welch still had a long way to go after returning home to Texas. Additional recording and post-production would be done piecemeal, as funds and scheduling allowed, over the next four years at various friends' studios in and around Austin, Nashville, and Norman, Oklahoma. All the while Welch continued to write, fine tuning new songs and revisiting others he'd long held in reserve, including "Dresden Snow," a co-write with Cary Ann Hurst of Shovels and Rope and Bill Carson. That one, inspired by the 2005 Jonathan Safran Foer novel Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close, actually dates all the way back to the early days of Whisky Priest. "We wrote it the same day that we wrote [Whisky Priest's] 'Don't Tell 'Em Nothin',' but I knew it just wasn't the time for that song yet," Welch says. "I was always thinking in terms of the big picture, thematically." 

Other co-writing friends featured on Amateur Theater, many of whom also play or sing on the record, include John Fullbright, John Hadley, Javi Garcia, Jamie Lin Wilson, Jeremiah Nelson, Jeremy Nail, Mark Germino, Scotty Melton, and Chris Luedeke. Welch also wrote three songs with his dad, each an undeniable highlight: the aforementioned "Far Horizon," written during two of their tours together, a year apart, in Australia; the sobering "Man of Stone," which originated as a poem Kevin wrote about a fan who'd committed suicide; and the life-affirming "After the Music" — inspired by an elderly couple Dustin witnessed waltzing together, sans music, in the middle of an empty Texas dancehall while he was packing up his gear after a show. 

Welch never actually mentions that incident in the song, let alone his believe that the couple he saw might well have been ghosts, but the beauty of the moment shook him to the soul — every bit as much as the harrowing stories of war and PTSD that he's heard first hand from the veterans he's worked with over the years through his songwriting-as-therapy program, Soldiers Songs and Voices. Their experiences aren't his own, but they're all very much a part of the "big picture" that he's devoted the last decade of his life and art to framing. "It's all about survival," he offers. "The whole album — the whole trilogy — is really about going through all hell, but knowing that you've got to be able to press through, to keep that hope and faith, and come back home."

Welcome home, then, to Amateur Theater. Where it's opening night ... again — and time for the restless hero's journey to be born anew. 

"To be honest, I have no idea yet where I'll go from here, but after being tied to this one thing for so long, now that it's done, I feel sort of set loose." says Welch. "What that means exactly, I don't know — but I do think the next record's going to be a whole different deal."

After a little more thought, though, he can't help but laugh.

"Maybe I'll do a prequel trilogy ..."

story:
About "Unyielding"

We are Eternity's End, an international power metal band with neoclassical and speed metal influences, featuring former and current members of Necrophagist, Symphony X, Hibria, First Fragment and Alkaloid. The band was founded in 2014 and we released our debut album "The Fire Within" through Power Prog records in 2016. The album was very well received by both medias and critics alike. Unfortunately, the band's label went out of business in late 2016.

Shortly after the release of The Fire Within, we started writing songs for our second album titled "Unyielding". We are currently in the recording process. The album will be mixed and mastered by Piet Sielck (Iron Savior, Savage Circus) at Powerhouse Studios in Hamburg, starting in the last week of August. Piet and his team will also provide the choirs and backing vocals for the album.

The line up for Unyielding consists of:

Iuri Sanson - vocals

Christian Muenzner - lead&rhythm guitars

Phil Tougas - lead&rhythm guitars

Jimmy Pitts - keyboards

Mike LePond - Bass

Hannes Grossmann - Drums

The album will contain 10 songs, with a playtime of over 50 minutes of truly uncompromising, over the top power metal, with a strong emphasis on virtuoso musicianship, attitude and catchy-ness, in a unique combination of German, American and Japanese power metal influences mixed with Japanese SNES soundtracks. Very aggressive riffing, straight forward song structures, neoclassical chord progressions, triple lead trade offs and harmonies between 2 guitarists and a keyboardist, very memorable choruses, big, epic choirs and some of the most over the top classic metal vocals ever delivered by Iuri Sanson (ex Hibria) are the cornerstones of the music on our 2nd album. Despite the focus on over the top musicianship the entire album remains very catchy and memorable. What we feel sets Unyielding apart from the majority of other contemporary power metal releases is the aggression, passion and relentless-ness that got lost in the genre, the focus on aggressive, speedy riffs and dynamic performances by all members involved, allowing each member to put their own individual stamp on the music instead of producing a "pop metal" album.

A crowd funding campaign with the direct involvement of the fans is the best and only way for us to finance a production which we feel does the songs justice. We want to give the album the best sound and performance possible, therefore we need a budget for a proper, time consuming mix and master and to pay studio time for drum, bass, vocal and choir recordings. We also want to give the album the best possible design and will pay for the artwork ourselves through the funds generated from this campaign.

After the production is finished, we will try to license the album to different companies for distribution in different territories of the world. But in the days of constantly declining record sales and an over crowded market no record label in that genre of music will be able to pay a recording advance that will cover the expenses of the production.

An album like that is always a labor of love and not intended for personal enrichment, but also a very time consuming undertaking for everyone involved and which also bares a big financial risk. By contributing to this campaign, you can help us to cover the costs for the production and minimize the financial risk for us. Therefore, you are guaranteed to receive a high quality product.

What We Need & What You Get

The costs for the production process will include:

- mix and master of the album

- studio time for vocal, backing vocal, choir, guitar, drum and bass recordings, engineering, editing and re-amping

- the cover artwork and 16 page booklet

In this campaign you can pre-order  a physical copy of the album in CD version or a digital download, estimated delivery will be the first week of December. You can also order different 2 CD or 3 CD bundles.

We also offer the Guitar Pro Files for all the songs from The Fire Within and Unyielding. Please specify in your order if you want to receive the files in Guitar Pro 5, 6 or 7 format.

You also get the chance to have either Christian, Phil or Jimmy play a solo on your band's album, demo, single or video.

You can also get an individual Skype lesson with guitarist Christian Muenzner on guitar technique, harmony&theory, improvisation, songwriting/composition/arrangement, fretboard knowledge, music business insights etc.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute to the campaign, you can help us out by spreading the word, sharing this campaign on social media sites and forums. Any help is greatly appreciated!

story:
My band and I are looking into recording new music super soon, having just finished uni as music students and struggling to pull the funds together for all the exciting things we want to record, we are looking for any donations to try and kick start this exciting process!

Obviously we understand it's a lot to ask for and this is why any donations, no matter how big or small, would be so greatly appreciated!

There is no doubt that the recording will go ahead either way, but we believe the project will be best achieved with funding and any extra help we can get along the way! We have set ourselves the goal of reaching £250. We have a couple of new exciting pop projects which are completely different to anything I’ve released before in the making and we really want to make these something we can be proud of.

We are so excited to record and can't wait to get started with bringing lots of new music out for everyone to hear!

Anybody who donates will receive a free digital copy of my new music when it is released!

Thanks so much,

Nikki xxx

story:
about me (Karin Plato)

 

  • I am a Vancouver based independent recording artist,  jazz vocalist, composer and arranger and I've jumped in the deep end (so to speak) and recorded a brand new recording of mostly originals along with a few other tunes that I really love and connect with. THIS COULD BE THE ONE will be released on CD and on vinyl this September.

 

  • I feel lucky to be able to work with some of the very best jazz musicians in Vancouver: pianist Chris Gestrin, clarinetist James Danderfer, bassist Laurence Mollerup &  drummer Joe Poole  YES!  Each of these gents put their heart and soul into this recording with me. The guest artists involved in the project were the icing on my "music cake"  The guests: vocalists Jim Byrnes, Rebecca Shoichet, and trombonist Rod Murray again YES!

 

  • Although this is a DIY project there have been many sizable expenses along the way! We recorded in the famed Warehouse Studio (Bryan Adam's Studio) and we took our time with recording, mixing and mastering of the final work and I think the result is quite special. The artistry and skill level of the musicians, and engineer Sheldon Zaharko at the console capturing a warm and natural sound “live off the floor” in the studio, resulted in this quality recording for which I am thrilled.

     

  • This is my first time approaching potential fans and possible supporters of a music project in a crowd funding campaign. Support could be provided in several ways: Purchasing one of the perk packages offered in this campaign will certainly help. You can also help by spreading the word about the new recording. I think we've got something good here! 

 

Perks & Pledges re: Karin's campaign

 

  • I've created some unique perks which I hope will entice potential supporters. Most of these perks are related to the music recorded and the graphic art we used for the CD and vinyl packaging.  The sketched character BO is a big part of the graphics work. My husband and artist Gorm Damborg sketched and created this character for me. In Danish the name BO means "to live" and thematically the music is about experiences many of us will have in our own lifetimes.

 

  • There are exclusive perks such as hosting a house concert in your own home (some stipulations apply) and there are other perhaps more affordable perks including calendars, lyric booklets and more. There's also the VIP perk package which includes VIP tickets to one of 2 special album release concerts. These perks allow you to get something in addition to the music, either for yourself or, as gifts for others while in turn you'll be helping with this campaign. A signed CD is included with most perks.

 

  • Regarding what your money will support at this stage: Your pledges will help cover musician fees for album release concerts, Graphic artist fees and promotional fees beyond what I am able to cover on my own. There are certainly other areas where money raised in this campaign will help and I'll try to be transparent along the way with updates as the weeks progress.

 

about the recording "THIS COULD BE THE ONE"

 

  • Regarding this new recording I can tell you that it is the result of almost 10 years of singing, playing, composing, performing, learning, improving and arranging music. Time has passed and like everyone else, much has happened and I believe that is reflected in the music. I know that no one in particular is actually "waiting" for my music but as an artist it is something I am compelled to do: to create, to be creative and to work on this art with passion and honesty. I get excited listening to how my fellow musicians sound on the recording. This record is authentic and filled with beautiful heart. Truly!

FINALLY...

  • Some potential fans do not have the means to get involved financially and that I can completely understand and respect that. I'd certainly be grateful for any help getting the word out about the new recording, this campaign and the September concerts. Sharing the information with friends via word of mouth or email or via social media will be a big help too. Thank you all!

Karin
story_txt:
about me (Karin Plato)
 
I am a Vancouver based independent recording artist,  jazz vocalist, composer and arranger and I've jumped in the deep end (so to speak) and recorded a brand new recording of mostly originals along with a few other tunes that I really love and connect with. THIS COULD BE THE ONE will be released on CD and on vinyl this September.
 
I feel lucky to be able to work with some of the very best jazz musicians in Vancouver: pianist Chris Gestrin, clarinetist James Danderfer, bassist Laurence Mollerup &  drummer Joe Poole  YES!  Each of these gents put their heart and soul into this recording with me. The guest artists involved in the project were the icing on my "music cake"  The guests: vocalists Jim Byrnes, Rebecca Shoichet, and trombonist Rod Murray again YES!

 


Although this is a DIY project there have been many sizable expenses along the way! We recorded in the famed Warehouse Studio (Bryan Adam's Studio) and we took our time with recording, mixing and mastering of the final work and I think the result is quite special. The artistry and skill level of the musicians, and engineer Sheldon Zaharko at the console capturing a warm and natural sound “live off the floor” in the studio, resulted in this quality recording for which I am thrilled.
 

This is my first time approaching potential fans and possible supporters of a music project in a crowd funding campaign. Support could be provided in several ways: Purchasing one of the perk packages offered in this campaign will certainly help. You can also help by spreading the word about the new recording. I think we've got something good here! 

 

Perks & Pledges re: Karin's campaign
 
I've created some unique perks which I hope will entice potential supporters. Most of these perks are related to the music recorded and the graphic art we used for the CD and vinyl packaging.  The sketched character BO is a big part of the graphics work. My husband and artist Gorm Damborg sketched and created this character for me. In Danish the name BO means "to live" and thematically the music is about experiences many of us will have in our own lifetimes.
 
There are exclusive perks such as hosting a house concert in your own home (some stipulations apply) and there are other perhaps more affordable perks including calendars, lyric booklets and more. There's also the VIP perk package which includes VIP tickets to one of 2 special album release concerts. These perks allow you to get something in addition to the music, either for yourself or, as gifts for others while in turn you'll be helping with this campaign. A signed CD is included with most perks.
 
Regarding what your money will support at this stage: Your pledges will help cover musician fees for album release concerts, Graphic artist fees and promotional fees beyond what I am able to cover on my own. There are certainly other areas where money raised in this campaign will help and I'll try to be transparent along the way with updates as the weeks progress.
 

about the recording "THIS COULD BE THE ONE"
 
Regarding this new recording I can tell you that it is the result of almost 10 years of singing, playing, composing, performing, learning, improving and arranging music. Time has passed and like everyone else, much has happened and I believe that is reflected in the music. I know that no one in particular is actually "waiting" for my music but as an artist it is something I am compelled to do: to create, to be creative and to work on this art with passion and honesty. I get excited listening to how my fellow musicians sound on the recording. This record is authentic and filled with beautiful heart. Truly!

FINALLY...

Some potential fans do not have the means to get involved financially and that I can completely understand and respect that. I'd certainly be grateful for any help getting the word out about the new recording, this campaign and the September concerts. Sharing the information with friends via word of mouth or email or via social media will be a big help too. Thank you all!
Karin

story:
Help Spha record her debut album

My name is Spha Mdlalose, I'm a South African singer/ songwriter and band leader. I also host my own jazz show on an online radio station called TransAfrica Radio.

I started recording my debut album two years ago and I need your help to complete the rest of the project. The funds raised from this campaign will assist me with recording costs such as booking studio time, mixing, mastering, C.D printing and a range of other relevant project related costs.

The album will consist of mostly original material that is influenced by jazz, soul and a variety of African sounds. 

I'm very excited about the prospect of sharing this personal and musical journey with you and hope that you will enjoy the completed offering!

How much?

I need a total of $ 9 000 to be able to complete the project in the way that I have envisioned. This amount will cover:

Booking studio time

Mixing and Mastering

C.d Printing

PR and advertising

 

To inject a bit of excitement into our budding "partnership"I will be offering fun perks namely: 

5 x 1 hour vocal lessons that you can use for yourself, or for friends  and  family as a gift.

4 x comps for the album launch to the first four campaign contributors.

15 x copies of the digital album up for pre order (and sent straight to you).

50 x signed copies of the full physical album for pre order.

20 x hampers of some of my favourite things, including a signed copy of the physical album.

6 x intimate trio concerts at your house/ garden for you and your friends. 

*This perk is only available to Johannesburg residents.

 

In the event that I do not reach the goal of $ 9000, the donated funds will still used for the album.

With this being my debut album, this project is a culmination of a life long dream and your contributions will be crucial in helping me realise this dream. I have always believed in the ability of music to convey emotions, thoughts and messages that cannot otherwise be easily articulated. In this way music has always been a place of solace, a  liberating experience and something that brings sheer joy and happiness to many the world over.This is how I hope the world will experience my musical offering. 

 

Hardships and Challenges:

The arts and jazz music in South Africa are not an easy terrain to navigate, more so for an independent artist like myself. This comes with a number of risks and challenges, namely: 

Financial constraints, 

Inadequate opportunities to share and/or perform the music 

My sheer determination and absolute love for what i do will go a long way in helping me overcome these challenges. My plan is to take the music to spaces that are not known as conventional music performance spaces, in this way the music can have a broader audience reach and stimulate performance demand. 

I have also built up a significant amount of goodwill and a good network in the music industry, this will go a long way in assisting me to see the completion and release of this project.

I am really grateful for your interest in this fundraising campaign! If you are unable to contribute funding to this campaign, no need to fret!:-)

 Your assistance in spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your friends and family is equally valuable and will be much appreciated! 

Much love,

Spha

story:
The Music

Covers of fifteen protest songs from fifteen outstanding bands including:

  • FIRES covering Bad Religion's "American Jesus"
  • Society Burning covering Buffalo Springfield's "For What It's Worth"
  • Die Robot covering Credence Clearwater Revival's "Fortunate Son"
  • Deconbrio covering Genesis' "Land of Confusion"
  • Photona covering Iron Maiden's "Run to the Hills"
  • Demons Needs Angels covering John Lennon's "Imagine"
  • Slighter covering Midnight Oil's "Beds Are Burning"
  • Out Out covering Peter Gabriel's "Biko"
  • Chemlab covering The Pixies' "Monkey Gone To Heaven"
  • SMP covering Public Enemy's "Fight The Power"
  • Dead Animal Assembly Plant covering Pop Will Eat Itself's "Ich Bin Ein Auslander"
  • Caustic covering The Clash's "The Guns of Brixton"
  • WORM covering The Temptations' "Ball of Confusion"
  • File Transfer Protocol covering The Who's "My Generation"
  • Kill Minus Nine covering U2's "Sunday Bloody Sunday"

What We Need & What You Get

This compilation will only be available through the indiegogo campaign.  It will not be available through streaming platforms or any other music sales service.

  • We are looking to secure enough pre-orders to fund $1,200 for the initial run and to cover the cost of licenses for the release and production of art and CDs.
  • We are offering digital downloads as well as 4 panel digipak CD
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still produce the compilation in the quantity we have funds to cover.
  • Our goal is to release the album on President's Day, February 18th, 2019

The Impact you will have

Protests are about making our world better.  That's no exception here.  The proceeds from the sale of this release will be given to The Family Tree, which helps victims of Domestic Violence, Homelessness and Child Abuse & Neglect.

  • https://www.thefamilytree.org/

Risks & Challenges

The bands have about two months to finish up their cover song and get it to us. They are all professionals and we are confident we will stay on schedule.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time, we welcome your support.  You can help by:

  • Sharing news about our campaign with your friends and people who may enjoy this music.

Oh, and remember, a physical CD copy makes a great gift!

story:
Hi! I'm Stephen Webb and I have a story to share.

Through many years of struggling with my faith, struggling to cling to hope, and remembering I am worthy and have always been loved I have come to a place where I believe God is asking me to start sharing my heart and creativity for Him.

In about 3 weeks I plan to spread a Christmas message of Hope, Healing, and Mystery through a unique arrangement of the classic carol "Oh Holy Night" set to a moving and emotional music video. I am asking for partners to help that happen!

There is so much that Christmas is all about to us in our modern society. Sometimes the reason we celebrate gets confused or forgotten. I hope to share what Christmas means to me and share it with as many people as possible while giving God the glory for what He did for us all. 

I don't know what God wants to come of this, but I do know that He has placed this on my heart and if only one person is touched or healed in some way then I know it was worth it. I hope you choose be a part of that!

I am seeking only $3,500 to start!

This amount will completely cover the cost of the professional audio recording and the production of the music video. If you know anything about the music industry you'll know this is A STEAL and hard to believe. Any extra funds will be used to make the video even better, more dynamic, and help curb marketing costs!

Contribute $5 and get an advanced download of the track.

Contribute $50 and you'll get a special thanks in the credits of the music video!

Contribute $100 and get a special video thanks with me singing a song for you!

Contribute $1000 and get a private performance of Oh Holy Night and select carols in your home for family and friends. (If not local to Salt Lake City must have 2 weeks advanced scheduling. If Christmas doesn't work we'll find some other songs for a later to do to perform for you!)

 

The exciting part is that this project has the potential for global impact!

As you know when Christmas time comes around videos and songs get shared like crazy when everyone is in the Christmas spirit. My hope and vision is that all those who contribute and even those that can't will share this to all of their friends and family on social media, email, word of mouth, carrier pigeon, owl, you name it... 

The more people reached in this world the more impact this music and story has the potential to make. 

I really hope you enjoy the music, the video, and the story. I pray it touches you and inspires you to reach deep within and discover the gifts God has given. I pray it can be blessing to all those in need of spiritual and emotional nourishment. God bless you and have a Merry Christmas!!

story:
UPDATE

» Click this link to view Round 2 of Indiegogo funding for my upcoming EP!

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

The Project 

The finished product will be a professionally recorded and produced 5 song album (EP) made here in Nashville. The album should be available by September 2019, if not sooner, in both digital and hard copy (CD) formats.  

STEP 1 (completed)

This project started several years ago as I began to develop and discover my own unique voice as a singer/songwriter. I am so passionate about what I have created, and I believe the five songs I have chosen for the studio are ready for the next step.

STEP 2 (completed)

Having good songs comes first, but putting them in the hands of the right producer is not only the next move but extremely important to the integrity of the music.

Through months of searching and networking here in Music City, I have met many great and talented producers. However, it was just recently that I connected with the perfect producer and studio for this project. His name is Misa, and his team includes Ryan (a sound engineering genius) plus an awesome group of world-class session musicians. 

I know these guys will get the vibe just right. Btw, if you follow along on the journey, I will introduce them to you! Now, that leads us to...

STEP 3

This step is the BIGGEST one of all and why I need your help. Step three is the actual recording process, which entails far more than just recording. After the recording is done, including my vocal parts, there is still much work left to do in the studio to get the songs sounding and feeling juuuuust right. And juuuuust right costs a few $$$.

STEP 4

After all the songs are recorded, mixed and mastered, they will need to be properly distributed and promoted. Although this can take a while, I am already making some strategical moves in advance so that I can release the songs at the right time. Staying on schedule is key here.

Where the Funds Go

Your contribution, think of it like a pre-order, will allow me to record an original EP and will cover the following costs:

  • Studio Time
  • Pre/Post Production 
  • Studio Musicians 
  • Mixing & Mastering
  • Distribution
  • Promotion

What You Get 

To reward your generous giving, I have created some unique gifts to send to you. And for those who just want to hear the tunes and feel the vibes, I have perks for you as well!

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Follow me on social media for news, updates, and memes.
  2. Please share this campaign with your friends and family because sharing is caring!
  3. Although this campaign (Round 1) has officially closed, you can still contribute to Round 2 of funding by visiting this link: https://igg.me/at/kimberlyatwood/x/20305875#/
