story:
Short Summary

My name is Eliza and I go by the artist alias E-Turn (FKA Eternity). I'm a singer and an MC based in Orlando, FL and I've been performing for close to 15 years now. I've known since I was a kid that music was my calling. For as long as I can remember, my voice and my words have been a bridge to self-expression. My parents told me a story that always stuck with me. When I was 2 years old, I had a febrile seizure and was taken to the hospital. They treated me and I fell asleep. As soon as I woke up, I started happily singing, as if nothing happened. This story sticks with me and is one of the thoughts that come into my head when hurdles hit my path. Fast forward, I have been part of a creative collective based in Orlando called "Second Subject" for about 8 years now and it has been such a blessing to my creative journey. The artists involved have pushed me to be better, off their talent alone. My crew eventually afforded me the connection to Fake Four and now, I am feeling more hopeful about my career than I ever have. I feel like when you're writing a "short" summary, it can be difficult to capture the whole journey and it almost makes it sound easy. Like, "this happened, then this, then..voila!" Let me just tell you, this has been so damn far from easy. I have put in countless hours, to the point that I had to check myself and make sure I was taking care of myself properly because my health was declining. I see my progress but it is a slow and taxing process. That's why many people give up. They burn out. It is a ruthless endeavor. But I'm still here and I understand how important it is for me to NOT give up. I'm about to embark on my first European tour in March and I am so incredibly grateful. Being that it's my first official tour out there, I'm not making big bucks. By funding this project, you will not only help bring the record to life, you will help me sustain myself on the road so I can continue share this album with people all over the world. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $3500. There are a ton of cool perks you can choose from and a bunch of different bundle varieties. There are also exclusive items that will only be available through this Indiegogo. Be one of the first to own Young World on vinyl, but not just regular ol' vinyl...a dope ass 12" picture disc! 

NOTE: All perks that include vinyl will come with the same vinyl. Different photos are simply to show different angles of the record. 

The Impact

I discussed some of the impact earlier but what's more, I feel like Young World has the potential to raise standards for women in Hip Hop and by expanding it's platform, we continue to solidify it's stance. By backing this project, you not only get to experience the record through such a classic listening medium, you are also supporting the roots of our culture, supporting the evolution of our culture, as well as supporting an indie label and artist who devote their lives to this. You are so important to keeping us going. And at the end of the day, you help my artistry thrive, which can ultimately help others to thrive.

Risks & Challenges

As an indie artist, I'm sure many of you know, money is one of the biggest hurdles. Being able to fund everything without those major label numbers is not an easy feat. We continue to take risks though, because we know our calling and will stop at nothing to make it work. We rely on those who believe in us and benefit from our art to help us push through. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help...

You can also help us by spreading the word! 

I love you all and thank you so much for taking the time to read this. Let's get it!

My parents told me a story that always stuck with me. When I was 2 years old, I had a febrile seizure and was taken to the hospital. They treated me and I fell asleep. As soon as I woke up, I started happily singing, as if nothing happened. This story sticks with me and is one of the thoughts that come into my head when hurdles hit my path. Fast forward, I have been part of a creative collective based in Orlando called "Second Subject" for about 8 years now and it has been such a blessing to my creative journey. The artists involved have pushed me to be better, off their talent alone. My crew eventually afforded me the connection to Fake Four and now, I am feeling more hopeful about my career than I ever have. I feel like when you're writing a "short" summary, it can be difficult to capture the whole journey and it almost makes it sound easy. Like, "this happened, then this, then..voila!" Let me just tell you, this has been so damn far from easy. I have put in countless hours, to the point that I had to check myself and make sure I was taking care of myself properly because my health was declining. I see my progress but it is a slow and taxing process. That's why many people give up. They burn out. It is a ruthless endeavor. But I'm still here and I understand how important it is for me to NOT give up. I'm about to embark on my first European tour in March and I am so incredibly grateful. Being that it's my first official tour out there, I'm not making big bucks. By funding this project, you will not only help bring the record to life, you will help me sustain myself on the road so I can continue share this album with people all over the world. 

What We Need & What You Get
We need to raise $3500. There are a ton of cool perks you can choose from and a bunch of different bundle varieties. There are also exclusive items that will only be available through this Indiegogo. Be one of the first to own Young World on vinyl, but not just regular ol' vinyl...a dope ass 12" picture disc! 
NOTE: All perks that include vinyl will come with the same vinyl. Different photos are simply to show different angles of the record. 

The Impact
I discussed some of the impact earlier but what's more, I feel like Young World has the potential to raise standards for women in Hip Hop and by expanding it's platform, we continue to solidify it's stance. By backing this project, you not only get to experience the record through such a classic listening medium, you are also supporting the roots of our culture, supporting the evolution of our culture, as well as supporting an indie label and artist who devote their lives to this. You are so important to keeping us going. And at the end of the day, you help my artistry thrive, which can ultimately help others to thrive.
Risks & Challenges
As an indie artist, I'm sure many of you know, money is one of the biggest hurdles. Being able to fund everything without those major label numbers is not an easy feat. We continue to take risks though, because we know our calling and will stop at nothing to make it work. We rely on those who believe in us and benefit from our art to help us push through. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help...
You can also help us by spreading the word! 
I love you all and thank you so much for taking the time to read this. Let's get it!

story:
I started to write my first album four years ago, and after countless months in the studio with my team my debut EP  is ready to come to light. 

We are about half-way through finishing the record. It's taken many hands and countless people contributing their whole selves to make it happen! The first single will be released this July, the EP HEART will be released this September, and the entire album will make its debut winter of 2020. 

Every moment that went into making HEART came from a honest, vulnerable place, and it's a gift to share it with you..I can't wait for the record to be yours. To promote and create visibility that can be seen by many people, I’m kindly asking for your generous financial support. 

Where does the money go? Great question! 

— To finish the six songs left on my album winter 2020. The funds raised will go towards hiring the musicians, engineers, producers, and the fees for using the recording studio. 

— Hiring promoters who work to get the first half of the album (the EP) on Spotify playlists, Pandora, college radio, Sirius XM, etc. They’re the ones on the road talking about the music and marketing it. 

— Hiring a social media team who work alongside the promoters to create visibility that they continue to build and sustain before, during and after the album is released. 

— Filming and producing the music videos for my first two singles.

— Photoshoot for album cover shot: Hiring team.

— A publicist to promote my current and future shows. This person will also help book shows and create buzz. 

— Hiring an in-store indie retailer to put my EP into 85,000 retail locations including, cafes, airports, restaurants, etc. 

— Helping fund Emily Rose and her band's FIRST TOUR this coming winter 2020.

I am privileged and incredibly blessed to be given this opportunity to pursue my dream. I thank you all in advance for contributing anything you can to make that dream a reality! 

Here is a sneak peak of two of the singles we will be releasing this fall. with your help.

https://soundcloud.com/emilyrose-keating/daddy

https://soundcloud.com/emilyrose-keating/no-1

Look ahead to see the great perks and rewards you will receive for generously donating.

Love,

Emily Rose

story:
Luminous Emptiness

In early 2018 we ran a crowdfunding campaign for our Luminous Emptiness album. The huge success of the campaign enabled us to devote our time and energy to develop and record the music for the project, but also for so much more.

Your support helped us create music videos which were filmed in incredible locations across India, all of which can be found on our YouTube channel. We also recorded amazing visuals to complement the new music, and set off on the Luminous Emptiness Tour which has now been seen in over 30 countries, and continues to be enjoyed by audiences worldwide.

Continuing the momentum

It feels great to continue this powerful momentum and create more music, more visuals and more magical vibes. We love crowdfunding campaigns not only because they serve as a financial support but also as they are a great way to share and promote the new music and to connect with so many people around the world. 

Now is the perfect time to start a new album!

Your support

By contributing to this campaign, you support the production expenses for our upcoming album. These expenses include:

  • renting studio time 
  • hiring professional audio wizards for recording, mixing and mastering
  • developing album artwork
  • producing physical copies of the album, and
  • many other extras along the way.


In return, you will receive the perk (or perks) you choose.

Thank you

Thank you for supporting us, our music and the continuation of what we are doing. It is a joy for us to create music that is enjoyed by people all over the world. It is a privilege we honour deeply. 

If you feel moved, we invite you to share our campaign with your friends and family.
